See https://plot.ly/settings for more details. number 0 10000 500 info calc Sets the maximum number of points to keep on the plots from an incoming stream. If `maxpoints` is set to *50*, only the newest 50 points will be displayed on the plot. calc object calc An array of operations that manipulate the trace data, for example filtering or sorting the data arrays. object object any info none Controls persistence of some user-driven changes to the trace: `constraintrange` in `parcoords` traces, as well as some `editable: true` modifications such as `name` and `colorbar.title`. Defaults to `layout.uirevision`. Note that other user-driven trace attribute changes are controlled by `layout` attributes: `trace.visible` is controlled by `layout.legend.uirevision`, `selectedpoints` is controlled by `layout.selectionrevision`, and `colorbar.(x|y)` (accessible with `config: {editable: true}`) is controlled by `layout.editrevision`. Trace changes are tracked by `uid`, which only falls back on trace index if no `uid` is provided. So if your app can add/remove traces before the end of the `data` array, such that the same trace has a different index, you can still preserve user-driven changes if you give each trace a `uid` that stays with it as it moves. data_array calc Sets the labels of each of the sunburst sectors. data data_array calc Sets the parent sectors for each of the sunburst sectors. Empty string items '' are understood to reference the root node in the hierarchy. If `ids` is filled, `parents` items are understood to be "ids" themselves. When `ids` is not set, plotly attempts to find matching items in `labels`, but beware they must be unique. data data_array calc Sets the values associated with each of the sunburst sectors. Use with `branchvalues` to determine how the values are summed. data enumerated remainder remainder calc info Determines how the items in `values` are summed. When set to *total*, items in `values` are taken to be value of all its descendants. When set to *remainder*, items in `values` corresponding to the root and the branches sectors are taken to be the extra part not part of the sum of the values at their leaves. any plot info Sets the level from which this sunburst trace hierarchy is rendered. Set `level` to `''` to start the sunburst from the root node in the hierarchy. Must be an "id" if `ids` is filled in, otherwise plotly attempts to find a matching item in `labels`. integer plot info -1 Sets the number of rendered sunburst rings from any given `level`. Set `maxdepth` to *-1* to render all the levels in the hierarchy. data_array calc Sets the color of each sector of this sunburst chart. If not specified, the default trace color set is used to pick the sector colors. data color style TRUE style Sets the color of the line enclosing each sector. Defaults to the `paper_bgcolor` value. number style 0 1 TRUE style Sets the width (in px) of the line enclosing each sector. calc object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for color . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for width . none calc object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for colors . none number style style 0 1 0.7 Sets the opacity of the leaves. plot object data_array calc Sets text elements associated with each sector. If trace `textinfo` contains a *text* flag, these elements will be seen on the chart. If trace `hoverinfo` contains a *text* flag and *hovertext* is not set, these elements will be seen in the hover labels. data flaglist info label none plot Determines which trace information appear on the graph. string style TRUE TRUE calc HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. TRUE number style 1 calc TRUE color style plot TRUE calc Sets the font used for `textinfo`. object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for family . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for size . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for color . none string info TRUE style Sets hover text elements associated with each sector. If a single string, the same string appears for all data points. If an array of string, the items are mapped in order of this trace's sectors. To be seen, trace `hoverinfo` must contain a *text* flag. flaglist info label all TRUE all none Determines which trace information appear on hover. If `none` or `skip` are set, no information is displayed upon hovering. But, if `none` is set, click and hover events are still fired. string info none Template string used for rendering the information that appear on hover box. Note that this will override `hoverinfo`. Variables are inserted using %{variable}, for example "y: %{y}". Numbers are formatted using d3-format's syntax %{variable:d3-format}, for example "Price: %{y:$.2f}". See https://github.com/d3/d3-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format for details on the formatting syntax. The variables available in `hovertemplate` are the ones emitted as event data described at this link https://plot.ly/javascript/plotlyjs-events/#event-data. Additionally, every attributes that can be specified per-point (the ones that are `arrayOk: true`) are available. Anything contained in tag `<extra>` is displayed in the secondary box, for example "<extra>{fullData.name}</extra>". To hide the secondary box completely, use an empty tag `<extra></extra>`. TRUE string style TRUE TRUE calc HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. TRUE number style 1 calc TRUE color style plot TRUE calc Sets the font used for `textinfo` lying inside the pie. object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for family . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for size . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for color . none string style TRUE TRUE calc HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. TRUE number style 1 calc TRUE color style plot TRUE calc Sets the font used for `textinfo` lying outside the pie. object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for family . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for size . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for color . none info_array info calc number 0 1 calc 0 Sets the horizontal domain of this sunburst trace (in plot fraction). info_array info calc number 0 1 calc 0 Sets the vertical domain of this sunburst trace (in plot fraction). calc integer 0 0 info calc If there is a layout grid, use the domain for this row in the grid for this sunburst trace . integer 0 0 info calc If there is a layout grid, use the domain for this column in the grid for this sunburst trace . object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for ids . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for customdata . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for labels . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for parents . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for values . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for text . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for hovertext . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for hoverinfo . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for hovertemplate . none colorlist style calc Sets the default sunburst slice colors. Defaults to the main `colorway` used for trace colors. If you specify a new list here it can still be extended with lighter and darker colors, see `extendsunburstcolors`. boolean TRUE style calc If `true`, the sunburst slice colors (whether given by `sunburstcolorway` or inherited from `colorway`) will be extended to three times its original length by first repeating every color 20% lighter then each color 20% darker. This is intended to reduce the likelihood of reusing the same color when you have many slices, but you can set `false` to disable. Colors provided in the trace, using `marker.colors`, are never extended. scatter_3d The data visualized as scatter point or lines in 3D dimension is set in `x`, `y`, `z`. Text (appearing either on the chart or on hover only) is via `text`. Bubble charts are achieved by setting `marker.size` and/or `marker.color` Projections are achieved via `projection`. Surface fills are achieved via `surfaceaxis`. scatter3d enumerated TRUE info TRUE calc Determines whether or not this trace is visible. If *legendonly*, the trace is not drawn, but can appear as a legend item (provided that the legend itself is visible). boolean info TRUE style Determines whether or not an item corresponding to this trace is shown in the legend. string info style Sets the legend group for this trace. Traces part of the same legend group hide/show at the same time when toggling legend items. number style 0 1 1 style Sets the opacity of the trace. string info style Sets the trace name. The trace name appear as the legend item and on hover. string info plot TRUE Assign an id to this trace, Use this to provide object constancy between traces during animations and transitions. data_array calc TRUE Assigns id labels to each datum. These ids for object constancy of data points during animation. Should be an array of strings, not numbers or any other type. data data_array calc Assigns extra data each datum. This may be useful when listening to hover, click and selection events. Note that, *scatter* traces also appends customdata items in the markers DOM elements data any info calc Array containing integer indices of selected points. Has an effect only for traces that support selections. Note that an empty array means an empty selection where the `unselected` are turned on for all points, whereas, any other non-array values means no selection all where the `selected` and `unselected` styles have no effect. color style TRUE none Sets the background color of the hover labels for this trace color style TRUE none Sets the border color of the hover labels for this trace. string style TRUE TRUE none HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. TRUE number style 1 none TRUE color style none TRUE none Sets the font used in hover labels. object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for family . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for size . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for color . none integer -1 TRUE style none Sets the length (in number of characters) of the trace name in the hover labels for this trace. -1 shows the whole name regardless of length. 0-3 shows the first 0-3 characters, and an integer >3 will show the whole name if it is less than that many characters, but if it is longer, will truncate to `namelength - 3` characters and add an ellipsis. calc object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for bgcolor . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for bordercolor . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for namelength . none string TRUE TRUE info calc The stream id number links a data trace on a plot with a stream. See https://plot.ly/settings for more details. number 0 10000 500 info calc Sets the maximum number of points to keep on the plots from an incoming stream. If `maxpoints` is set to *50*, only the newest 50 points will be displayed on the plot. calc object calc An array of operations that manipulate the trace data, for example filtering or sorting the data arrays. object object any info none Controls persistence of some user-driven changes to the trace: `constraintrange` in `parcoords` traces, as well as some `editable: true` modifications such as `name` and `colorbar.title`. Defaults to `layout.uirevision`. Note that other user-driven trace attribute changes are controlled by `layout` attributes: `trace.visible` is controlled by `layout.legend.uirevision`, `selectedpoints` is controlled by `layout.selectionrevision`, and `colorbar.(x|y)` (accessible with `config: {editable: true}`) is controlled by `layout.editrevision`. Trace changes are tracked by `uid`, which only falls back on trace index if no `uid` is provided. So if your app can add/remove traces before the end of the `data` array, such that the same trace has a different index, you can still preserve user-driven changes if you give each trace a `uid` that stays with it as it moves. data_array calc+clearAxisTypes TRUE Sets the x coordinates. data data_array calc+clearAxisTypes TRUE Sets the y coordinates. data data_array Sets the z coordinates. calc+clearAxisTypes data string info TRUE calc Sets text elements associated with each (x,y,z) triplet. If a single string, the same string appears over all the data points. If an array of string, the items are mapped in order to the this trace's (x,y,z) coordinates. If trace `hoverinfo` contains a *text* flag and *hovertext* is not set, these elements will be seen in the hover labels. string info TRUE calc Sets text elements associated with each (x,y,z) triplet. If a single string, the same string appears over all the data points. If an array of string, the items are mapped in order to the this trace's (x,y,z) coordinates. To be seen, trace `hoverinfo` must contain a *text* flag. string info calc Template string used for rendering the information that appear on hover box. Note that this will override `hoverinfo`. Variables are inserted using %{variable}, for example "y: %{y}". Numbers are formatted using d3-format's syntax %{variable:d3-format}, for example "Price: %{y:$.2f}". See https://github.com/d3/d3-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format for details on the formatting syntax. The variables available in `hovertemplate` are the ones emitted as event data described at this link https://plot.ly/javascript/plotlyjs-events/#event-data. Additionally, every attributes that can be specified per-point (the ones that are `arrayOk: true`) are available. Anything contained in tag `<extra>` is displayed in the secondary box, for example "<extra>{fullData.name}</extra>". To hide the secondary box completely, use an empty tag `<extra></extra>`. TRUE flaglist lines none info calc Determines the drawing mode for this scatter trace. If the provided `mode` includes *text* then the `text` elements appear at the coordinates. Otherwise, the `text` elements appear on hover. If there are less than 20 points and the trace is not stacked then the default is *lines+markers*. Otherwise, *lines*. lines+markers enumerated info -1 -1 If *-1*, the scatter points are not fill with a surface If *0*, *1*, *2*, the scatter points are filled with a Delaunay surface about the x, y, z respectively. calc color style Sets the surface fill color. calc boolean info FALSE Sets whether or not projections are shown along the x axis. calc number style 0 1 1 Sets the projection color. calc number style 0 10 0.666666666666667 Sets the scale factor determining the size of the projection marker points. calc calc object boolean info FALSE Sets whether or not projections are shown along the y axis. calc number style 0 1 1 Sets the projection color. calc number style 0 10 0.666666666666667 Sets the scale factor determining the size of the projection marker points. calc calc object boolean info FALSE Sets whether or not projections are shown along the z axis. calc number style 0 1 1 Sets the projection color. calc number style 0 10 0.666666666666667 Sets the scale factor determining the size of the projection marker points. calc calc object calc object boolean FALSE info calc Determines whether or not gaps (i.e. {nan} or missing values) in the provided data arrays are connected. number 0 2 style calc TRUE Sets the line width (in px). enumerated solid solid style Sets the dash style of the lines. calc color TRUE style calc Sets thelinecolor. It accepts either a specific color or an array of numbers that are mapped to the colorscale relative to the max and min values of the array or relative to `line.cmin` and `line.cmax` if set. boolean info TRUE calc Determines whether or not the color domain is computed with respect to the input data (here in `line.color`) or the bounds set in `line.cmin` and `line.cmax` Has an effect only if in `line.color`is set to a numerical array. Defaults to `false` when `line.cmin` and `line.cmax` are set by the user. number info calc FALSE Sets the lower bound of the color domain. Has an effect only if in `line.color`is set to a numerical array. Value should have the same units as in `line.color` and if set, `line.cmax` must be set as well. number info calc FALSE Sets the upper bound of the color domain. Has an effect only if in `line.color`is set to a numerical array. Value should have the same units as in `line.color` and if set, `line.cmin` must be set as well. number info calc Sets the mid-point of the color domain by scaling `line.cmin` and/or `line.cmax` to be equidistant to this point. Has an effect only if in `line.color`is set to a numerical array. Value should have the same units as in `line.color`. Has no effect when `line.cauto` is `false`. colorscale style calc FALSE Sets the colorscale. Has an effect only if in `line.color`is set to a numerical array. The colorscale must be an array containing arrays mapping a normalized value to an rgb, rgba, hex, hsl, hsv, or named color string. At minimum, a mapping for the lowest (0) and highest (1) values are required. For example, `[[0, 'rgb(0,0,255)', [1, 'rgb(255,0,0)']]`. To control the bounds of the colorscale in color space, use`line.cmin` and `line.cmax`. Alternatively, `colorscale` may be a palette name string of the following list: Greys,YlGnBu,Greens,YlOrRd,Bluered,RdBu,Reds,Blues,Picnic,Rainbow,Portland,Jet,Hot,Blackbody,Earth,Electric,Viridis,Cividis. boolean style TRUE calc Determines whether the colorscale is a default palette (`autocolorscale: true`) or the palette determined by `line.colorscale`. Has an effect only if in `line.color`is set to a numerical array. In case `colorscale` is unspecified or `autocolorscale` is true, the default palette will be chosen according to whether numbers in the `color` array are all positive, all negative or mixed. boolean style FALSE calc Reverses the color mapping if true. Has an effect only if in `line.color`is set to a numerical array. If true, `line.cmin` will correspond to the last color in the array and `line.cmax` will correspond to the first color. boolean info FALSE calc Determines whether or not a colorbar is displayed for this trace. Has an effect only if in `line.color`is set to a numerical array. calc object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for color . none enumerated circle style circle TRUE Sets the marker symbol type. calc number 0 8 TRUE style calc TRUE Sets the marker size (in px). number 1 style calc Has an effect only if `marker.size` is set to a numerical array. Sets the scale factor used to determine the rendered size of marker points. Use with `sizemin` and `sizemode`. number 0 0 style calc Has an effect only if `marker.size` is set to a numerical array. Sets the minimum size (in px) of the rendered marker points. enumerated diameter diameter info calc Has an effect only if `marker.size` is set to a numerical array. Sets the rule for which the data in `size` is converted to pixels. number 0 1 FALSE style calc TRUE Sets the marker opacity. Note that the marker opacity for scatter3d traces must be a scalar value for performance reasons. To set a blending opacity value (i.e. which is not transparent), set *marker.color* to an rgba color and use its alpha channel. enumerated fraction style pixels Determines whether this color bar's thickness (i.e. the measure in the constant color direction) is set in units of plot *fraction* or in *pixels*. Use `thickness` to set the value. calc number style 0 30 Sets the thickness of the color bar This measure excludes the size of the padding, ticks and labels. calc enumerated fraction info fraction Determines whether this color bar's length (i.e. the measure in the color variation direction) is set in units of plot *fraction* or in *pixels. Use `len` to set the value. calc number 0 1 style Sets the length of the color bar This measure excludes the padding of both ends. That is, the color bar length is this length minus the padding on both ends. calc number 1.02 -2 3 style Sets the x position of the color bar (in plot fraction). calc enumerated left left style Sets this color bar's horizontal position anchor. This anchor binds the `x` position to the *left*, *center* or *right* of the color bar. calc number style 0 10 Sets the amount of padding (in px) along the x direction. calc number style 0.5 -2 3 Sets the y position of the color bar (in plot fraction). calc enumerated top style middle Sets this color bar's vertical position anchor This anchor binds the `y` position to the *top*, *middle* or *bottom* of the color bar. calc number style 0 10 Sets the amount of padding (in px) along the y direction. calc color #444 style calc Sets the axis line color. number 0 1 style calc Sets the width (in px) of the axis line. color #444 style calc Sets the axis line color. number style 0 0 Sets the width (in px) or the border enclosing this color bar. calc color style rgba(0,0,0,0) Sets the color of padded area. calc enumerated auto info calc Sets the tick mode for this axis. If *auto*, the number of ticks is set via `nticks`. If *linear*, the placement of the ticks is determined by a starting position `tick0` and a tick step `dtick` (*linear* is the default value if `tick0` and `dtick` are provided). If *array*, the placement of the ticks is set via `tickvals` and the tick text is `ticktext`. (*array* is the default value if `tickvals` is provided). integer 0 0 style calc Specifies the maximum number of ticks for the particular axis. The actual number of ticks will be chosen automatically to be less than or equal to `nticks`. Has an effect only if `tickmode` is set to *auto*. any style calc linear Sets the placement of the first tick on this axis. Use with `dtick`. If the axis `type` is *log*, then you must take the log of your starting tick (e.g. to set the starting tick to 100, set the `tick0` to 2) except when `dtick`=*L<f>* (see `dtick` for more info). If the axis `type` is *date*, it should be a date string, like date data. If the axis `type` is *category*, it should be a number, using the scale where each category is assigned a serial number from zero in the order it appears. any style calc linear Sets the step in-between ticks on this axis. Use with `tick0`. Must be a positive number, or special strings available to *log* and *date* axes. If the axis `type` is *log*, then ticks are set every 10^(n*dtick) where n is the tick number. For example, to set a tick mark at 1, 10, 100, 1000, ... set dtick to 1. To set tick marks at 1, 100, 10000, ... set dtick to 2. To set tick marks at 1, 5, 25, 125, 625, 3125, ... set dtick to log_10(5), or 0.69897000433. *log* has several special values; *L<f>*, where `f` is a positive number, gives ticks linearly spaced in value (but not position). For example `tick0` = 0.1, `dtick` = *L0.5* will put ticks at 0.1, 0.6, 1.1, 1.6 etc. To show powers of 10 plus small digits between, use *D1* (all digits) or *D2* (only 2 and 5). `tick0` is ignored for *D1* and *D2*. If the axis `type` is *date*, then you must convert the time to milliseconds. For example, to set the interval between ticks to one day, set `dtick` to 86400000.0. *date* also has special values *M<n>* gives ticks spaced by a number of months. `n` must be a positive integer. To set ticks on the 15th of every third month, set `tick0` to *2000-01-15* and `dtick` to *M3*. To set ticks every 4 years, set `dtick` to *M48* data_array calc Sets the values at which ticks on this axis appear. Only has an effect if `tickmode` is set to *array*. Used with `ticktext`. data data_array calc Sets the text displayed at the ticks position via `tickvals`. Only has an effect if `tickmode` is set to *array*. Used with `tickvals`. data enumerated outside style calc Determines whether ticks are drawn or not. If **, this axis' ticks are not drawn. If *outside* (*inside*), this axis' are drawn outside (inside) the axis lines. number 0 5 style calc Sets the tick length (in px). number 0 1 style calc Sets the tick width (in px). color #444 style calc Sets the tick color. boolean TRUE style calc Determines whether or not the tick labels are drawn. string style TRUE TRUE HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. calc number style 1 calc color style calc Sets the color bar's tick label font calc object angle auto style calc Sets the angle of the tick labels with respect to the horizontal. For example, a `tickangle` of -90 draws the tick labels vertically. string style calc Sets the tick label formatting rule using d3 formatting mini-languages which are very similar to those in Python. For numbers, see: https://github.com/d3/d3-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format And for dates see: https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format We add one item to d3's date formatter: *%{n}f* for fractional seconds with n digits. For example, *2016-10-13 09:15:23.456* with tickformat *%H~%M~%S.%2f* would display *09~15~23.46* boolean info TRUE calc Determines whether or not this stop is used. If `false`, this stop is ignored even within its `dtickrange`. info_array info any calc calc range [*min*, *max*], where *min*, *max* - dtick values which describe some zoom level, it is possible to omit *min* or *max* value by passing *null* string style calc string - dtickformat for described zoom level, the same as *tickformat* calc string style calc When used in a template, named items are created in the output figure in addition to any items the figure already has in this array. You can modify these items in the output figure by making your own item with `templateitemname` matching this `name` alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). Has no effect outside of a template. string info calc Used to refer to a named item in this array in the template. Named items from the template will be created even without a matching item in the input figure, but you can modify one by making an item with `templateitemname` matching its `name`, alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). If there is no template or no matching item, this item will be hidden unless you explicitly show it with `visible: true`. object object string style calc Sets a tick label prefix. enumerated all all style calc If *all*, all tick labels are displayed with a prefix. If *first*, only the first tick is displayed with a prefix. If *last*, only the last tick is displayed with a suffix. If *none*, tick prefixes are hidden. string style calc Sets a tick label suffix. enumerated all all style calc Same as `showtickprefix` but for tick suffixes. boolean FALSE style calc If "true", even 4-digit integers are separated enumerated none B style calc Determines a formatting rule for the tick exponents. For example, consider the number 1,000,000,000. If *none*, it appears as 1,000,000,000. If *e*, 1e+9. If *E*, 1E+9. If *power*, 1x10^9 (with 9 in a super script). If *SI*, 1G. If *B*, 1B. enumerated all all style calc If *all*, all exponents are shown besides their significands. If *first*, only the exponent of the first tick is shown. If *last*, only the exponent of the last tick is shown. If *none*, no exponents appear. string info Sets the title of the color bar. Note that before the existence of `title.text`, the title's contents used to be defined as the `title` attribute itself. This behavior has been deprecated. calc string style TRUE TRUE HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. calc number style 1 calc color style calc Sets this color bar's title font. Note that the title's location used to be set by the now deprecated `titleside` attribute. calc calc object string info Deprecated in favor of color bar's `title.text`. Note that value of color bar's `title` is no longer a simple *string* but a set of sub-attributes. calc string style TRUE TRUE HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. calc number style 1 calc color style calc Deprecated in favor of color bar's `title.font`. calc enumerated right style top Deprecated in favor of color bar's `title.side`. calc calc object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for tickvals . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for ticktext . none number 0 FALSE style calc TRUE Sets the width (in px) of the lines bounding the marker points. color TRUE style calc Sets themarker.linecolor. It accepts either a specific color or an array of numbers that are mapped to the colorscale relative to the max and min values of the array or relative to `marker.line.cmin` and `marker.line.cmax` if set. boolean info TRUE calc Determines whether or not the color domain is computed with respect to the input data (here in `marker.line.color`) or the bounds set in `marker.line.cmin` and `marker.line.cmax` Has an effect only if in `marker.line.color`is set to a numerical array. Defaults to `false` when `marker.line.cmin` and `marker.line.cmax` are set by the user. number info calc FALSE Sets the lower bound of the color domain. Has an effect only if in `marker.line.color`is set to a numerical array. Value should have the same units as in `marker.line.color` and if set, `marker.line.cmax` must be set as well. number info calc FALSE Sets the upper bound of the color domain. Has an effect only if in `marker.line.color`is set to a numerical array. Value should have the same units as in `marker.line.color` and if set, `marker.line.cmin` must be set as well. number info calc Sets the mid-point of the color domain by scaling `marker.line.cmin` and/or `marker.line.cmax` to be equidistant to this point. Has an effect only if in `marker.line.color`is set to a numerical array. Value should have the same units as in `marker.line.color`. Has no effect when `marker.line.cauto` is `false`. colorscale style calc FALSE Sets the colorscale. Has an effect only if in `marker.line.color`is set to a numerical array. The colorscale must be an array containing arrays mapping a normalized value to an rgb, rgba, hex, hsl, hsv, or named color string. At minimum, a mapping for the lowest (0) and highest (1) values are required. For example, `[[0, 'rgb(0,0,255)', [1, 'rgb(255,0,0)']]`. To control the bounds of the colorscale in color space, use`marker.line.cmin` and `marker.line.cmax`. Alternatively, `colorscale` may be a palette name string of the following list: Greys,YlGnBu,Greens,YlOrRd,Bluered,RdBu,Reds,Blues,Picnic,Rainbow,Portland,Jet,Hot,Blackbody,Earth,Electric,Viridis,Cividis. boolean style TRUE calc Determines whether the colorscale is a default palette (`autocolorscale: true`) or the palette determined by `marker.line.colorscale`. Has an effect only if in `marker.line.color`is set to a numerical array. In case `colorscale` is unspecified or `autocolorscale` is true, the default palette will be chosen according to whether numbers in the `color` array are all positive, all negative or mixed. boolean style FALSE calc Reverses the color mapping if true. Has an effect only if in `marker.line.color`is set to a numerical array. If true, `marker.line.cmin` will correspond to the last color in the array and `marker.line.cmax` will correspond to the first color. calc object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for color . none color TRUE style calc Sets themarkercolor. It accepts either a specific color or an array of numbers that are mapped to the colorscale relative to the max and min values of the array or relative to `marker.cmin` and `marker.cmax` if set. boolean info TRUE calc Determines whether or not the color domain is computed with respect to the input data (here in `marker.color`) or the bounds set in `marker.cmin` and `marker.cmax` Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. Defaults to `false` when `marker.cmin` and `marker.cmax` are set by the user. number info calc FALSE Sets the lower bound of the color domain. Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. Value should have the same units as in `marker.color` and if set, `marker.cmax` must be set as well. number info calc FALSE Sets the upper bound of the color domain. Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. Value should have the same units as in `marker.color` and if set, `marker.cmin` must be set as well. number info calc Sets the mid-point of the color domain by scaling `marker.cmin` and/or `marker.cmax` to be equidistant to this point. Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. Value should have the same units as in `marker.color`. Has no effect when `marker.cauto` is `false`. colorscale style calc FALSE Sets the colorscale. Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. The colorscale must be an array containing arrays mapping a normalized value to an rgb, rgba, hex, hsl, hsv, or named color string. At minimum, a mapping for the lowest (0) and highest (1) values are required. For example, `[[0, 'rgb(0,0,255)', [1, 'rgb(255,0,0)']]`. To control the bounds of the colorscale in color space, use`marker.cmin` and `marker.cmax`. Alternatively, `colorscale` may be a palette name string of the following list: Greys,YlGnBu,Greens,YlOrRd,Bluered,RdBu,Reds,Blues,Picnic,Rainbow,Portland,Jet,Hot,Blackbody,Earth,Electric,Viridis,Cividis. boolean style TRUE calc Determines whether the colorscale is a default palette (`autocolorscale: true`) or the palette determined by `marker.colorscale`. Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. In case `colorscale` is unspecified or `autocolorscale` is true, the default palette will be chosen according to whether numbers in the `color` array are all positive, all negative or mixed. boolean style FALSE calc Reverses the color mapping if true. Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. If true, `marker.cmin` will correspond to the last color in the array and `marker.cmax` will correspond to the first color. boolean info FALSE calc Determines whether or not a colorbar is displayed for this trace. Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. calc object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for symbol . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for size . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for color . none enumerated top left top center TRUE style calc Sets the positions of the `text` elements with respects to the (x,y) coordinates. color style calc TRUE number style 1 calc TRUE string style TRUE TRUE calc HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. FALSE calc object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for color . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for size . none flaglist info x all TRUE all calc Determines which trace information appear on hover. If `none` or `skip` are set, no information is displayed upon hovering. But, if `none` is set, click and hover events are still fired. boolean info calc Determines whether or not this set of error bars is visible. enumerated percent info calc Determines the rule used to generate the error bars. If *constant`, the bar lengths are of a constant value. Set this constant in `value`. If *percent*, the bar lengths correspond to a percentage of underlying data. Set this percentage in `value`. If *sqrt*, the bar lengths correspond to the sqaure of the underlying data. If *array*, the bar lengths are set with data set `array`. boolean info calc Determines whether or not the error bars have the same length in both direction (top/bottom for vertical bars, left/right for horizontal bars. data_array calc Sets the data corresponding the length of each error bar. Values are plotted relative to the underlying data. data data_array calc Sets the data corresponding the length of each error bar in the bottom (left) direction for vertical (horizontal) bars Values are plotted relative to the underlying data. data number 0 10 info calc Sets the value of either the percentage (if `type` is set to *percent*) or the constant (if `type` is set to *constant*) corresponding to the lengths of the error bars. number 0 10 info calc Sets the value of either the percentage (if `type` is set to *percent*) or the constant (if `type` is set to *constant*) corresponding to the lengths of the error bars in the bottom (left) direction for vertical (horizontal) bars integer 0 0 info calc integer 0 0 info calc boolean style calc color style calc Sets the stoke color of the error bars. number 0 2 style calc Sets the thickness (in px) of the error bars. number 0 style calc Sets the width (in px) of the cross-bar at both ends of the error bars. calc number style calc Obsolete. Use the alpha channel in error bar `color` to set the opacity. object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for array . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for arrayminus . none boolean info calc Determines whether or not this set of error bars is visible. enumerated percent info calc Determines the rule used to generate the error bars. If *sqrt*, the bar lengths correspond to the sqaure of the underlying data. If *array*, the bar lengths are set with data set `array`. boolean info calc Determines whether or not the error bars have the same length in both direction (top/bottom for vertical bars, left/right for horizontal bars. data_array calc Sets the data corresponding the length of each error bar. Values are plotted relative to the underlying data. data data_array calc Sets the data corresponding the length of each error bar in the bottom (left) direction for vertical (horizontal) bars Values are plotted relative to the underlying data. data number 0 10 info calc Sets the value of either the percentage (if `type` is set to *percent*) or the constant (if `type` is set to *constant*) corresponding to the lengths of the error bars. number 0 10 info calc Sets the value of either the percentage (if `type` is set to *percent*) or the constant (if `type` is set to *constant*) corresponding to the lengths of the error bars in the bottom (left) direction for vertical (horizontal) bars integer 0 0 info calc integer 0 0 info calc boolean style calc color style calc Sets the stoke color of the error bars. number 0 2 style calc Sets the thickness (in px) of the error bars. number 0 style calc Sets the width (in px) of the cross-bar at both ends of the error bars. calc number style calc Obsolete. Values are plotted relative to the underlying data. data data_array calc Sets the data corresponding the length of each error bar in the bottom (left) direction for vertical (horizontal) bars Values are plotted relative to the underlying data. data number 0 10 info calc Sets the value of either the percentage (if `type` is set to *percent*) or the constant (if `type` is set to *constant*) corresponding to the lengths of the error bars. number 0 10 info calc Sets the value of either the percentage (if `type` is set to *percent*) or the constant (if `type` is set to *constant*) corresponding to the lengths of the error bars in the bottom (left) direction for vertical (horizontal) bars integer 0 0 info calc integer 0 0 info calc color style calc Sets the stoke color of the error bars. number 0 2 style calc Sets the thickness (in px) of the error bars. number 0 style calc Sets the width (in px) of the cross-bar at both ends of the error bars. calc number style calc Obsolete. Use the alpha channel in error bar `color` to set the opacity. object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for array . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for arrayminus . none enumerated gregorian info calc gregorian Sets the calendar system to use with `x` date data. enumerated gregorian info calc gregorian Sets the calendar system to use with `y` date data. enumerated gregorian info calc gregorian Sets the calendar system to use with `z` date data. subplotid info scene calc+clearAxisTypes Sets a reference between this trace's 3D coordinate system and a 3D scene. If *scene* (the default value), the (x,y,z) coordinates refer to `layout.scene`. If *scene2*, the (x,y,z) coordinates refer to `layout.scene2`, and so on. string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for ids . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for customdata . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for x . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for y . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for z . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for text . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for hovertext . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for hovertemplate . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for textposition . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for hoverinfo . none The data the describes the coordinates of the surface is set in `z`. Data in `z` should be a {2D array}. Coordinates in `x` and `y` can either be 1D {arrays} or {2D arrays} (e.g. to graph parametric surfaces). If not provided in `x` and `y`, the x and y coordinates are assumed to be linear starting at 0 with a unit step. The color scale corresponds to the `z` values by default. For custom color scales, use `surfacecolor` which should be a {2D array}, where its bounds can be controlled using `cmin` and `cmax`. surface enumerated TRUE info TRUE calc Determines whether or not this trace is visible. If *legendonly*, the trace is not drawn, but can appear as a legend item (provided that the legend itself is visible). boolean info TRUE style Determines whether or not an item corresponding to this trace is shown in the legend. string info style Sets the legend group for this trace. Traces part of the same legend group hide/show at the same time when toggling legend items. string info style Sets the trace name. The trace name appear as the legend item and on hover. string info plot TRUE Assign an id to this trace, Use this to provide object constancy between traces during animations and transitions. data_array calc TRUE Assigns id labels to each datum. These ids for object constancy of data points during animation. Should be an array of strings, not numbers or any other type. data data_array calc Assigns extra data each datum. This may be useful when listening to hover, click and selection events. Note that, *scatter* traces also appends customdata items in the markers DOM elements data any info calc Array containing integer indices of selected points. Has an effect only for traces that support selections. Note that an empty array means an empty selection where the `unselected` are turned on for all points, whereas, any other non-array values means no selection all where the `selected` and `unselected` styles have no effect. color style TRUE none Sets the background color of the hover labels for this trace color style TRUE none Sets the border color of the hover labels for this trace. string style TRUE TRUE none HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. TRUE number style 1 none TRUE color style none TRUE none Sets the font used in hover labels. object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for family . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for size . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for color . none integer -1 TRUE style none Sets the length (in number of characters) of the trace name in the hover labels for this trace. -1 shows the whole name regardless of length. 0-3 shows the first 0-3 characters, and an integer >3 will show the whole name if it is less than that many characters, but if it is longer, will truncate to `namelength - 3` characters and add an ellipsis. calc object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for bgcolor . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for bordercolor . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for namelength . none string TRUE TRUE info calc The stream id number links a data trace on a plot with a stream. See https://plot.ly/settings for more details. number 0 10000 500 info calc Sets the maximum number of points to keep on the plots from an incoming stream. If `maxpoints` is set to *50*, only the newest 50 points will be displayed on the plot. calc object any info none Controls persistence of some user-driven changes to the trace: `constraintrange` in `parcoords` traces, as well as some `editable: true` modifications such as `name` and `colorbar.title`. Defaults to `layout.uirevision`. Note that other user-driven trace attribute changes are controlled by `layout` attributes: `trace.visible` is controlled by `layout.legend.uirevision`, `selectedpoints` is controlled by `layout.selectionrevision`, and `colorbar.(x|y)` (accessible with `config: {editable: true}`) is controlled by `layout.editrevision`. Trace changes are tracked by `uid`, which only falls back on trace index if no `uid` is provided. So if your app can add/remove traces before the end of the `data` array, such that the same trace has a different index, you can still preserve user-driven changes if you give each trace a `uid` that stays with it as it moves. data_array Sets the z coordinates. calc+clearAxisTypes data data_array Sets the x coordinates. calc+clearAxisTypes data data_array Sets the y coordinates. calc+clearAxisTypes data string info TRUE Sets the text elements associated with each z value. If trace `hoverinfo` contains a *text* flag and *hovertext* is not set, these elements will be seen in the hover labels. calc string info TRUE Same as `text`. calc string info calc Template string used for rendering the information that appear on hover box. Note that this will override `hoverinfo`. Variables are inserted using %{variable}, for example "y: %{y}". Numbers are formatted using d3-format's syntax %{variable:d3-format}, for example "Price: %{y:$.2f}". See https://github.com/d3/d3-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format for details on the formatting syntax. The variables available in `hovertemplate` are the ones emitted as event data described at this link https://plot.ly/javascript/plotlyjs-events/#event-data. Additionally, every attributes that can be specified per-point (the ones that are `arrayOk: true`) are available. Anything contained in tag `<extra>` is displayed in the secondary box, for example "<extra>{fullData.name}</extra>". To hide the secondary box completely, use an empty tag `<extra></extra>`. TRUE boolean FALSE info calc Determines whether or not gaps (i.e. {nan} or missing values) in the `z` data are filled in. data_array Sets the surface color values, used for setting a color scale independent of `z`. calc data boolean info TRUE calc Determines whether or not the color domain is computed with respect to the input data (here z or surfacecolor) or the bounds set in `cmin` and `cmax` Defaults to `false` when `cmin` and `cmax` are set by the user. number info calc FALSE Sets the lower bound of the color domain. Value should have the same units as z or surfacecolor and if set, `cmax` must be set as well. number info calc FALSE Sets the upper bound of the color domain. Value should have the same units as z or surfacecolor and if set, `cmin` must be set as well. number info calc Sets the mid-point of the color domain by scaling `cmin` and/or `cmax` to be equidistant to this point. Value should have the same units as z or surfacecolor. Has no effect when `cauto` is `false`. colorscale style calc FALSE Sets the colorscale. The colorscale must be an array containing arrays mapping a normalized value to an rgb, rgba, hex, hsl, hsv, or named color string. At minimum, a mapping for the lowest (0) and highest (1) values are required. For example, `[[0, 'rgb(0,0,255)', [1, 'rgb(255,0,0)']]`. To control the bounds of the colorscale in color space, use`cmin` and `cmax`. Alternatively, `colorscale` may be a palette name string of the following list: Greys,YlGnBu,Greens,YlOrRd,Bluered,RdBu,Reds,Blues,Picnic,Rainbow,Portland,Jet,Hot,Blackbody,Earth,Electric,Viridis,Cividis. boolean style FALSE calc Determines whether the colorscale is a default palette (`autocolorscale: true`) or the palette determined by `colorscale`. In case `colorscale` is unspecified or `autocolorscale` is true, the default palette will be chosen according to whether numbers in the `color` array are all positive, all negative or mixed. boolean style FALSE calc Reverses the color mapping if true. If true, `cmin` will correspond to the last color in the array and `cmax` will correspond to the first color. boolean info TRUE calc Determines whether or not a colorbar is displayed for this trace. enumerated fraction style pixels Determines whether this color bar's thickness (i.e. the measure in the constant color direction) is set in units of plot *fraction* or in *pixels*. Use `thickness` to set the value. calc number style 0 30 Sets the thickness of the color bar This measure excludes the size of the padding, ticks and labels. calc enumerated fraction info fraction Determines whether this color bar's length (i.e. the measure in the color variation direction) is set in units of plot *fraction* or in *pixels. Use `len` to set the value. calc number 0 1 style Sets the length of the color bar This measure excludes the padding of both ends. That is, the color bar length is this length minus the padding on both ends. calc number 1.02 -2 3 style Sets the x position of the color bar (in plot fraction). calc enumerated left left style Sets this color bar's horizontal position anchor. This anchor binds the `x` position to the *left*, *center* or *right* of the color bar. calc number style 0 10 Sets the amount of padding (in px) along the x direction. calc number style 0.5 -2 3 Sets the y position of the color bar (in plot fraction). calc enumerated top style middle Sets this color bar's vertical position anchor This anchor binds the `y` position to the *top*, *middle* or *bottom* of the color bar. calc number style 0 10 Sets the amount of padding (in px) along the y direction. calc color #444 style calc Sets the axis line color. number 0 1 style calc Sets the width (in px) of the axis line. color #444 style calc Sets the axis line color. number style 0 0 Sets the width (in px) or the border enclosing this color bar. calc color style rgba(0,0,0,0) Sets the color of padded area. calc enumerated auto info calc Sets the tick mode for this axis. If *auto*, the number of ticks is set via `nticks`. If *linear*, the placement of the ticks is determined by a starting position `tick0` and a tick step `dtick` (*linear* is the default value if `tick0` and `dtick` are provided). If *array*, the placement of the ticks is set via `tickvals` and the tick text is `ticktext`. (*array* is the default value if `tickvals` is provided). integer 0 0 style calc Specifies the maximum number of ticks for the particular axis. The actual number of ticks will be chosen automatically to be less than or equal to `nticks`. Has an effect only if `tickmode` is set to *auto*. any style calc linear Sets the placement of the first tick on this axis. Use with `dtick`. If the axis `type` is *log*, then you must take the log of your starting tick (e.g. to set the starting tick to 100, set the `tick0` to 2) except when `dtick`=*L<f>* (see `dtick` for more info). If the axis `type` is *date*, it should be a date string, like date data. If the axis `type` is *category*, it should be a number, using the scale where each category is assigned a serial number from zero in the order it appears. any style calc linear Sets the step in-between ticks on this axis. Use with `tick0`. Must be a positive number, or special strings available to *log* and *date* axes. If the axis `type` is *log*, then ticks are set every 10^(n*dtick) where n is the tick number. For example, to set a tick mark at 1, 10, 100, 1000, ... set dtick to 1. To set tick marks at 1, 100, 10000, ... set dtick to 2. To set tick marks at 1, 5, 25, 125, 625, 3125, ... set dtick to log_10(5), or 0.69897000433. *log* has several special values; *L<f>*, where `f` is a positive number, gives ticks linearly spaced in value (but not position). For example `tick0` = 0.1, `dtick` = *L0.5* will put ticks at 0.1, 0.6, 1.1, 1.6 etc. To show powers of 10 plus small digits between, use *D1* (all digits) or *D2* (only 2 and 5). `tick0` is ignored for *D1* and *D2*. If the axis `type` is *date*, then you must convert the time to milliseconds. For example, to set the interval between ticks to one day, set `dtick` to 86400000.0. *date* also has special values *M<n>* gives ticks spaced by a number of months. `n` must be a positive integer. To set ticks on the 15th of every third month, set `tick0` to *2000-01-15* and `dtick` to *M3*. To set ticks every 4 years, set `dtick` to *M48* data_array calc Sets the values at which ticks on this axis appear. Only has an effect if `tickmode` is set to *array*. Used with `ticktext`. data data_array calc Sets the text displayed at the ticks position via `tickvals`. Only has an effect if `tickmode` is set to *array*. Used with `tickvals`. data enumerated outside style calc Determines whether ticks are drawn or not. If **, this axis' ticks are not drawn. If *outside* (*inside*), this axis' are drawn outside (inside) the axis lines. number 0 5 style calc Sets the tick length (in px). number 0 1 style calc Sets the tick width (in px). color #444 style calc Sets the tick color. boolean TRUE style calc Determines whether or not the tick labels are drawn. string style TRUE TRUE HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. calc number style 1 calc color style calc Sets the color bar's tick label font calc object angle auto style calc Sets the angle of the tick labels with respect to the horizontal. For example, a `tickangle` of -90 draws the tick labels vertically. string style calc Sets the tick label formatting rule using d3 formatting mini-languages which are very similar to those in Python. For numbers, see: https://github.com/d3/d3-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format And for dates see: https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format We add one item to d3's date formatter: *%{n}f* for fractional seconds with n digits. For example, *2016-10-13 09:15:23.456* with tickformat *%H~%M~%S.%2f* would display *09~15~23.46* boolean info TRUE calc Determines whether or not this stop is used. If `false`, this stop is ignored even within its `dtickrange`. info_array info any calc calc range [*min*, *max*], where *min*, *max* - dtick values which describe some zoom level, it is possible to omit *min* or *max* value by passing *null* string style calc string - dtickformat for described zoom level, the same as *tickformat* calc string style calc When used in a template, named items are created in the output figure in addition to any items the figure already has in this array. You can modify these items in the output figure by making your own item with `templateitemname` matching this `name` alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). Has no effect outside of a template. string info calc Used to refer to a named item in this array in the template. Named items from the template will be created even without a matching item in the input figure, but you can modify one by making an item with `templateitemname` matching its `name`, alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). If there is no template or no matching item, this item will be hidden unless you explicitly show it with `visible: true`. object object string style calc Sets a tick label prefix. enumerated all all style calc If *all*, all tick labels are displayed with a prefix. If *first*, only the first tick is displayed with a prefix. If *last*, only the last tick is displayed with a suffix. If *none*, tick prefixes are hidden. string style calc Sets a tick label suffix. enumerated all all style calc Same as `showtickprefix` but for tick suffixes. boolean FALSE style calc If "true", even 4-digit integers are separated enumerated none B style calc Determines a formatting rule for the tick exponents. For example, consider the number 1,000,000,000. If *none*, it appears as 1,000,000,000. If *e*, 1e+9. If *E*, 1E+9. If *power*, 1x10^9 (with 9 in a super script). If *SI*, 1G. If *B*, 1B. enumerated all all style calc If *all*, all exponents are shown besides their significands. If *first*, only the exponent of the first tick is shown. If *last*, only the exponent of the last tick is shown. If *none*, no exponents appear. string info Sets the title of the color bar. Note that before the existence of `title.text`, the title's contents used to be defined as the `title` attribute itself. This behavior has been deprecated. calc string style TRUE TRUE HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. calc number style 1 calc color style calc Sets this color bar's title font. Note that the title's font used to be set by the now deprecated `titlefont` attribute. calc object enumerated right style top Determines the location of color bar's title with respect to the color bar. Note that the title's location used to be set by the now deprecated `titleside` attribute. calc calc object string info Deprecated in favor of color bar's `title.text`. Note that value of color bar's `title` is no longer a simple *string* but a set of sub-attributes. calc string style TRUE TRUE HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. calc number style 1 calc color style calc Deprecated in favor of color bar's `title.font`. calc enumerated right style top Deprecated in favor of color bar's `title.side`. calc calc object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for tickvals . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for ticktext . none boolean info FALSE Determines whether or not contour lines about the x dimension are drawn. calc boolean info FALSE Determines whether or not these contour lines are projected on the x plane. If `highlight` is set to *true* (the default), the projected lines are shown on hover. If `show` is set to *true*, the projected lines are shown in permanence. calc boolean info FALSE Determines whether or not these contour lines are projected on the y plane. If `highlight` is set to *true* (the default), the projected lines are shown on hover. If `show` is set to *true*, the projected lines are shown in permanence. calc boolean info FALSE Determines whether or not these contour lines are projected on the z plane. If `highlight` is set to *true* (the default), the projected lines are shown on hover. If `show` is set to *true*, the projected lines are shown in permanence. calc calc object color style #444 Sets the color of the contour lines. calc boolean info FALSE An alternate to *color*. If `show` is set to *true*, the projected lines are shown in permanence. calc calc object color style #444 Sets the color of the contour lines. calc boolean info FALSE An alternate to *color*. Determines whether or not the contour lines are colored using the trace *colorscale*. calc number style 1 16 2 Sets the width of the contour lines. calc boolean info TRUE Determines whether or not contour lines about the z dimension are highlighted on hover. calc color style #444 Sets the color of the highlighted contour lines. calc number style 1 16 2 Sets the width of the highlighted contour lines. calc calc object calc object boolean info FALSE Determines whether or not a surface is drawn. For example, set `hidesurface` to *false* `contours.x.show` to *true* and `contours.y.show` to *true* to draw a wire frame plot. calc number style -100000 100000 10 Numeric vector, representing the X coordinate for each vertex. calc number style -100000 100000 10000 Numeric vector, representing the Y coordinate for each vertex. calc number style -100000 100000 0 Numeric vector, representing the Z coordinate for each vertex. calc calc object number style 0 1 0.8 Ambient light increases overall color visibility but can wash out the image. calc number style 0 1 0.8 Represents the extent that incident rays are reflected in a range of angles. calc number style 0 2 0.05 Represents the level that incident rays are reflected in a single direction, causing shine. calc number style 0 1 0.5 Alters specular reflection; the rougher the surface, the wider and less contrasty the shine. calc number style 0 5 0.2 Represents the reflectance as a dependency of the viewing angle; e.g. paper is reflective when viewing it from the edge of the paper (almost 90 degrees), causing shine. calc calc object number style 0 1 1 Sets the opacity of the surface. Please note that in the case of using high `opacity` values for example a value greater than or equal to 0.5 on two surfaces (and 0.25 with four surfaces), an overlay of multiple transparent surfaces may not perfectly be sorted in depth by the webgl API. This behavior may be improved in the near future and is subject to change. calc Obsolete. Use `cauto` instead. calc Obsolete. Use `cmin` instead. calc Obsolete. Use `cmax` instead. calc flaglist info x all TRUE all calc Determines which trace information appear on hover. If `none` or `skip` are set, no information is displayed upon hovering. But, if `none` is set, click and hover events are still fired. enumerated gregorian info calc gregorian Sets the calendar system to use with `x` date data. enumerated gregorian info calc gregorian Sets the calendar system to use with `y` date data. enumerated gregorian info calc gregorian Sets the calendar system to use with `z` date data. subplotid info scene calc+clearAxisTypes Sets a reference between this trace's 3D coordinate system and a 3D scene. If *scene* (the default value), the (x,y,z) coordinates refer to `layout.scene`. If *scene2*, the (x,y,z) coordinates refer to `layout.scene2`, and so on. string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for ids . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for customdata . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for z . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for x . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for y . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for text . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for hovertext . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for hovertemplate . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for surfacecolor . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for hoverinfo . none Draws isosurfaces between iso-min and iso-max values with coordinates given by four 1-dimensional arrays containing the `value`, `x`, `y` and `z` of every vertex of a uniform or non-uniform 3-D grid. Horizontal or vertical slices, caps as well as spaceframe between iso-min and iso-max values could also be drawn using this trace. isosurface enumerated TRUE info TRUE calc Determines whether or not this trace is visible. If *legendonly*, the trace is not drawn, but can appear as a legend item (provided that the legend itself is visible). boolean info TRUE style Determines whether or not an item corresponding to this trace is shown in the legend. string info style Sets the legend group for this trace. Traces part of the same legend group hide/show at the same time when toggling legend items. string info style Sets the trace name. The trace name appear as the legend item and on hover. string info plot TRUE Assign an id to this trace, Use this to provide object constancy between traces during animations and transitions. data_array calc TRUE Assigns id labels to each datum. These ids for object constancy of data points during animation. Should be an array of strings, not numbers or any other type. data data_array calc Assigns extra data each datum. This may be useful when listening to hover, click and selection events. Note that, *scatter* traces also appends customdata items in the markers DOM elements data any info calc Array containing integer indices of selected points. Has an effect only for traces that support selections. Note that an empty array means an empty selection where the `unselected` are turned on for all points, whereas, any other non-array values means no selection all where the `selected` and `unselected` styles have no effect. color style TRUE none Sets the background color of the hover labels for this trace color style TRUE none Sets the border color of the hover labels for this trace. string style TRUE TRUE none HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. TRUE number style 1 none TRUE color style none TRUE none Sets the font used in hover labels. object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for family . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for size . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for color . none integer -1 TRUE style none Sets the length (in number of characters) of the trace name in the hover labels for this trace. -1 shows the whole name regardless of length. 0-3 shows the first 0-3 characters, and an integer >3 will show the whole name if it is less than that many characters, but if it is longer, will truncate to `namelength - 3` characters and add an ellipsis. calc object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for bgcolor . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for bordercolor . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for namelength . none string TRUE TRUE info calc The stream id number links a data trace on a plot with a stream. See https://plot.ly/settings for more details. number 0 10000 500 info calc Sets the maximum number of points to keep on the plots from an incoming stream. If `maxpoints` is set to *50*, only the newest 50 points will be displayed on the plot. calc object any info none Controls persistence of some user-driven changes to the trace: `constraintrange` in `parcoords` traces, as well as some `editable: true` modifications such as `name` and `colorbar.title`. Defaults to `layout.uirevision`. Note that other user-driven trace attribute changes are controlled by `layout` attributes: `trace.visible` is controlled by `layout.legend.uirevision`, `selectedpoints` is controlled by `layout.selectionrevision`, and `colorbar.(x|y)` (accessible with `config: {editable: true}`) is controlled by `layout.editrevision`. Trace changes are tracked by `uid`, which only falls back on trace index if no `uid` is provided. So if your app can add/remove traces before the end of the `data` array, such that the same trace has a different index, you can still preserve user-driven changes if you give each trace a `uid` that stays with it as it moves. data_array data Sets the X coordinates of the vertices on X axis. calc+clearAxisTypes data_array data Sets the Y coordinates of the vertices on Y axis. calc+clearAxisTypes data_array data Sets the Z coordinates of the vertices on Z axis. calc+clearAxisTypes data_array data Sets the 4th dimension (value) of the vertices. calc+clearAxisTypes number info Sets the minimum boundary for iso-surface plot. calc number info Sets the maximum boundary for iso-surface plot. calc boolean info TRUE Hides/displays surfaces between minimum and maximum iso-values. calc integer info 2 1 Sets the number of iso-surfaces between minimum and maximum iso-values. By default this value is 2 meaning that only minimum and maximum surfaces would be drawn. calc number style 0 1 1 Sets the fill ratio of the iso-surface. The default fill value of the surface is 1 meaning that they are entirely shaded. On the other hand Applying a `fill` ratio less than one would allow the creation of openings parallel to the edges. calc flaglist A all all style Sets the surface pattern of the iso-surface 3-D sections. The default pattern of the surface is `all` meaning that the rest of surface elements would be shaded. The check options (either 1 or 2) could be used to draw half of the squares on the surface. Using various combinations of capital `A`, `B`, `C`, `D` and `E` may also be used to reduce the number of triangles on the iso-surfaces and creating other patterns of interest. calc calc object boolean info FALSE Displays/hides tetrahedron shapes between minimum and maximum iso-values. Often useful when either caps or surfaces are disabled or filled with values less than 1. calc number style 0 1 0.15 Sets the fill ratio of the `spaceframe` elements. The default fill value is 0.15 meaning that only 15% of the area of every faces of tetras would be shaded. Applying a greater `fill` ratio would allow the creation of stronger elements or could be sued to have entirely closed areas (in case of using 1). calc calc object boolean info FALSE Determines whether or not slice planes about the x dimension are drawn. calc data_array data Specifies the location(s) of slices on the axis. When not locations specified slices would be created for all points of the axis x except start and end. calc number style 0 1 1 Sets the fill ratio of the `slices`. The default fill value of the `slices` is 1 meaning that they are entirely shaded. On the other hand Applying a `fill` ratio less than one would allow the creation of openings parallel to the edges. calc calc object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for locations . none boolean info FALSE Determines whether or not slice planes about the y dimension are drawn. calc data_array data Specifies the location(s) of slices on the axis. The default fill value of the `slices` is 1 meaning that they are entirely shaded. On the other hand Applying a `fill` ratio less than one would allow the creation of openings parallel to the edges. calc calc object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for locations . none boolean info FALSE Determines whether or not slice planes about the z dimension are drawn. calc data_array data Specifies the location(s) of slices on the axis. The default fill value of the `slices` is 1 meaning that they are entirely shaded. On the other hand Applying a `fill` ratio less than one would allow the creation of openings parallel to the edges. calc calc object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for locations . none calc object boolean info TRUE Sets the fill ratio of the `slices`. The default fill value of the x `slices` is 1 meaning that they are entirely shaded. The default fill value of the `caps` is 1 meaning that they are entirely shaded.
