See https://plot.ly/settings for more details. number 0 10000 500 info calc Sets the maximum number of points to keep on the plots from an incoming stream. If `maxpoints` is set to *50*, only the newest 50 points will be displayed on the plot. calc object any info none Controls persistence of some user-driven changes to the trace: `constraintrange` in `parcoords` traces, as well as some `editable: true` modifications such as `name` and `colorbar.title`. Defaults to `layout.uirevision`. Note that other user-driven trace attribute changes are controlled by `layout` attributes: `trace.visible` is controlled by `layout.legend.uirevision`, `selectedpoints` is controlled by `layout.selectionrevision`, and `colorbar.(x|y)` (accessible with `config: {editable: true}`) is controlled by `layout.editrevision`. Trace changes are tracked by `uid`, which only falls back on trace index if no `uid` is provided. So if your app can add/remove traces before the end of the `data` array, such that the same trace has a different index, you can still preserve user-driven changes if you give each trace a `uid` that stays with it as it moves. data_array data calc+clearAxisTypes Sets the x coordinates of the vector field. data_array data calc+clearAxisTypes Sets the y coordinates of the vector field. data_array data calc+clearAxisTypes Sets the z coordinates of the vector field. data_array calc Sets the x components of the vector field. data data_array calc Sets the y components of the vector field. data data_array calc Sets the z components of the vector field. data data_array calc Sets the x components of the starting position of the streamtubes data data_array calc Sets the y components of the starting position of the streamtubes data data_array calc Sets the z components of the starting position of the streamtubes data calc object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for x . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for y . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for z . none integer 0 1000 info calc The maximum number of displayed segments in a streamtube. number info calc 0 1 The scaling factor for the streamtubes. The default is 1, which avoids two max divergence tubes from touching at adjacent starting positions. string info calc Sets a text element associated with this trace. If trace `hoverinfo` contains a *text* flag, this text element will be seen in all hover labels. Note that streamtube traces do not support array `text` values. string info calc Same as `text`. string info calc Template string used for rendering the information that appear on hover box. Note that this will override `hoverinfo`. Variables are inserted using %{variable}, for example "y: %{y}". Numbers are formatted using d3-format's syntax %{variable:d3-format}, for example "Price: %{y:$.2f}". See https://github.com/d3/d3-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format for details on the formatting syntax. The variables available in `hovertemplate` are the ones emitted as event data described at this link https://plot.ly/javascript/plotlyjs-events/#event-data. Additionally, every attributes that can be specified per-point (the ones that are `arrayOk: true`) are available. variables `tubex`, `tubey`, `tubez`, `tubeu`, `tubev`, `tubew`, `norm` and `divergence`. Anything contained in tag `<extra>` is displayed in the secondary box, for example "<extra>{fullData.name}</extra>". To hide the secondary box completely, use an empty tag `<extra></extra>`. TRUE boolean info TRUE calc Determines whether or not the color domain is computed with respect to the input data (here u/v/w norm) or the bounds set in `cmin` and `cmax` Defaults to `false` when `cmin` and `cmax` are set by the user. number info calc FALSE Sets the lower bound of the color domain. Value should have the same units as u/v/w norm and if set, `cmax` must be set as well. number info calc FALSE Sets the upper bound of the color domain. Value should have the same units as u/v/w norm and if set, `cmin` must be set as well. number info calc Sets the mid-point of the color domain by scaling `cmin` and/or `cmax` to be equidistant to this point. Value should have the same units as u/v/w norm. Has no effect when `cauto` is `false`. colorscale style calc FALSE Sets the colorscale. The colorscale must be an array containing arrays mapping a normalized value to an rgb, rgba, hex, hsl, hsv, or named color string. At minimum, a mapping for the lowest (0) and highest (1) values are required. For example, `[[0, 'rgb(0,0,255)', [1, 'rgb(255,0,0)']]`. To control the bounds of the colorscale in color space, use`cmin` and `cmax`. Alternatively, `colorscale` may be a palette name string of the following list: Greys,YlGnBu,Greens,YlOrRd,Bluered,RdBu,Reds,Blues,Picnic,Rainbow,Portland,Jet,Hot,Blackbody,Earth,Electric,Viridis,Cividis. boolean style TRUE calc Determines whether the colorscale is a default palette (`autocolorscale: true`) or the palette determined by `colorscale`. In case `colorscale` is unspecified or `autocolorscale` is true, the default palette will be chosen according to whether numbers in the `color` array are all positive, all negative or mixed. boolean style FALSE plot Reverses the color mapping if true. If true, `cmin` will correspond to the last color in the array and `cmax` will correspond to the first color. boolean info TRUE calc Determines whether or not a colorbar is displayed for this trace. enumerated fraction style pixels Determines whether this color bar's thickness (i.e. the measure in the constant color direction) is set in units of plot *fraction* or in *pixels*. Use `thickness` to set the value. colorbars number style 0 30 Sets the thickness of the color bar This measure excludes the size of the padding, ticks and labels. colorbars enumerated fraction info fraction Determines whether this color bar's length (i.e. the measure in the color variation direction) is set in units of plot *fraction* or in *pixels. Use `len` to set the value. colorbars number 0 1 style Sets the length of the color bar This measure excludes the padding of both ends. That is, the color bar length is this length minus the padding on both ends. colorbars number 1.02 -2 3 style Sets the x position of the color bar (in plot fraction). colorbars enumerated left left style Sets this color bar's horizontal position anchor. This anchor binds the `x` position to the *left*, *center* or *right* of the color bar. colorbars number style 0 10 Sets the amount of padding (in px) along the x direction. colorbars number style 0.5 -2 3 Sets the y position of the color bar (in plot fraction). colorbars enumerated top style middle Sets this color bar's vertical position anchor This anchor binds the `y` position to the *top*, *middle* or *bottom* of the color bar. colorbars number style 0 10 Sets the amount of padding (in px) along the y direction. colorbars color #444 style colorbars Sets the axis line color. number 0 1 style colorbars Sets the width (in px) of the axis line. color #444 style colorbars Sets the axis line color. number style 0 0 Sets the width (in px) or the border enclosing this color bar. colorbars color style rgba(0,0,0,0) Sets the color of padded area. colorbars enumerated auto info colorbars Sets the tick mode for this axis. If *auto*, the number of ticks is set via `nticks`. If *linear*, the placement of the ticks is determined by a starting position `tick0` and a tick step `dtick` (*linear* is the default value if `tick0` and `dtick` are provided). If *array*, the placement of the ticks is set via `tickvals` and the tick text is `ticktext`. (*array* is the default value if `tickvals` is provided). integer 0 0 style colorbars Specifies the maximum number of ticks for the particular axis. The actual number of ticks will be chosen automatically to be less than or equal to `nticks`. Has an effect only if `tickmode` is set to *auto*. any style colorbars linear Sets the placement of the first tick on this axis. Use with `dtick`. If the axis `type` is *log*, then you must take the log of your starting tick (e.g. to set the starting tick to 100, set the `tick0` to 2) except when `dtick`=*L<f>* (see `dtick` for more info). If the axis `type` is *date*, it should be a date string, like date data. If the axis `type` is *category*, it should be a number, using the scale where each category is assigned a serial number from zero in the order it appears. any style colorbars linear Sets the step in-between ticks on this axis. Use with `tick0`. Must be a positive number, or special strings available to *log* and *date* axes. If the axis `type` is *log*, then ticks are set every 10^(n*dtick) where n is the tick number. For example, to set a tick mark at 1, 10, 100, 1000, ... set dtick to 1. To set tick marks at 1, 100, 10000, ... set dtick to 2. To set tick marks at 1, 5, 25, 125, 625, 3125, ... set dtick to log_10(5), or 0.69897000433. *log* has several special values; *L<f>*, where `f` is a positive number, gives ticks linearly spaced in value (but not position). For example `tick0` = 0.1, `dtick` = *L0.5* will put ticks at 0.1, 0.6, 1.1, 1.6 etc. To show powers of 10 plus small digits between, use *D1* (all digits) or *D2* (only 2 and 5). `tick0` is ignored for *D1* and *D2*. If the axis `type` is *date*, then you must convert the time to milliseconds. For example, to set the interval between ticks to one day, set `dtick` to 86400000.0. *date* also has special values *M<n>* gives ticks spaced by a number of months. `n` must be a positive integer. To set ticks on the 15th of every third month, set `tick0` to *2000-01-15* and `dtick` to *M3*. To set ticks every 4 years, set `dtick` to *M48* data_array colorbars Sets the values at which ticks on this axis appear. Only has an effect if `tickmode` is set to *array*. Used with `ticktext`. data data_array colorbars Sets the text displayed at the ticks position via `tickvals`. Only has an effect if `tickmode` is set to *array*. Used with `tickvals`. data enumerated outside style colorbars Determines whether ticks are drawn or not. If **, this axis' ticks are not drawn. If *outside* (*inside*), this axis' are drawn outside (inside) the axis lines. number 0 5 style colorbars Sets the tick length (in px). number 0 1 style colorbars Sets the tick width (in px). color #444 style colorbars Sets the tick color. boolean TRUE style colorbars Determines whether or not the tick labels are drawn. string style TRUE TRUE HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. colorbars number style 1 colorbars color style colorbars Sets the color bar's tick label font colorbars object angle auto style colorbars Sets the angle of the tick labels with respect to the horizontal. For example, a `tickangle` of -90 draws the tick labels vertically. string style colorbars Sets the tick label formatting rule using d3 formatting mini-languages which are very similar to those in Python. For numbers, see: https://github.com/d3/d3-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format And for dates see: https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format We add one item to d3's date formatter: *%{n}f* for fractional seconds with n digits. For example, *2016-10-13 09:15:23.456* with tickformat *%H~%M~%S.%2f* would display *09~15~23.46* boolean info TRUE colorbars Determines whether or not this stop is used. If `false`, this stop is ignored even within its `dtickrange`. info_array info any colorbars colorbars range [*min*, *max*], where *min*, *max* - dtick values which describe some zoom level, it is possible to omit *min* or *max* value by passing *null* string style colorbars string - dtickformat for described zoom level, the same as *tickformat* colorbars string style colorbars When used in a template, named items are created in the output figure in addition to any items the figure already has in this array. You can modify these items in the output figure by making your own item with `templateitemname` matching this `name` alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). Has no effect outside of a template. string info colorbars Used to refer to a named item in this array in the template. Named items from the template will be created even without a matching item in the input figure, but you can modify one by making an item with `templateitemname` matching its `name`, alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). If there is no template or no matching item, this item will be hidden unless you explicitly show it with `visible: true`. object object string style colorbars Sets a tick label prefix. enumerated all all style colorbars If *all*, all tick labels are displayed with a prefix. If *first*, only the first tick is displayed with a prefix. If *last*, only the last tick is displayed with a suffix. If *none*, tick prefixes are hidden. string style colorbars Sets a tick label suffix. enumerated all all style colorbars Same as `showtickprefix` but for tick suffixes. boolean FALSE style colorbars If "true", even 4-digit integers are separated enumerated none B style colorbars Determines a formatting rule for the tick exponents. For example, consider the number 1,000,000,000. If *none*, it appears as 1,000,000,000. If *e*, 1e+9. If *E*, 1E+9. If *power*, 1x10^9 (with 9 in a super script). If *SI*, 1G. If *B*, 1B. enumerated all all style colorbars If *all*, all exponents are shown besides their significands. If *first*, only the exponent of the first tick is shown. If *last*, only the exponent of the last tick is shown. If *none*, no exponents appear. string info Sets the title of the color bar. Note that before the existence of `title.text`, the title's contents used to be defined as the `title` attribute itself. This behavior has been deprecated. colorbars string style TRUE TRUE HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. colorbars number style 1 colorbars color style colorbars Sets this color bar's title font. Note that the title's font used to be set by the now deprecated `titlefont` attribute. colorbars object enumerated right style top Determines the location of color bar's title with respect to the color bar. Note that the title's location used to be set by the now deprecated `titleside` attribute. colorbars colorbars object string info Deprecated in favor of color bar's `title.text`. Note that value of color bar's `title` is no longer a simple *string* but a set of sub-attributes. colorbars string style TRUE TRUE HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. colorbars number style 1 colorbars color style colorbars Deprecated in favor of color bar's `title.font`. colorbars enumerated right style top Deprecated in favor of color bar's `title.side`. colorbars colorbars object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for tickvals . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for ticktext . none number style 0 1 1 Sets the opacity of the surface. Please note that in the case of using high `opacity` values for example a value greater than or equal to 0.5 on two surfaces (and 0.25 with four surfaces), an overlay of multiple transparent surfaces may not perfectly be sorted in depth by the webgl API. This behavior may be improved in the near future and is subject to change. calc number style -100000 100000 100000 Numeric vector, representing the X coordinate for each vertex. calc number style -100000 100000 100000 Numeric vector, representing the Y coordinate for each vertex. calc number style -100000 100000 0 Numeric vector, representing the Z coordinate for each vertex. calc calc object number style 0 1 1e-12 calc Epsilon for vertex normals calculation avoids math issues arising from degenerate geometry. number style 0 1 1e-06 calc Epsilon for face normals calculation avoids math issues arising from degenerate geometry. calc number style 0 1 0.8 Ambient light increases overall color visibility but can wash out the image. calc number style 0 1 0.8 Represents the extent that incident rays are reflected in a range of angles. calc number style 0 2 0.05 Represents the level that incident rays are reflected in a single direction, causing shine. calc number style 0 1 0.5 Alters specular reflection; the rougher the surface, the wider and less contrasty the shine. calc number style 0 5 0.2 Represents the reflectance as a dependency of the viewing angle; e.g. paper is reflective when viewing it from the edge of the paper (almost 90 degrees), causing shine. calc object flaglist info x all TRUE x+y+z+norm+text+name calc Determines which trace information appear on hover. If `none` or `skip` are set, no information is displayed upon hovering. But, if `none` is set, click and hover events are still fired. subplotid info scene calc+clearAxisTypes Sets a reference between this trace's 3D coordinate system and a 3D scene. If *scene* (the default value), the (x,y,z) coordinates refer to `layout.scene`. If *scene2*, the (x,y,z) coordinates refer to `layout.scene2`, and so on. string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for ids . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for customdata . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for x . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for y . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for z . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for u . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for v . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for w . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for hovertemplate . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for hoverinfo . none scatter_geo The data visualized as scatter point or lines on a geographic map is provided either by longitude/latitude pairs in `lon` and `lat` respectively or by geographic location IDs or names in `locations`. scattergeo enumerated TRUE info TRUE calc Determines whether or not this trace is visible. If *legendonly*, the trace is not drawn, but can appear as a legend item (provided that the legend itself is visible). boolean info TRUE style Determines whether or not an item corresponding to this trace is shown in the legend. string info style Sets the legend group for this trace. Traces part of the same legend group hide/show at the same time when toggling legend items. number style 0 1 1 style Sets the opacity of the trace. string info style Sets the trace name. The trace name appear as the legend item and on hover. string info plot TRUE Assign an id to this trace, Use this to provide object constancy between traces during animations and transitions. data_array calc TRUE Assigns id labels to each datum. These ids for object constancy of data points during animation. Should be an array of strings, not numbers or any other type. data data_array calc Assigns extra data each datum. This may be useful when listening to hover, click and selection events. Note that, *scatter* traces also appends customdata items in the markers DOM elements data any info calc Array containing integer indices of selected points. Has an effect only for traces that support selections. Note that an empty array means an empty selection where the `unselected` are turned on for all points, whereas, any other non-array values means no selection all where the `selected` and `unselected` styles have no effect. color style TRUE none Sets the background color of the hover labels for this trace color style TRUE none Sets the border color of the hover labels for this trace. string style TRUE TRUE none HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. TRUE number style 1 none TRUE color style none TRUE none Sets the font used in hover labels. object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for family . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for size . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for color . none integer -1 TRUE style none Sets the length (in number of characters) of the trace name in the hover labels for this trace. -1 shows the whole name regardless of length. 0-3 shows the first 0-3 characters, and an integer >3 will show the whole name if it is less than that many characters, but if it is longer, will truncate to `namelength - 3` characters and add an ellipsis. calc object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for bgcolor . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for bordercolor . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for namelength . none string TRUE TRUE info calc The stream id number links a data trace on a plot with a stream. See https://plot.ly/settings for more details. number 0 10000 500 info calc Sets the maximum number of points to keep on the plots from an incoming stream. If `maxpoints` is set to *50*, only the newest 50 points will be displayed on the plot. calc object calc An array of operations that manipulate the trace data, for example filtering or sorting the data arrays. object object any info none Controls persistence of some user-driven changes to the trace: `constraintrange` in `parcoords` traces, as well as some `editable: true` modifications such as `name` and `colorbar.title`. Defaults to `layout.uirevision`. Note that other user-driven trace attribute changes are controlled by `layout` attributes: `trace.visible` is controlled by `layout.legend.uirevision`, `selectedpoints` is controlled by `layout.selectionrevision`, and `colorbar.(x|y)` (accessible with `config: {editable: true}`) is controlled by `layout.editrevision`. Trace changes are tracked by `uid`, which only falls back on trace index if no `uid` is provided. So if your app can add/remove traces before the end of the `data` array, such that the same trace has a different index, you can still preserve user-driven changes if you give each trace a `uid` that stays with it as it moves. data_array Sets the longitude coordinates (in degrees East). calc data data_array Sets the latitude coordinates (in degrees North). calc data data_array Sets the coordinates via location IDs or names. Coordinates correspond to the centroid of each location given. See `locationmode` for more info. calc data enumerated ISO-3 info ISO-3 Determines the set of locations used to match entries in `locations` to regions on the map. calc flaglist lines none info calc Determines the drawing mode for this scatter trace. If the provided `mode` includes *text* then the `text` elements appear at the coordinates. Otherwise, the `text` elements appear on hover. If there are less than 20 points and the trace is not stacked then the default is *lines+markers*. Otherwise, *lines*. markers string info TRUE calc Sets text elements associated with each (lon,lat) pair or item in `locations`. If a single string, the same string appears over all the data points. If an array of string, the items are mapped in order to the this trace's (lon,lat) or `locations` coordinates. If trace `hoverinfo` contains a *text* flag and *hovertext* is not set, these elements will be seen in the hover labels. string info TRUE calc Sets hover text elements associated with each (lon,lat) pair or item in `locations`. If a single string, the same string appears over all the data points. If an array of string, the items are mapped in order to the this trace's (lon,lat) or `locations` coordinates. To be seen, trace `hoverinfo` must contain a *text* flag. string style TRUE TRUE calc HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. TRUE number style 1 calc TRUE color style calc TRUE calc Sets the text font. object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for family . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for size . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for color . none enumerated top left middle center TRUE style calc Sets the positions of the `text` elements with respects to the (x,y) coordinates. color style calc TRUE Sets the line color. number 0 2 style calc TRUE Sets the line width (in px). string solid solid style calc Sets the dash style of lines. Set to a dash type string (*solid*, *dot*, *dash*, *longdash*, *dashdot*, or *longdashdot*) or a dash length list in px (eg *5px,10px,2px,2px*). calc object boolean FALSE info calc Determines whether or not gaps (i.e. {nan} or missing values) in the provided data arrays are connected. enumerated 0 circle TRUE style calc Sets the marker symbol type. Adding 100 is equivalent to appending *-open* to a symbol name. Adding 200 is equivalent to appending *-dot* to a symbol name. Adding 300 is equivalent to appending *-open-dot* or *dot-open* to a symbol name. number 0 1 TRUE style calc TRUE Sets the marker opacity. number 0 6 TRUE style calc TRUE Sets the marker size (in px). number 1 style calc Has an effect only if `marker.size` is set to a numerical array. Sets the scale factor used to determine the rendered size of marker points. Use with `sizemin` and `sizemode`. number 0 0 style calc Has an effect only if `marker.size` is set to a numerical array. Sets the minimum size (in px) of the rendered marker points. enumerated diameter diameter info calc Has an effect only if `marker.size` is set to a numerical array. Sets the rule for which the data in `size` is converted to pixels. enumerated fraction style pixels Determines whether this color bar's thickness (i.e. the measure in the constant color direction) is set in units of plot *fraction* or in *pixels*. Use `thickness` to set the value. calc number style 0 30 Sets the thickness of the color bar This measure excludes the size of the padding, ticks and labels. calc enumerated fraction info fraction Determines whether this color bar's length (i.e. the measure in the color variation direction) is set in units of plot *fraction* or in *pixels. Use `len` to set the value. calc number 0 1 style Sets the length of the color bar This measure excludes the padding of both ends. That is, the color bar length is this length minus the padding on both ends. calc number 1.02 -2 3 style Sets the x position of the color bar (in plot fraction). calc enumerated left left style Sets this color bar's horizontal position anchor. This anchor binds the `x` position to the *left*, *center* or *right* of the color bar. calc number style 0 10 Sets the amount of padding (in px) along the x direction. calc number style 0.5 -2 3 Sets the y position of the color bar (in plot fraction). calc enumerated top style middle Sets this color bar's vertical position anchor This anchor binds the `y` position to the *top*, *middle* or *bottom* of the color bar. calc number style 0 10 Sets the amount of padding (in px) along the y direction. calc color #444 style calc Sets the axis line color. number 0 1 style calc Sets the width (in px) of the axis line. color #444 style calc Sets the axis line color. number style 0 0 Sets the width (in px) or the border enclosing this color bar. calc color style rgba(0,0,0,0) Sets the color of padded area. calc enumerated auto info calc Sets the tick mode for this axis. If *auto*, the number of ticks is set via `nticks`. If *linear*, the placement of the ticks is determined by a starting position `tick0` and a tick step `dtick` (*linear* is the default value if `tick0` and `dtick` are provided). If *array*, the placement of the ticks is set via `tickvals` and the tick text is `ticktext`. (*array* is the default value if `tickvals` is provided). integer 0 0 style calc Specifies the maximum number of ticks for the particular axis. The actual number of ticks will be chosen automatically to be less than or equal to `nticks`. Has an effect only if `tickmode` is set to *auto*. any style calc linear Sets the placement of the first tick on this axis. Use with `dtick`. If the axis `type` is *log*, then you must take the log of your starting tick (e.g. to set the starting tick to 100, set the `tick0` to 2) except when `dtick`=*L<f>* (see `dtick` for more info). If the axis `type` is *date*, it should be a date string, like date data. If the axis `type` is *category*, it should be a number, using the scale where each category is assigned a serial number from zero in the order it appears. any style calc linear Sets the step in-between ticks on this axis. Use with `tick0`. Must be a positive number, or special strings available to *log* and *date* axes. If the axis `type` is *log*, then ticks are set every 10^(n*dtick) where n is the tick number. For example, to set a tick mark at 1, 10, 100, 1000, ... set dtick to 1. To set tick marks at 1, 100, 10000, ... set dtick to 2. To set tick marks at 1, 5, 25, 125, 625, 3125, ... set dtick to log_10(5), or 0.69897000433. *log* has several special values; *L<f>*, where `f` is a positive number, gives ticks linearly spaced in value (but not position). For example `tick0` = 0.1, `dtick` = *L0.5* will put ticks at 0.1, 0.6, 1.1, 1.6 etc. To show powers of 10 plus small digits between, use *D1* (all digits) or *D2* (only 2 and 5). `tick0` is ignored for *D1* and *D2*. If the axis `type` is *date*, then you must convert the time to milliseconds. For example, to set the interval between ticks to one day, set `dtick` to 86400000.0. *date* also has special values *M<n>* gives ticks spaced by a number of months. `n` must be a positive integer. To set ticks on the 15th of every third month, set `tick0` to *2000-01-15* and `dtick` to *M3*. To set ticks every 4 years, set `dtick` to *M48* data_array calc Sets the values at which ticks on this axis appear. Only has an effect if `tickmode` is set to *array*.
