If *y2*, the y coordinates refer to `layout.yaxis2`, and so on. string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for ids . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for customdata . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for hoverinfo . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for z . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for x . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for y . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for text . none Parallel coordinates for multidimensional exploratory data analysis. The samples are specified in `dimensions`. The colors are set in `line.color`. parcoords enumerated TRUE info TRUE calc Determines whether or not this trace is visible. If *legendonly*, the trace is not drawn, but can appear as a legend item (provided that the legend itself is visible). boolean info TRUE style Determines whether or not an item corresponding to this trace is shown in the legend. string info style Sets the legend group for this trace. Traces part of the same legend group hide/show at the same time when toggling legend items. number style 0 1 1 style Sets the opacity of the trace. string info style Sets the trace name. The trace name appear as the legend item and on hover. string info plot TRUE Assign an id to this trace, Use this to provide object constancy between traces during animations and transitions. data_array calc TRUE Assigns id labels to each datum. These ids for object constancy of data points during animation. Should be an array of strings, not numbers or any other type. data data_array calc Assigns extra data each datum. This may be useful when listening to hover, click and selection events. Note that, *scatter* traces also appends customdata items in the markers DOM elements data any info calc Array containing integer indices of selected points. Has an effect only for traces that support selections. Note that an empty array means an empty selection where the `unselected` are turned on for all points, whereas, any other non-array values means no selection all where the `selected` and `unselected` styles have no effect. flaglist info x all TRUE all none Determines which trace information appear on hover. If `none` or `skip` are set, no information is displayed upon hovering. But, if `none` is set, click and hover events are still fired. string TRUE TRUE info calc The stream id number links a data trace on a plot with a stream. See https://plot.ly/settings for more details. number 0 10000 500 info calc Sets the maximum number of points to keep on the plots from an incoming stream. If `maxpoints` is set to *50*, only the newest 50 points will be displayed on the plot. calc object calc An array of operations that manipulate the trace data, for example filtering or sorting the data arrays. object object any info none Controls persistence of some user-driven changes to the trace: `constraintrange` in `parcoords` traces, as well as some `editable: true` modifications such as `name` and `colorbar.title`. Defaults to `layout.uirevision`. Note that other user-driven trace attribute changes are controlled by `layout` attributes: `trace.visible` is controlled by `layout.legend.uirevision`, `selectedpoints` is controlled by `layout.selectionrevision`, and `colorbar.(x|y)` (accessible with `config: {editable: true}`) is controlled by `layout.editrevision`. Trace changes are tracked by `uid`, which only falls back on trace index if no `uid` is provided. So if your app can add/remove traces before the end of the `data` array, such that the same trace has a different index, you can still preserve user-driven changes if you give each trace a `uid` that stays with it as it moves. info_array info calc number 0 1 calc 0 Sets the horizontal domain of this parcoords trace (in plot fraction). info_array info calc number 0 1 calc 0 Sets the vertical domain of this parcoords trace (in plot fraction). calc integer 0 0 info calc If there is a layout grid, use the domain for this row in the grid for this parcoords trace . integer 0 0 info calc If there is a layout grid, use the domain for this column in the grid for this parcoords trace . object string style TRUE TRUE calc HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. number style 1 calc color style calc calc Sets the font for the `dimension` labels. object string style TRUE TRUE calc HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. number style 1 calc color style calc calc Sets the font for the `dimension` tick values. object string style TRUE TRUE calc HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. number style 1 calc color style calc calc Sets the font for the `dimension` range values. object string info calc The shown name of the dimension. data_array calc Sets the values at which ticks on this axis appear. Only has an effect if `tickmode` is set to *array*. Used with `ticktext`. data data_array calc Sets the text displayed at the ticks position via `tickvals`. Only has an effect if `tickmode` is set to *array*. Used with `tickvals`. data string 3s style calc Sets the tick label formatting rule using d3 formatting mini-language which is similar to those of Python. See https://github.com/d3/d3-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format boolean TRUE info calc Shows the dimension when set to `true` (the default). Hides the dimension for `false`. info_array info number calc calc The domain range that represents the full, shown axis extent. Defaults to the `values` extent. Must be an array of `[fromValue, toValue]` with finite numbers as elements. info_array info TRUE 1-2 number calc calc The domain range to which the filter on the dimension is constrained. Must be an array of `[fromValue, toValue]` with `fromValue <= toValue`, or if `multiselect` is not disabled, you may give an array of arrays, where each inner array is `[fromValue, toValue]`. boolean TRUE info calc Do we allow multiple selection ranges or just a single range? data_array data calc Dimension values. `values[n]` represents the value of the `n`th point in the dataset, therefore the `values` vector for all dimensions must be the same (longer vectors will be truncated). Each value must be a finite number. calc The dimensions (variables) of the parallel coordinates chart. 2..60 dimensions are supported. string style none When used in a template, named items are created in the output figure in addition to any items the figure already has in this array. You can modify these items in the output figure by making your own item with `templateitemname` matching this `name` alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). Has no effect outside of a template. string info calc Used to refer to a named item in this array in the template. Named items from the template will be created even without a matching item in the input figure, but you can modify one by making an item with `templateitemname` matching its `name`, alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). If there is no template or no matching item, this item will be hidden unless you explicitly show it with `visible: true`. object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for tickvals . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for ticktext . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for values . none object color TRUE style calc Sets thelinecolor. It accepts either a specific color or an array of numbers that are mapped to the colorscale relative to the max and min values of the array or relative to `line.cmin` and `line.cmax` if set. boolean info TRUE calc Determines whether or not the color domain is computed with respect to the input data (here in `line.color`) or the bounds set in `line.cmin` and `line.cmax` Has an effect only if in `line.color`is set to a numerical array. Defaults to `false` when `line.cmin` and `line.cmax` are set by the user. number info calc FALSE Sets the lower bound of the color domain. Has an effect only if in `line.color`is set to a numerical array. Value should have the same units as in `line.color` and if set, `line.cmax` must be set as well. number info calc FALSE Sets the upper bound of the color domain. Has an effect only if in `line.color`is set to a numerical array. Value should have the same units as in `line.color` and if set, `line.cmin` must be set as well. number info calc Sets the mid-point of the color domain by scaling `line.cmin` and/or `line.cmax` to be equidistant to this point. Has an effect only if in `line.color`is set to a numerical array. Value should have the same units as in `line.color`. Has no effect when `line.cauto` is `false`. colorscale style calc 0 FALSE Sets the colorscale. Has an effect only if in `line.color`is set to a numerical array. The colorscale must be an array containing arrays mapping a normalized value to an rgb, rgba, hex, hsl, hsv, or named color string. At minimum, a mapping for the lowest (0) and highest (1) values are required. For example, `[[0, 'rgb(0,0,255)', [1, 'rgb(255,0,0)']]`. To control the bounds of the colorscale in color space, use`line.cmin` and `line.cmax`. Alternatively, `colorscale` may be a palette name string of the following list: Greys,YlGnBu,Greens,YlOrRd,Bluered,RdBu,Reds,Blues,Picnic,Rainbow,Portland,Jet,Hot,Blackbody,Earth,Electric,Viridis,Cividis. boolean style FALSE calc Determines whether the colorscale is a default palette (`autocolorscale: true`) or the palette determined by `line.colorscale`. Has an effect only if in `line.color`is set to a numerical array. In case `colorscale` is unspecified or `autocolorscale` is true, the default palette will be chosen according to whether numbers in the `color` array are all positive, all negative or mixed. boolean style FALSE plot Reverses the color mapping if true. Has an effect only if in `line.color`is set to a numerical array. If true, `line.cmin` will correspond to the last color in the array and `line.cmax` will correspond to the first color. boolean info FALSE calc Determines whether or not a colorbar is displayed for this trace. Has an effect only if in `line.color`is set to a numerical array. enumerated fraction style pixels Determines whether this color bar's thickness (i.e. the measure in the constant color direction) is set in units of plot *fraction* or in *pixels*. Use `thickness` to set the value. colorbars number style 0 30 Sets the thickness of the color bar This measure excludes the size of the padding, ticks and labels. colorbars enumerated fraction info fraction Determines whether this color bar's length (i.e. the measure in the color variation direction) is set in units of plot *fraction* or in *pixels. Use `len` to set the value. colorbars number 0 1 style Sets the length of the color bar This measure excludes the padding of both ends. That is, the color bar length is this length minus the padding on both ends. colorbars number 1.02 -2 3 style Sets the x position of the color bar (in plot fraction). colorbars enumerated left left style Sets this color bar's horizontal position anchor. This anchor binds the `x` position to the *left*, *center* or *right* of the color bar. colorbars number style 0 10 Sets the amount of padding (in px) along the x direction. colorbars number style 0.5 -2 3 Sets the y position of the color bar (in plot fraction). colorbars enumerated top style middle Sets this color bar's vertical position anchor This anchor binds the `y` position to the *top*, *middle* or *bottom* of the color bar. colorbars number style 0 10 Sets the amount of padding (in px) along the y direction. colorbars color #444 style colorbars Sets the axis line color. number 0 1 style colorbars Sets the width (in px) of the axis line. color #444 style colorbars Sets the axis line color. number style 0 0 Sets the width (in px) or the border enclosing this color bar. colorbars color style rgba(0,0,0,0) Sets the color of padded area. colorbars enumerated auto info colorbars Sets the tick mode for this axis. If *auto*, the number of ticks is set via `nticks`. If *linear*, the placement of the ticks is determined by a starting position `tick0` and a tick step `dtick` (*linear* is the default value if `tick0` and `dtick` are provided). If *array*, the placement of the ticks is set via `tickvals` and the tick text is `ticktext`. (*array* is the default value if `tickvals` is provided). integer 0 0 style colorbars Specifies the maximum number of ticks for the particular axis. The actual number of ticks will be chosen automatically to be less than or equal to `nticks`. Has an effect only if `tickmode` is set to *auto*. any style colorbars linear Sets the placement of the first tick on this axis. Use with `dtick`. If the axis `type` is *log*, then you must take the log of your starting tick (e.g. to set the starting tick to 100, set the `tick0` to 2) except when `dtick`=*L<f>* (see `dtick` for more info). If the axis `type` is *date*, it should be a date string, like date data. If the axis `type` is *category*, it should be a number, using the scale where each category is assigned a serial number from zero in the order it appears. any style colorbars linear Sets the step in-between ticks on this axis. Use with `tick0`. Must be a positive number, or special strings available to *log* and *date* axes. If the axis `type` is *log*, then ticks are set every 10^(n*dtick) where n is the tick number. For example, to set a tick mark at 1, 10, 100, 1000, ... set dtick to 1. To set tick marks at 1, 100, 10000, ... set dtick to 2. To set tick marks at 1, 5, 25, 125, 625, 3125, ... set dtick to log_10(5), or 0.69897000433. *log* has several special values; *L<f>*, where `f` is a positive number, gives ticks linearly spaced in value (but not position). For example `tick0` = 0.1, `dtick` = *L0.5* will put ticks at 0.1, 0.6, 1.1, 1.6 etc. To show powers of 10 plus small digits between, use *D1* (all digits) or *D2* (only 2 and 5). `tick0` is ignored for *D1* and *D2*. If the axis `type` is *date*, then you must convert the time to milliseconds. For example, to set the interval between ticks to one day, set `dtick` to 86400000.0. *date* also has special values *M<n>* gives ticks spaced by a number of months. `n` must be a positive integer. To set ticks on the 15th of every third month, set `tick0` to *2000-01-15* and `dtick` to *M3*. To set ticks every 4 years, set `dtick` to *M48* data_array colorbars Sets the values at which ticks on this axis appear. Only has an effect if `tickmode` is set to *array*. Used with `ticktext`. data data_array colorbars Sets the text displayed at the ticks position via `tickvals`. Only has an effect if `tickmode` is set to *array*. Used with `tickvals`. data enumerated outside style colorbars Determines whether ticks are drawn or not. If **, this axis' ticks are not drawn. If *outside* (*inside*), this axis' are drawn outside (inside) the axis lines. number 0 5 style colorbars Sets the tick length (in px). number 0 1 style colorbars Sets the tick width (in px). color #444 style colorbars Sets the tick color. boolean TRUE style colorbars Determines whether or not the tick labels are drawn. string style TRUE TRUE HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. colorbars number style 1 colorbars color style colorbars Sets the color bar's tick label font colorbars object angle auto style colorbars Sets the angle of the tick labels with respect to the horizontal. For example, a `tickangle` of -90 draws the tick labels vertically. string style colorbars Sets the tick label formatting rule using d3 formatting mini-languages which are very similar to those in Python. For numbers, see: https://github.com/d3/d3-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format And for dates see: https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format We add one item to d3's date formatter: *%{n}f* for fractional seconds with n digits. For example, *2016-10-13 09:15:23.456* with tickformat *%H~%M~%S.%2f* would display *09~15~23.46* boolean info TRUE colorbars Determines whether or not this stop is used. If `false`, this stop is ignored even within its `dtickrange`. info_array info any colorbars colorbars range [*min*, *max*], where *min*, *max* - dtick values which describe some zoom level, it is possible to omit *min* or *max* value by passing *null* string style colorbars string - dtickformat for described zoom level, the same as *tickformat* colorbars string style colorbars When used in a template, named items are created in the output figure in addition to any items the figure already has in this array. You can modify these items in the output figure by making your own item with `templateitemname` matching this `name` alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). Has no effect outside of a template. string info colorbars Used to refer to a named item in this array in the template. Named items from the template will be created even without a matching item in the input figure, but you can modify one by making an item with `templateitemname` matching its `name`, alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). If there is no template or no matching item, this item will be hidden unless you explicitly show it with `visible: true`. object object string style colorbars Sets a tick label prefix. enumerated all all style colorbars If *all*, all tick labels are displayed with a prefix. If *first*, only the first tick is displayed with a prefix. If *last*, only the last tick is displayed with a suffix. If *none*, tick prefixes are hidden. string style colorbars Sets a tick label suffix. enumerated all all style colorbars Same as `showtickprefix` but for tick suffixes. boolean FALSE style colorbars If "true", even 4-digit integers are separated enumerated none B style colorbars Determines a formatting rule for the tick exponents. For example, consider the number 1,000,000,000. If *none*, it appears as 1,000,000,000. If *e*, 1e+9. If *E*, 1E+9. If *power*, 1x10^9 (with 9 in a super script). If *SI*, 1G. If *B*, 1B. enumerated all all style colorbars If *all*, all exponents are shown besides their significands. If *first*, only the exponent of the first tick is shown. If *last*, only the exponent of the last tick is shown. If *none*, no exponents appear. string info Sets the title of the color bar. Note that before the existence of `title.text`, the title's contents used to be defined as the `title` attribute itself. This behavior has been deprecated. colorbars string style TRUE TRUE HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. colorbars number style 1 colorbars color style colorbars Sets this color bar's title font. Note that the title's font used to be set by the now deprecated `titlefont` attribute. colorbars object enumerated right style top Determines the location of color bar's title with respect to the color bar. Note that the title's location used to be set by the now deprecated `titleside` attribute. colorbars colorbars object string info Deprecated in favor of color bar's `title.text`. Note that value of color bar's `title` is no longer a simple *string* but a set of sub-attributes. colorbars string style TRUE TRUE HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. colorbars number style 1 colorbars color style colorbars Deprecated in favor of color bar's `title.font`. colorbars enumerated right style top Deprecated in favor of color bar's `title.side`. colorbars colorbars object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for tickvals . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for ticktext . none calc object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for color . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for ids . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for customdata . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for hoverinfo . none Parallel categories diagram for multidimensional categorical data. parcats enumerated TRUE info TRUE calc Determines whether or not this trace is visible. If *legendonly*, the trace is not drawn, but can appear as a legend item (provided that the legend itself is visible). string info style Sets the trace name. The trace name appear as the legend item and on hover. string info plot TRUE Assign an id to this trace, Use this to provide object constancy between traces during animations and transitions. string TRUE TRUE info calc The stream id number links a data trace on a plot with a stream. See https://plot.ly/settings for more details. number 0 10000 500 info calc Sets the maximum number of points to keep on the plots from an incoming stream. If `maxpoints` is set to *50*, only the newest 50 points will be displayed on the plot. calc object calc An array of operations that manipulate the trace data, for example filtering or sorting the data arrays. object object any info none Controls persistence of some user-driven changes to the trace: `constraintrange` in `parcoords` traces, as well as some `editable: true` modifications such as `name` and `colorbar.title`. Defaults to `layout.uirevision`. Note that other user-driven trace attribute changes are controlled by `layout` attributes: `trace.visible` is controlled by `layout.legend.uirevision`, `selectedpoints` is controlled by `layout.selectionrevision`, and `colorbar.(x|y)` (accessible with `config: {editable: true}`) is controlled by `layout.editrevision`. Trace changes are tracked by `uid`, which only falls back on trace index if no `uid` is provided. So if your app can add/remove traces before the end of the `data` array, such that the same trace has a different index, you can still preserve user-driven changes if you give each trace a `uid` that stays with it as it moves. info_array info calc number 0 1 calc 0 Sets the horizontal domain of this parcats trace (in plot fraction). info_array info calc number 0 1 calc 0 Sets the vertical domain of this parcats trace (in plot fraction). calc integer 0 0 info calc If there is a layout grid, use the domain for this row in the grid for this parcats trace . integer 0 0 info calc If there is a layout grid, use the domain for this column in the grid for this parcats trace . object flaglist info count all FALSE all plot Determines which trace information appear on hover. If `none` or `skip` are set, no information is displayed upon hovering. But, if `none` is set, click and hover events are still fired. enumerated category category info plot Sets the hover interaction mode for the parcats diagram. If `category`, hover interaction take place per category. If `color`, hover interactions take place per color per category. If `dimension`, hover interactions take place across all categories per dimension. string info plot Template string used for rendering the information that appear on hover box. Note that this will override `hoverinfo`. Variables are inserted using %{variable}, for example "y: %{y}". Numbers are formatted using d3-format's syntax %{variable:d3-format}, for example "Price: %{y:$.2f}". See https://github.com/d3/d3-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format for details on the formatting syntax. The variables available in `hovertemplate` are the ones emitted as event data described at this link https://plot.ly/javascript/plotlyjs-events/#event-data. Additionally, every attributes that can be specified per-point (the ones that are `arrayOk: true`) are available. variables `count`, `probability`, `category`, `categorycount`, `colorcount` and `bandcolorcount`. Anything contained in tag `<extra>` is displayed in the secondary box, for example "<extra>{fullData.name}</extra>". To hide the secondary box completely, use an empty tag `<extra></extra>`. enumerated perpendicular perpendicular style plot Sets the drag interaction mode for categories and dimensions. If `perpendicular`, the categories can only move along a line perpendicular to the paths. If `freeform`, the categories can freely move on the plane. If `fixed`, the categories and dimensions are stationary. boolean TRUE info plot Sort paths so that like colors are bundled together within each category. enumerated forward forward info plot Sets the path sorting algorithm. If `forward`, sort paths based on dimension categories from left to right. If `backward`, sort paths based on dimensions categories from right to left. string style TRUE TRUE calc HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. number style 1 calc color style calc calc Sets the font for the `dimension` labels. object string style TRUE TRUE calc HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. number style 1 calc color style calc calc Sets the font for the `category` labels. object string info calc The shown name of the dimension. enumerated trace trace info calc Specifies the ordering logic for the categories in the dimension. By default, plotly uses *trace*, which specifies the order that is present in the data supplied. Set `categoryorder` to *category ascending* or *category descending* if order should be determined by the alphanumerical order of the category names. Set `categoryorder` to *array* to derive the ordering from the attribute `categoryarray`. If a category is not found in the `categoryarray` array, the sorting behavior for that attribute will be identical to the *trace* mode. The unspecified categories will follow the categories in `categoryarray`. data_array data calc Sets the order in which categories in this dimension appear. Only has an effect if `categoryorder` is set to *array*. Used with `categoryorder`. data_array data calc Sets alternative tick labels for the categories in this dimension. Only has an effect if `categoryorder` is set to *array*. Should be an array the same length as `categoryarray` Used with `categoryorder`. data_array data calc Dimension values. `values[n]` represents the category value of the `n`th point in the dataset, therefore the `values` vector for all dimensions must be the same (longer vectors will be truncated). integer info calc The display index of dimension, from left to right, zero indexed, defaults to dimension index. calc The dimensions (variables) of the parallel categories diagram. boolean TRUE info calc Shows the dimension when set to `true` (the default). Hides the dimension for `false`. object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for categoryarray . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for ticktext . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for values . none object calc color TRUE style style Sets thelinecolor. It accepts either a specific color or an array of numbers that are mapped to the colorscale relative to the max and min values of the array or relative to `line.cmin` and `line.cmax` if set. boolean info TRUE calc Determines whether or not the color domain is computed with respect to the input data (here in `line.color`) or the bounds set in `line.cmin` and `line.cmax` Has an effect only if in `line.color`is set to a numerical array. Defaults to `false` when `line.cmin` and `line.cmax` are set by the user. number info plot FALSE Sets the lower bound of the color domain. Has an effect only if in `line.color`is set to a numerical array. Value should have the same units as in `line.color` and if set, `line.cmax` must be set as well. number info plot FALSE Sets the upper bound of the color domain. Has an effect only if in `line.color`is set to a numerical array. Value should have the same units as in `line.color` and if set, `line.cmin` must be set as well. number info calc Sets the mid-point of the color domain by scaling `line.cmin` and/or `line.cmax` to be equidistant to this point. Has an effect only if in `line.color`is set to a numerical array. Value should have the same units as in `line.color`. Has no effect when `line.cauto` is `false`. colorscale style calc FALSE Sets the colorscale. Has an effect only if in `line.color`is set to a numerical array. The colorscale must be an array containing arrays mapping a normalized value to an rgb, rgba, hex, hsl, hsv, or named color string. At minimum, a mapping for the lowest (0) and highest (1) values are required. For example, `[[0, 'rgb(0,0,255)', [1, 'rgb(255,0,0)']]`. To control the bounds of the colorscale in color space, use`line.cmin` and `line.cmax`. Alternatively, `colorscale` may be a palette name string of the following list: Greys,YlGnBu,Greens,YlOrRd,Bluered,RdBu,Reds,Blues,Picnic,Rainbow,Portland,Jet,Hot,Blackbody,Earth,Electric,Viridis,Cividis. boolean style TRUE calc Determines whether the colorscale is a default palette (`autocolorscale: true`) or the palette determined by `line.colorscale`. Has an effect only if in `line.color`is set to a numerical array. In case `colorscale` is unspecified or `autocolorscale` is true, the default palette will be chosen according to whether numbers in the `color` array are all positive, all negative or mixed. boolean style FALSE plot Reverses the color mapping if true. Has an effect only if in `line.color`is set to a numerical array. If true, `line.cmin` will correspond to the last color in the array and `line.cmax` will correspond to the first color. boolean info FALSE calc Determines whether or not a colorbar is displayed for this trace. Has an effect only if in `line.color`is set to a numerical array. enumerated fraction style pixels Determines whether this color bar's thickness (i.e. the measure in the constant color direction) is set in units of plot *fraction* or in *pixels*. Use `thickness` to set the value. colorbars number style 0 30 Sets the thickness of the color bar This measure excludes the size of the padding, ticks and labels. colorbars enumerated fraction info fraction Determines whether this color bar's length (i.e. the measure in the color variation direction) is set in units of plot *fraction* or in *pixels. Use `len` to set the value. colorbars number 0 1 style Sets the length of the color bar This measure excludes the padding of both ends. That is, the color bar length is this length minus the padding on both ends. colorbars number 1.02 -2 3 style Sets the x position of the color bar (in plot fraction). colorbars enumerated left left style Sets this color bar's horizontal position anchor. This anchor binds the `x` position to the *left*, *center* or *right* of the color bar. colorbars number style 0 10 Sets the amount of padding (in px) along the x direction. colorbars number style 0.5 -2 3 Sets the y position of the color bar (in plot fraction). colorbars enumerated top style middle Sets this color bar's vertical position anchor This anchor binds the `y` position to the *top*, *middle* or *bottom* of the color bar. colorbars number style 0 10 Sets the amount of padding (in px) along the y direction. colorbars color #444 style colorbars Sets the axis line color. number 0 1 style colorbars Sets the width (in px) of the axis line. color #444 style colorbars Sets the axis line color. number style 0 0 Sets the width (in px) or the border enclosing this color bar. colorbars color style rgba(0,0,0,0) Sets the color of padded area. colorbars enumerated auto info colorbars Sets the tick mode for this axis. If *auto*, the number of ticks is set via `nticks`. If *linear*, the placement of the ticks is determined by a starting position `tick0` and a tick step `dtick` (*linear* is the default value if `tick0` and `dtick` are provided). If *array*, the placement of the ticks is set via `tickvals` and the tick text is `ticktext`. (*array* is the default value if `tickvals` is provided). integer 0 0 style colorbars Specifies the maximum number of ticks for the particular axis. The actual number of ticks will be chosen automatically to be less than or equal to `nticks`. Has an effect only if `tickmode` is set to *auto*. any style colorbars linear Sets the placement of the first tick on this axis. Use with `dtick`. If the axis `type` is *log*, then you must take the log of your starting tick (e.g. to set the starting tick to 100, set the `tick0` to 2) except when `dtick`=*L<f>* (see `dtick` for more info). If the axis `type` is *date*, it should be a date string, like date data. If the axis `type` is *category*, it should be a number, using the scale where each category is assigned a serial number from zero in the order it appears. any style colorbars linear Sets the step in-between ticks on this axis. Use with `tick0`. Must be a positive number, or special strings available to *log* and *date* axes. If the axis `type` is *log*, then ticks are set every 10^(n*dtick) where n is the tick number. For example, to set a tick mark at 1, 10, 100, 1000, ... set dtick to 1. To set tick marks at 1, 100, 10000, ... set dtick to 2. To set tick marks at 1, 5, 25, 125, 625, 3125, ... set dtick to log_10(5), or 0.69897000433. *log* has several special values; *L<f>*, where `f` is a positive number, gives ticks linearly spaced in value (but not position). For example `tick0` = 0.1, `dtick` = *L0.5* will put ticks at 0.1, 0.6, 1.1, 1.6 etc. To show powers of 10 plus small digits between, use *D1* (all digits) or *D2* (only 2 and 5). `tick0` is ignored for *D1* and *D2*. If the axis `type` is *date*, then you must convert the time to milliseconds. For example, to set the interval between ticks to one day, set `dtick` to 86400000.0. *date* also has special values *M<n>* gives ticks spaced by a number of months. `n` must be a positive integer. To set ticks on the 15th of every third month, set `tick0` to *2000-01-15* and `dtick` to *M3*. To set ticks every 4 years, set `dtick` to *M48* data_array colorbars Sets the values at which ticks on this axis appear. Only has an effect if `tickmode` is set to *array*. Used with `ticktext`. data data_array colorbars Sets the text displayed at the ticks position via `tickvals`. Only has an effect if `tickmode` is set to *array*. Used with `tickvals`. data enumerated outside style colorbars Determines whether ticks are drawn or not. If **, this axis' ticks are not drawn. If *outside* (*inside*), this axis' are drawn outside (inside) the axis lines. number 0 5 style colorbars Sets the tick length (in px). number 0 1 style colorbars Sets the tick width (in px). color #444 style colorbars Sets the tick color. boolean TRUE style colorbars Determines whether or not the tick labels are drawn. string style TRUE TRUE HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. colorbars number style 1 colorbars color style colorbars Sets the color bar's tick label font colorbars object angle auto style colorbars Sets the angle of the tick labels with respect to the horizontal. For example, a `tickangle` of -90 draws the tick labels vertically. string style colorbars Sets the tick label formatting rule using d3 formatting mini-languages which are very similar to those in Python. For numbers, see: https://github.com/d3/d3-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format And for dates see: https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format We add one item to d3's date formatter: *%{n}f* for fractional seconds with n digits. For example, *2016-10-13 09:15:23.456* with tickformat *%H~%M~%S.%2f* would display *09~15~23.46* boolean info TRUE colorbars Determines whether or not this stop is used. If `false`, this stop is ignored even within its `dtickrange`. info_array info any colorbars colorbars range [*min*, *max*], where *min*, *max* - dtick values which describe some zoom level, it is possible to omit *min* or *max* value by passing *null* string style colorbars string - dtickformat for described zoom level, the same as *tickformat* colorbars string style colorbars When used in a template, named items are created in the output figure in addition to any items the figure already has in this array. You can modify these items in the output figure by making your own item with `templateitemname` matching this `name` alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). Has no effect outside of a template. string info colorbars Used to refer to a named item in this array in the template. Named items from the template will be created even without a matching item in the input figure, but you can modify one by making an item with `templateitemname` matching its `name`, alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). If there is no template or no matching item, this item will be hidden unless you explicitly show it with `visible: true`. object object string style colorbars Sets a tick label prefix. enumerated all all style colorbars If *all*, all tick labels are displayed with a prefix. If *first*, only the first tick is displayed with a prefix. If *last*, only the last tick is displayed with a suffix. If *none*, tick prefixes are hidden. string style colorbars Sets a tick label suffix. enumerated all all style colorbars Same as `showtickprefix` but for tick suffixes. boolean FALSE style colorbars If "true", even 4-digit integers are separated enumerated none B style colorbars Determines a formatting rule for the tick exponents. For example, consider the number 1,000,000,000. If *none*, it appears as 1,000,000,000. If *e*, 1e+9. If *E*, 1E+9. If *power*, 1x10^9 (with 9 in a super script). If *SI*, 1G. If *B*, 1B. enumerated all all style colorbars If *all*, all exponents are shown besides their significands. If *first*, only the exponent of the first tick is shown. If *last*, only the exponent of the last tick is shown. If *none*, no exponents appear. string info Sets the title of the color bar. Note that before the existence of `title.text`, the title's contents used to be defined as the `title` attribute itself. This behavior has been deprecated. colorbars string style TRUE TRUE HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. colorbars number style 1 colorbars color style colorbars Sets this color bar's title font. Note that the title's font used to be set by the now deprecated `titlefont` attribute. colorbars object enumerated right style top Determines the location of color bar's title with respect to the color bar. Note that the title's location used to be set by the now deprecated `titleside` attribute. colorbars colorbars object string info Deprecated in favor of color bar's `title.text`. Note that value of color bar's `title` is no longer a simple *string* but a set of sub-attributes. colorbars string style TRUE TRUE HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. colorbars number style 1 colorbars color style colorbars Deprecated in favor of color bar's `title.font`. colorbars enumerated right style top Deprecated in favor of color bar's `title.side`. colorbars colorbars object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for tickvals . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for ticktext . none enumerated linear linear info plot Sets the shape of the paths. If `linear`, paths are composed of straight lines. If `hspline`, paths are composed of horizontal curved splines string info plot Template string used for rendering the information that appear on hover box. Note that this will override `hoverinfo`. Variables are inserted using %{variable}, for example "y: %{y}". Numbers are formatted using d3-format's syntax %{variable:d3-format}, for example "Price: %{y:$.2f}". See https://github.com/d3/d3-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format for details on the formatting syntax. The variables available in `hovertemplate` are the ones emitted as event data described at this link https://plot.ly/javascript/plotlyjs-events/#event-data. Additionally, every attributes that can be specified per-point (the ones that are `arrayOk: true`) are available. variables `count` and `probability`. Anything contained in tag `<extra>` is displayed in the secondary box, for example "<extra>{fullData.name}</extra>". To hide the secondary box completely, use an empty tag `<extra></extra>`. object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for color . none number 0 1 TRUE info calc The number of observations represented by each state. Defaults to 1 so that each state represents one observation string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for counts . none scatter_mapbox The data visualized as scatter point, lines or marker symbols on a Mapbox GL geographic map is provided by longitude/latitude pairs in `lon` and `lat`. scattermapbox enumerated TRUE info TRUE calc Determines whether or not this trace is visible. If *legendonly*, the trace is not drawn, but can appear as a legend item (provided that the legend itself is visible). boolean info TRUE style Determines whether or not an item corresponding to this trace is shown in the legend. string info style Sets the legend group for this trace. Traces part of the same legend group hide/show at the same time when toggling legend items. number style 0 1 1 style Sets the opacity of the trace. string info style Sets the trace name. The trace name appear as the legend item and on hover. string info plot TRUE Assign an id to this trace, Use this to provide object constancy between traces during animations and transitions. data_array calc TRUE Assigns id labels to each datum. These ids for object constancy of data points during animation. Should be an array of strings, not numbers or any other type. data data_array calc Assigns extra data each datum. This may be useful when listening to hover, click and selection events. Note that, *scatter* traces also appends customdata items in the markers DOM elements data any info calc Array containing integer indices of selected points. Has an effect only for traces that support selections. Note that an empty array means an empty selection where the `unselected` are turned on for all points, whereas, any other non-array values means no selection all where the `selected` and `unselected` styles have no effect. color style TRUE none Sets the background color of the hover labels for this trace color style TRUE none Sets the border color of the hover labels for this trace. string style TRUE TRUE none HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. TRUE number style 1 none TRUE color style none TRUE none Sets the font used in hover labels. object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for family . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for size . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for color . none integer -1 TRUE style none Sets the length (in number of characters) of the trace name in the hover labels for this trace. -1 shows the whole name regardless of length. 0-3 shows the first 0-3 characters, and an integer >3 will show the whole name if it is less than that many characters, but if it is longer, will truncate to `namelength - 3` characters and add an ellipsis. calc object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for bgcolor . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for bordercolor . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for namelength . none string TRUE TRUE info calc The stream id number links a data trace on a plot with a stream. See https://plot.ly/settings for more details. number 0 10000 500 info calc Sets the maximum number of points to keep on the plots from an incoming stream. If `maxpoints` is set to *50*, only the newest 50 points will be displayed on the plot. calc object calc An array of operations that manipulate the trace data, for example filtering or sorting the data arrays. object object any info none Controls persistence of some user-driven changes to the trace: `constraintrange` in `parcoords` traces, as well as some `editable: true` modifications such as `name` and `colorbar.title`. Defaults to `layout.uirevision`. Note that other user-driven trace attribute changes are controlled by `layout` attributes: `trace.visible` is controlled by `layout.legend.uirevision`, `selectedpoints` is controlled by `layout.selectionrevision`, and `colorbar.(x|y)` (accessible with `config: {editable: true}`) is controlled by `layout.editrevision`. Trace changes are tracked by `uid`, which only falls back on trace index if no `uid` is provided. So if your app can add/remove traces before the end of the `data` array, such that the same trace has a different index, you can still preserve user-driven changes if you give each trace a `uid` that stays with it as it moves. data_array Sets the longitude coordinates (in degrees East). calc data data_array Sets the latitude coordinates (in degrees North). calc data flaglist lines none info calc Determines the drawing mode for this scatter trace. If the provided `mode` includes *text* then the `text` elements appear at the coordinates. Otherwise, the `text` elements appear on hover. markers string info TRUE calc Sets text elements associated with each (lon,lat) pair If a single string, the same string appears over all the data points. If an array of string, the items are mapped in order to the this trace's (lon,lat) coordinates. If trace `hoverinfo` contains a *text* flag and *hovertext* is not set, these elements will be seen in the hover labels. string info TRUE calc Sets hover text elements associated with each (lon,lat) pair If a single string, the same string appears over all the data points. If an array of string, the items are mapped in order to the this trace's (lon,lat) coordinates. To be seen, trace `hoverinfo` must contain a *text* flag. color style calc TRUE Sets the line color. number 0 2 style calc TRUE Sets the line width (in px). calc object boolean FALSE info calc Determines whether or not gaps (i.e. {nan} or missing values) in the provided data arrays are connected. string circle style TRUE Sets the marker symbol. Full list: https://www.mapbox.com/maki-icons/ Note that the array `marker.color` and `marker.size` are only available for *circle* symbols. calc number 0 1 TRUE style calc TRUE Sets the marker opacity. number 0 6 TRUE style calc TRUE Sets the marker size (in px). number 1 style calc Has an effect only if `marker.size` is set to a numerical array. Sets the scale factor used to determine the rendered size of marker points. Use with `sizemin` and `sizemode`. number 0 0 style calc Has an effect only if `marker.size` is set to a numerical array. Sets the minimum size (in px) of the rendered marker points. enumerated diameter diameter info calc Has an effect only if `marker.size` is set to a numerical array. Sets the rule for which the data in `size` is converted to pixels. color TRUE style calc Sets themarkercolor. It accepts either a specific color or an array of numbers that are mapped to the colorscale relative to the max and min values of the array or relative to `marker.cmin` and `marker.cmax` if set. colorscale style calc FALSE Sets the colorscale. Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. The colorscale must be an array containing arrays mapping a normalized value to an rgb, rgba, hex, hsl, hsv, or named color string. At minimum, a mapping for the lowest (0) and highest (1) values are required. For example, `[[0, 'rgb(0,0,255)', [1, 'rgb(255,0,0)']]`. To control the bounds of the colorscale in color space, use`marker.cmin` and `marker.cmax`. Alternatively, `colorscale` may be a palette name string of the following list: Greys,YlGnBu,Greens,YlOrRd,Bluered,RdBu,Reds,Blues,Picnic,Rainbow,Portland,Jet,Hot,Blackbody,Earth,Electric,Viridis,Cividis. boolean info TRUE calc Determines whether or not the color domain is computed with respect to the input data (here in `marker.color`) or the bounds set in `marker.cmin` and `marker.cmax` Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. Defaults to `false` when `marker.cmin` and `marker.cmax` are set by the user. number info calc FALSE Sets the upper bound of the color domain. Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. Value should have the same units as in `marker.color` and if set, `marker.cmin` must be set as well. number info calc FALSE Sets the lower bound of the color domain. Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. Value should have the same units as in `marker.color` and if set, `marker.cmax` must be set as well. number info calc Sets the mid-point of the color domain by scaling `marker.cmin` and/or `marker.cmax` to be equidistant to this point. Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. Value should have the same units as in `marker.color`. Has no effect when `marker.cauto` is `false`. boolean style TRUE calc Determines whether the colorscale is a default palette (`autocolorscale: true`) or the palette determined by `marker.colorscale`. Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. In case `colorscale` is unspecified or `autocolorscale` is true, the default palette will be chosen according to whether numbers in the `color` array are all positive, all negative or mixed. boolean style FALSE calc Reverses the color mapping if true. Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. If true, `marker.cmin` will correspond to the last color in the array and `marker.cmax` will correspond to the first color. boolean info FALSE calc Determines whether or not a colorbar is displayed for this trace. Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. enumerated fraction style pixels Determines whether this color bar's thickness (i.e. the measure in the constant color direction) is set in units of plot *fraction* or in *pixels*. Use `thickness` to set the value. calc number style 0 30 Sets the thickness of the color bar This measure excludes the size of the padding, ticks and labels. calc enumerated fraction info fraction Determines whether this color bar's length (i.e. the measure in the color variation direction) is set in units of plot *fraction* or in *pixels. If the axis `type` is *log*, then you must take the log of your starting tick (e.g. to set the starting tick to 100, set the `tick0` to 2) except when `dtick`=*L<f>* (see `dtick` for more info). If the axis `type` is *category*, it should be a number, using the scale where each category is assigned a serial number from zero in the order it appears. any style calc linear Sets the step in-between ticks on this axis. Use with `tick0`. Must be a positive number, or special strings available to *log* and *date* axes. If the axis `type` is *log*, then ticks are set every 10^(n*dtick) where n is the tick number. For example, to set a tick mark at 1, 10, 100, 1000, ... set dtick to 1. To set tick marks at 1, 100, 10000, ... set dtick to 2. To set tick marks at 1, 5, 25, 125, 625, 3125, ... set dtick to log_10(5), or 0.69897000433. *log* has several special values; *L<f>*, where `f` is a positive number, gives ticks linearly spaced in value (but not position). For example `tick0` = 0.1, `dtick` = *L0.5* will put ticks at 0.1, 0.6, 1.1, 1.6 etc. To show powers of 10 plus small digits between, use *D1* (all digits) or *D2* (only 2 and 5). `tick0` is ignored for *D1* and *D2*. If the axis `type` is *date*, then you must convert the time to milliseconds. For example, to set the interval between ticks to one day, set `dtick` to 86400000.0. *date* also has special values *M<n>* gives ticks spaced by a number of months. `n` must be a positive integer. To set ticks on the 15th of every third month, set `tick0` to *2000-01-15* and `dtick` to *M3*. If *first*, only the first tick is displayed with a prefix. If *last*, only the last tick is displayed with a suffix. If *none*, tick prefixes are hidden. string style calc Sets a tick label suffix. enumerated all all style calc Same as `showtickprefix` but for tick suffixes. boolean FALSE style calc If "true", even 4-digit integers are separated enumerated none B style calc Determines a formatting rule for the tick exponents. For example, consider the number 1,000,000,000. If *none*, it appears as 1,000,000,000. If *e*, 1e+9. If *E*, 1E+9. If *power*, 1x10^9 (with 9 in a super script). If *SI*, 1G. If *B*, 1B. enumerated all all style calc If *all*, all exponents are shown besides their significands. If *first*, only the exponent of the first tick is shown. If *last*, only the exponent of the last tick is shown. If *none*, no exponents appear. string info Sets the title of the color bar. Note that before the existence of `title.text`, the title's contents used to be defined as the `title` attribute itself. This behavior has been deprecated. calc string style TRUE TRUE HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. calc number style 1 calc color style calc Sets this color bar's title font. Note that the title's font used to be set by the now deprecated `titlefont` attribute. calc object enumerated right style top Determines the location of color bar's title with respect to the color bar. Note that the title's location used to be set by the now deprecated `titleside` attribute. calc calc object string info Deprecated in favor of color bar's `title.text`. Note that value of color bar's `title` is no longer a simple *string* but a set of sub-attributes. calc string style TRUE TRUE HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. calc number style 1 calc color style calc Deprecated in favor of color bar's `title.font`. calc enumerated right style top Deprecated in favor of color bar's `title.side`. calc calc object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for tickvals . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for ticktext . none calc object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for symbol . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for opacity . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for size . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for color . none enumerated none none style Sets the area to fill with a solid color. Use with `fillcolor` if not *none*. *toself* connects the endpoints of the trace (or each segment of the trace if it has gaps) into a closed shape. calc color style calc TRUE Sets the fill color. Defaults to a half-transparent variant of the line color, marker color, or marker line color, whichever is available. string style TRUE TRUE HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. Open Sans Regular, Arial Unicode MS Regular calc number style 1 calc color style calc Sets the icon text font (color=mapbox.layer.paint.text-color, size=mapbox.layer.layout.text-size). Has an effect only when `type` is set to *symbol*. calc object enumerated top left middle center FALSE style calc Sets the positions of the `text` elements with respects to the (x,y) coordinates. number 0 1 style calc Sets the marker opacity of selected points. color style calc Sets the marker color of selected points. number 0 style calc Sets the marker size of selected points. calc object calc object number 0 1 style calc Sets the marker opacity of unselected points, applied only when a selection exists. color style calc Sets the marker color of unselected points, applied only when a selection exists. number 0 style calc Sets the marker size of unselected points, applied only when a selection exists. calc object calc object flaglist info lon all TRUE all calc Determines which trace information appear on hover. If `none` or `skip` are set, no information is displayed upon hovering. But, if `none` is set, click and hover events are still fired. string info calc Template string used for rendering the information that appear on hover box. Note that this will override `hoverinfo`. Variables are inserted using %{variable}, for example "y: %{y}". Numbers are formatted using d3-format's syntax %{variable:d3-format}, for example "Price: %{y:$.2f}". See https://github.com/d3/d3-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format for details on the formatting syntax. The variables available in `hovertemplate` are the ones emitted as event data described at this link https://plot.ly/javascript/plotlyjs-events/#event-data. Additionally, every attributes that can be specified per-point (the ones that are `arrayOk: true`) are available. Anything contained in tag `<extra>` is displayed in the secondary box, for example "<extra>{fullData.name}</extra>". To hide the secondary box completely, use an empty tag `<extra></extra>`. TRUE subplotid info mapbox calc Sets a reference between this trace's data coordinates and a mapbox subplot. If *mapbox* (the default value), the data refer to `layout.mapbox`. If *mapbox2*, the data refer to `layout.mapbox2`, and so on. string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for ids . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for customdata . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for lon . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for lat . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for text . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for hovertext . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for hoverinfo . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for hovertemplate . none Sankey plots for network flow data analysis. The nodes are specified in `nodes` and the links between sources and targets in `links`. The colors are set in `nodes[i].color` and `links[i].color`; otherwise defaults are used. sankey enumerated TRUE info TRUE calc Determines whether or not this trace is visible. If *legendonly*, the trace is not drawn, but can appear as a legend item (provided that the legend itself is visible). boolean info TRUE style Determines whether or not an item corresponding to this trace is shown in the legend. string info style Sets the legend group for this trace. Traces part of the same legend group hide/show at the same time when toggling legend items. number style 0 1 1 style Sets the opacity of the trace. string info style Sets the trace name. The trace name appear as the legend item and on hover. string info plot TRUE Assign an id to this trace, Use this to provide object constancy between traces during animations and transitions. data_array calc TRUE Assigns id labels to each datum. These ids for object constancy of data points during animation. Should be an array of strings, not numbers or any other type. data data_array calc Assigns extra data each datum. This may be useful when listening to hover, click and selection events. Note that, *scatter* traces also appends customdata items in the markers DOM elements data any info calc Array containing integer indices of selected points. Has an effect only for traces that support selections. Note that an empty array means an empty selection where the `unselected` are turned on for all points, whereas, any other non-array values means no selection all where the `selected` and `unselected` styles have no effect. string TRUE TRUE info calc The stream id number links a data trace on a plot with a stream. See https://plot.ly/settings for more details. number 0 10000 500 info calc Sets the maximum number of points to keep on the plots from an incoming stream. If `maxpoints` is set to *50*, only the newest 50 points will be displayed on the plot. calc object any info none Controls persistence of some user-driven changes to the trace: `constraintrange` in `parcoords` traces, as well as some `editable: true` modifications such as `name` and `colorbar.title`. Defaults to `layout.uirevision`. Note that other user-driven trace attribute changes are controlled by `layout` attributes: `trace.visible` is controlled by `layout.legend.uirevision`, `selectedpoints` is controlled by `layout.selectionrevision`, and `colorbar.(x|y)` (accessible with `config: {editable: true}`) is controlled by `layout.editrevision`. Trace changes are tracked by `uid`, which only falls back on trace index if no `uid` is provided. So if your app can add/remove traces before the end of the `data` array, such that the same trace has a different index, you can still preserve user-driven changes if you give each trace a `uid` that stays with it as it moves. flaglist info all FALSE all calc Determines which trace information appear on hover. If `none` or `skip` are set, no information is displayed upon hovering. But, if `none` is set, click and hover events are still fired. Note that this attribute is superseded by `node.hoverinfo` and `node.hoverinfo` for nodes and links respectively. color style TRUE calc Sets the background color of the hover labels for this trace color style TRUE calc Sets the border color of the hover labels for this trace. string style TRUE TRUE calc HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. TRUE number style 1 calc TRUE color style calc TRUE calc Sets the font used in hover labels. object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for family . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for size . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for color . none integer -1 TRUE style calc Sets the length (in number of characters) of the trace name in the hover labels for this trace. -1 shows the whole name regardless of length. 0-3 shows the first 0-3 characters, and an integer >3 will show the whole name if it is less than that many characters, but if it is longer, will truncate to `namelength - 3` characters and add an ellipsis. calc object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for bgcolor . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for bordercolor . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for namelength . none info_array info number 0 1 calc 0 Sets the horizontal domain of this sankey trace (in plot fraction). calc info_array info number 0 1 calc 0 Sets the vertical domain of this sankey trace (in plot fraction). calc integer 0 0 info If there is a layout grid, use the domain for this row in the grid for this sankey trace . calc integer 0 0 info If there is a layout grid, use the domain for this column in the grid for this sankey trace . calc calc object enumerated v h style Sets the orientation of the Sankey diagram. calc string .3s style Sets the value formatting rule using d3 formatting mini-language which is similar to those of Python. See https://github.com/d3/d3-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format calc string style Adds a unit to follow the value in the hover tooltip. Add a space if a separation is necessary from the value. calc enumerated snap snap style If value is `snap` (the default), the node arrangement is assisted by automatic snapping of elements to preserve space between nodes specified via `nodepad`. If value is `perpendicular`, the nodes can only move along a line perpendicular to the flow. If value is `freeform`, the nodes can freely move on the plane. If value is `fixed`, the nodes are stationary. calc string style TRUE TRUE HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Each group is defined by an array with the indices of the nodes it contains. Multiple groups can be specified. calc data_array data The normalized horizontal position of the node. calc data_array data The normalized vertical position of the node. calc color style TRUE Sets the `node` color. It can be a single value, or an array for specifying color for each `node`. If `node.color` is omitted, then the default `Plotly` color palette will be cycled through to have a variety of colors. These defaults are not fully opaque, to allow some visibility of what is beneath the node. calc color style #444 TRUE Sets the color of the `line` around each `node`. calc number style 0 0.5 TRUE Sets the width (in px) of the `line` around each `node`. calc calc object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for color . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for width . none number FALSE 0 20 style Sets the padding (in px) between the `nodes`. calc number FALSE 1 20 style Sets the thickness (in px) of the `nodes`. calc enumerated all all info Determines which trace information appear when hovering nodes. TRUE calc string info calc The label of the links to color based on their concentration within a flow. number info calc 1 Sets the upper bound of the color domain. number info calc 0 Sets the lower bound of the color domain. colorscale style calc 0 FALSE Sets the colorscale. The colorscale must be an array containing arrays mapping a normalized value to an rgb, rgba, hex, hsl, hsv, or named color string. At minimum, a mapping for the lowest (0) and highest (1) values are required. For example, `[[0, 'rgb(0,0,255)', [1, 'rgb(255,0,0)']]`. To control the bounds of the colorscale in color space, use`cmin` and `cmax`. Alternatively, `colorscale` may be a palette name string of the following list: Greys,YlGnBu,Greens,YlOrRd,Bluered,RdBu,Reds,Blues,Picnic,Rainbow,Portland,Jet,Hot,Blackbody,Earth,Electric,Viridis,Cividis. string style calc When used in a template, named items are created in the output figure in addition to any items the figure already has in this array. You can modify these items in the output figure by making your own item with `templateitemname` matching this `name` alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). Has no effect outside of a template. string info calc Used to refer to a named item in this array in the template. Named items from the template will be created even without a matching item in the input figure, but you can modify one by making an item with `templateitemname` matching its `name`, alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). If there is no template or no matching item, this item will be hidden unless you explicitly show it with `visible: true`. object object The links of the Sankey plot. object calc string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for label . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for color . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for source . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for target . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for value . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for hovertemplate . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for ids . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for customdata . none Table view for detailed data viewing. The data are arranged in a grid of rows and columns. Most styling can be specified for columns, rows or individual cells. Table is using a column-major order, ie. the grid is represented as a vector of column vectors. table enumerated TRUE info TRUE calc Determines whether or not this trace is visible.
