See https://plot.ly/settings for more details. number 0 10000 500 info calc Sets the maximum number of points to keep on the plots from an incoming stream. If `maxpoints` is set to *50*, only the newest 50 points will be displayed on the plot. calc object any info none Controls persistence of some user-driven changes to the trace: `constraintrange` in `parcoords` traces, as well as some `editable: true` modifications such as `name` and `colorbar.title`. Defaults to `layout.uirevision`. Note that other user-driven trace attribute changes are controlled by `layout` attributes: `trace.visible` is controlled by `layout.legend.uirevision`, `selectedpoints` is controlled by `layout.selectionrevision`, and `colorbar.(x|y)` (accessible with `config: {editable: true}`) is controlled by `layout.editrevision`. Trace changes are tracked by `uid`, which only falls back on trace index if no `uid` is provided. So if your app can add/remove traces before the end of the `data` array, such that the same trace has a different index, you can still preserve user-driven changes if you give each trace a `uid` that stays with it as it moves. info_array info number 0 1 calc 0 Sets the horizontal domain of this table trace (in plot fraction). calc info_array info number 0 1 calc 0 Sets the vertical domain of this table trace (in plot fraction). calc integer 0 0 info If there is a layout grid, use the domain for this row in the grid for this table trace . calc integer 0 0 info If there is a layout grid, use the domain for this column in the grid for this table trace . calc calc object number TRUE style The width of columns expressed as a ratio. Columns fill the available width in proportion of their specified column widths. calc data_array data Specifies the rendered order of the data columns; for example, a value `2` at position `0` means that column index `0` in the data will be rendered as the third column, as columns have an index base of zero. calc data_array data Header cell values. `values[m][n]` represents the value of the `n`th point in column `m`, therefore the `values[m]` vector length for all columns must be the same (longer vectors will be truncated). Each value must be a finite number or a string. calc data_array data Sets the cell value formatting rule using d3 formatting mini-language which is similar to those of Python. See https://github.com/d3/d3-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format calc string TRUE style Prefix for cell values. calc string TRUE style Suffix for cell values. calc number 28 style The height of cells. calc enumerated left center style calc Sets the horizontal alignment of the `text` within the box. Has an effect only if `text` spans more two or more lines (i.e. `text` contains one or more <br> HTML tags) or if an explicit width is set to override the text width. TRUE number TRUE 1 style calc color TRUE grey style calc calc object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for width . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for color . none color TRUE white style Sets the cell fill color. It accepts either a specific color or an array of colors or a 2D array of colors. calc calc object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for color . none string style TRUE TRUE HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Each value must be a finite number or a string. calc data_array data Sets the cell value formatting rule using d3 formatting mini-language which is similar to those of Python. See https://github.com/d3/d3-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format calc string TRUE style Prefix for cell values. calc string TRUE style Suffix for cell values. calc number 20 style The height of cells. calc enumerated left center style calc Sets the horizontal alignment of the `text` within the box. Has an effect only if `text` spans more two or more lines (i.e. `text` contains one or more <br> HTML tags) or if an explicit width is set to override the text width. TRUE number TRUE 1 style calc color TRUE grey style calc calc object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for width . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for color . none color TRUE style white Sets the cell fill color. It accepts either a specific color or an array of colors or a 2D array of colors. calc calc object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for color . none string style TRUE TRUE HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. TRUE calc number style 1 TRUE calc color style TRUE calc calc object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for family . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for size . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for color . none calc object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for values . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for format . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for prefix . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for suffix . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for align . none calc string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for ids . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for customdata . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for hoverinfo . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for columnwidth . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for columnorder . none The data describing carpet axis layout is set in `y` and (optionally) also `x`. If only `y` is present, `x` the plot is interpreted as a cheater plot and is filled in using the `y` values. `x` and `y` may either be 2D arrays matching with each dimension matching that of `a` and `b`, or they may be 1D arrays with total length equal to that of `a` and `b`. carpet enumerated TRUE info TRUE calc Determines whether or not this trace is visible. If *legendonly*, the trace is not drawn, but can appear as a legend item (provided that the legend itself is visible). boolean info TRUE style Determines whether or not an item corresponding to this trace is shown in the legend. string info style Sets the legend group for this trace. Traces part of the same legend group hide/show at the same time when toggling legend items. number style 0 1 1 style Sets the opacity of the trace. string info style Sets the trace name. The trace name appear as the legend item and on hover. string info plot TRUE Assign an id to this trace, Use this to provide object constancy between traces during animations and transitions. data_array calc TRUE Assigns id labels to each datum. These ids for object constancy of data points during animation. Should be an array of strings, not numbers or any other type. data data_array calc Assigns extra data each datum. This may be useful when listening to hover, click and selection events. Note that, *scatter* traces also appends customdata items in the markers DOM elements data any info calc Array containing integer indices of selected points. Has an effect only for traces that support selections. Note that an empty array means an empty selection where the `unselected` are turned on for all points, whereas, any other non-array values means no selection all where the `selected` and `unselected` styles have no effect. flaglist info x all TRUE all none Determines which trace information appear on hover. If `none` or `skip` are set, no information is displayed upon hovering. But, if `none` is set, click and hover events are still fired. color style TRUE none Sets the background color of the hover labels for this trace color style TRUE none Sets the border color of the hover labels for this trace. string style TRUE TRUE none HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. TRUE number style 1 none TRUE color style none TRUE none Sets the font used in hover labels. object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for family . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for size . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for color . none integer -1 TRUE style none Sets the length (in number of characters) of the trace name in the hover labels for this trace. -1 shows the whole name regardless of length. 0-3 shows the first 0-3 characters, and an integer >3 will show the whole name if it is less than that many characters, but if it is longer, will truncate to `namelength - 3` characters and add an ellipsis. calc object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for bgcolor . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for bordercolor . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for namelength . none string TRUE TRUE info calc The stream id number links a data trace on a plot with a stream. See https://plot.ly/settings for more details. number 0 10000 500 info calc Sets the maximum number of points to keep on the plots from an incoming stream. If `maxpoints` is set to *50*, only the newest 50 points will be displayed on the plot. calc object any info none Controls persistence of some user-driven changes to the trace: `constraintrange` in `parcoords` traces, as well as some `editable: true` modifications such as `name` and `colorbar.title`. Defaults to `layout.uirevision`. Note that other user-driven trace attribute changes are controlled by `layout` attributes: `trace.visible` is controlled by `layout.legend.uirevision`, `selectedpoints` is controlled by `layout.selectionrevision`, and `colorbar.(x|y)` (accessible with `config: {editable: true}`) is controlled by `layout.editrevision`. Trace changes are tracked by `uid`, which only falls back on trace index if no `uid` is provided. So if your app can add/remove traces before the end of the `data` array, such that the same trace has a different index, you can still preserve user-driven changes if you give each trace a `uid` that stays with it as it moves. string info calc An identifier for this carpet, so that `scattercarpet` and `scattercontour` traces can specify a carpet plot on which they lie data_array calc+clearAxisTypes A two dimensional array of x coordinates at each carpet point. If ommitted, the plot is a cheater plot and the xaxis is hidden by default. data data_array calc+clearAxisTypes A two dimensional array of y coordinates at each carpet point. data data_array calc An array containing values of the first parameter value data number 0 info calc Alternate to `a`. Builds a linear space of a coordinates. Use with `da` where `a0` is the starting coordinate and `da` the step. number 1 info calc Sets the a coordinate step. See `a0` for more info. data_array calc A two dimensional array of y coordinates at each carpet point. data number 0 info calc Alternate to `b`. Builds a linear space of a coordinates. Use with `db` where `b0` is the starting coordinate and `db` the step. number 1 info calc Sets the b coordinate step. See `b0` for more info. number info 1 calc The shift applied to each successive row of data in creating a cheater plot. Only used if `x` is been ommitted. color style calc Sets default for all colors associated with this axis all at once: line, font, tick, and grid colors. Grid color is lightened by blending this with the plot background Individual pieces can override this. number 1 0 1.3 info calc string info calc Sets the title of this axis. Note that before the existence of `title.text`, the title's contents used to be defined as the `title` attribute itself. This behavior has been deprecated. string style TRUE TRUE calc HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. number style 1 calc color style calc calc Sets this axis' title font. Note that the title's font used to be set by the now deprecated `titlefont` attribute. object number info 10 calc An additional amount by which to offset the title from the tick labels, given in pixels. Note that this used to be set by the now deprecated `titleoffset` attribute. calc object enumerated - - info calc Sets the axis type. By default, plotly attempts to determined the axis type by looking into the data of the traces that referenced the axis in question. enumerated TRUE TRUE style calc Determines whether or not the range of this axis is computed in relation to the input data. See `rangemode` for more info. If `range` is provided, then `autorange` is set to *false*. enumerated normal normal style calc If *normal*, the range is computed in relation to the extrema of the input data. If *tozero*`, the range extends to 0, regardless of the input data If *nonnegative*, the range is non-negative, regardless of the input data. info_array info calc any calc Sets the range of this axis. If the axis `type` is *log*, then you must take the log of your desired range (e.g. to set the range from 1 to 100, set the range from 0 to 2). If the axis `type` is *date*, it should be date strings, like date data, though Date objects and unix milliseconds will be accepted and converted to strings. If the axis `type` is *category*, it should be numbers, using the scale where each category is assigned a serial number from zero in the order it appears. boolean FALSE info calc Determines whether or not this axis is zoom-able. If true, then zoom is disabled. enumerated index value info calc enumerated linear array info calc integer 0 0 style calc Specifies the maximum number of ticks for the particular axis. The actual number of ticks will be chosen automatically to be less than or equal to `nticks`. Has an effect only if `tickmode` is set to *auto*. data_array calc Sets the values at which ticks on this axis appear. Only has an effect if `tickmode` is set to *array*. Used with `ticktext`. data data_array calc Sets the text displayed at the ticks position via `tickvals`. Only has an effect if `tickmode` is set to *array*. Used with `tickvals`. data enumerated start start style calc Determines whether axis labels are drawn on the low side, the high side, both, or neither side of the axis. string style TRUE TRUE calc HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. number style 1 calc color style calc calc Sets the tick font. object angle auto style calc Sets the angle of the tick labels with respect to the horizontal. For example, a `tickangle` of -90 draws the tick labels vertically. string style calc Sets a tick label prefix. enumerated all all style calc If *all*, all tick labels are displayed with a prefix. If *first*, only the first tick is displayed with a prefix. If *last*, only the last tick is displayed with a suffix. If *none*, tick prefixes are hidden. string style calc Sets a tick label suffix. enumerated all all style calc Same as `showtickprefix` but for tick suffixes. enumerated all all style calc If *all*, all exponents are shown besides their significands. If *first*, only the exponent of the first tick is shown. If *last*, only the exponent of the last tick is shown. If *none*, no exponents appear. enumerated none B style calc Determines a formatting rule for the tick exponents. For example, consider the number 1,000,000,000. If *none*, it appears as 1,000,000,000. If *e*, 1e+9. If *E*, 1E+9. If *power*, 1x10^9 (with 9 in a super script). If *SI*, 1G. If *B*, 1B. boolean FALSE style calc If "true", even 4-digit integers are separated string style calc Sets the tick label formatting rule using d3 formatting mini-languages which are very similar to those in Python. For numbers, see: https://github.com/d3/d3-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format And for dates see: https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format We add one item to d3's date formatter: *%{n}f* for fractional seconds with n digits. For example, *2016-10-13 09:15:23.456* with tickformat *%H~%M~%S.%2f* would display *09~15~23.46* boolean info TRUE calc Determines whether or not this stop is used. If `false`, this stop is ignored even within its `dtickrange`. info_array info any calc calc range [*min*, *max*], where *min*, *max* - dtick values which describe some zoom level, it is possible to omit *min* or *max* value by passing *null* string style calc string - dtickformat for described zoom level, the same as *tickformat* calc string style calc When used in a template, named items are created in the output figure in addition to any items the figure already has in this array. You can modify these items in the output figure by making your own item with `templateitemname` matching this `name` alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). Has no effect outside of a template. string info calc Used to refer to a named item in this array in the template. Named items from the template will be created even without a matching item in the input figure, but you can modify one by making an item with `templateitemname` matching its `name`, alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). If there is no template or no matching item, this item will be hidden unless you explicitly show it with `visible: true`. object object enumerated trace trace info calc Specifies the ordering logic for the case of categorical variables. By default, plotly uses *trace*, which specifies the order that is present in the data supplied. Set `categoryorder` to *category ascending* or *category descending* if order should be determined by the alphanumerical order of the category names. Set `categoryorder` to *array* to derive the ordering from the attribute `categoryarray`. If a category is not found in the `categoryarray` array, the sorting behavior for that attribute will be identical to the *trace* mode. The unspecified categories will follow the categories in `categoryarray`. data_array data calc Sets the order in which categories on this axis appear. Only has an effect if `categoryorder` is set to *array*. Used with `categoryorder`. integer style 10 calc Extra padding between label and the axis string style calc Sets a axis label prefix. string style calc Sets a axis label suffix. boolean FALSE style calc Determines whether or not a line bounding this axis is drawn. color #444 style calc Sets the axis line color. number 0 1 style calc Sets the width (in px) of the axis line. color style calc Sets the axis line color. number 0 1 style calc Sets the width (in px) of the axis line. boolean style TRUE calc Determines whether or not grid lines are drawn. If *true*, the grid lines are drawn at every tick mark. integer 0 0 info calc Sets the number of minor grid ticks per major grid tick number 0 1 style calc Sets the width (in px) of the grid lines. color #eee style calc Sets the color of the grid lines. boolean style calc Determines whether or not a line is drawn at along the starting value of this axis. If *true*, the start line is drawn on top of the grid lines. color style calc Sets the line color of the start line. number 1 style calc Sets the width (in px) of the start line. boolean style calc Determines whether or not a line is drawn at along the final value of this axis. If *true*, the end line is drawn on top of the grid lines. number 1 style calc Sets the width (in px) of the end line. color style calc Sets the line color of the end line. number 0 0 info calc The starting index of grid lines along the axis number 0 1 info calc The stride between grid lines along the axis integer 0 0 info calc The starting index of grid lines along the axis integer 1 1 info calc The stride between grid lines along the axis string info calc Deprecated in favor of `title.text`. Note that value of `title` is no longer a simple *string* but a set of sub-attributes. string style TRUE TRUE calc HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. "Open Sans", verdana, arial, sans-serif number style 1 calc 12 color style calc #444 calc The default font used for axis & tick labels on this carpet object color #444 style plot Sets default for all colors associated with this axis all at once: line, font, tick, and grid colors. Grid color is lightened by blending this with the plot background Individual pieces can override this. subplotid info x calc+clearAxisTypes Sets a reference between this trace's x coordinates and a 2D cartesian x axis. If *x* (the default value), the x coordinates refer to `layout.xaxis`. If *x2*, the x coordinates refer to `layout.xaxis2`, and so on. subplotid info y calc+clearAxisTypes Sets a reference between this trace's y coordinates and a 2D cartesian y axis. If *y* (the default value), the y coordinates refer to `layout.yaxis`. If *y2*, the y coordinates refer to `layout.yaxis2`, and so on. string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for ids . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for customdata . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for hoverinfo . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for x . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for y . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for a . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for b . none scatter_carpet Plots a scatter trace on either the first carpet axis or the carpet axis with a matching `carpet` attribute. scattercarpet enumerated TRUE info TRUE calc Determines whether or not this trace is visible. If *legendonly*, the trace is not drawn, but can appear as a legend item (provided that the legend itself is visible). boolean info TRUE style Determines whether or not an item corresponding to this trace is shown in the legend. string info style Sets the legend group for this trace. Traces part of the same legend group hide/show at the same time when toggling legend items. number style 0 1 1 style Sets the opacity of the trace. string info style Sets the trace name. The trace name appear as the legend item and on hover. string info plot TRUE Assign an id to this trace, Use this to provide object constancy between traces during animations and transitions. data_array calc TRUE Assigns id labels to each datum. These ids for object constancy of data points during animation. Should be an array of strings, not numbers or any other type. data data_array calc Assigns extra data each datum. This may be useful when listening to hover, click and selection events. Note that, *scatter* traces also appends customdata items in the markers DOM elements data any info calc Array containing integer indices of selected points. Has an effect only for traces that support selections. Note that an empty array means an empty selection where the `unselected` are turned on for all points, whereas, any other non-array values means no selection all where the `selected` and `unselected` styles have no effect. color style TRUE none Sets the background color of the hover labels for this trace color style TRUE none Sets the border color of the hover labels for this trace. string style TRUE TRUE none HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. TRUE number style 1 none TRUE color style none TRUE none Sets the font used in hover labels. object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for family . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for size . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for color . none integer -1 TRUE style none Sets the length (in number of characters) of the trace name in the hover labels for this trace. -1 shows the whole name regardless of length. 0-3 shows the first 0-3 characters, and an integer >3 will show the whole name if it is less than that many characters, but if it is longer, will truncate to `namelength - 3` characters and add an ellipsis. calc object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for bgcolor . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for bordercolor . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for namelength . none string TRUE TRUE info calc The stream id number links a data trace on a plot with a stream. See https://plot.ly/settings for more details. number 0 10000 500 info calc Sets the maximum number of points to keep on the plots from an incoming stream. If `maxpoints` is set to *50*, only the newest 50 points will be displayed on the plot. calc object calc An array of operations that manipulate the trace data, for example filtering or sorting the data arrays. object object any info none Controls persistence of some user-driven changes to the trace: `constraintrange` in `parcoords` traces, as well as some `editable: true` modifications such as `name` and `colorbar.title`. Defaults to `layout.uirevision`. Note that other user-driven trace attribute changes are controlled by `layout` attributes: `trace.visible` is controlled by `layout.legend.uirevision`, `selectedpoints` is controlled by `layout.selectionrevision`, and `colorbar.(x|y)` (accessible with `config: {editable: true}`) is controlled by `layout.editrevision`. Trace changes are tracked by `uid`, which only falls back on trace index if no `uid` is provided. So if your app can add/remove traces before the end of the `data` array, such that the same trace has a different index, you can still preserve user-driven changes if you give each trace a `uid` that stays with it as it moves. string info calc An identifier for this carpet, so that `scattercarpet` and `scattercontour` traces can specify a carpet plot on which they lie data_array calc Sets the a-axis coordinates. data data_array calc Sets the b-axis coordinates. data flaglist lines none info calc Determines the drawing mode for this scatter trace. If the provided `mode` includes *text* then the `text` elements appear at the coordinates. Otherwise, the `text` elements appear on hover. If there are less than 20 points and the trace is not stacked then the default is *lines+markers*. Otherwise, *lines*. markers string info TRUE calc Sets text elements associated with each (a,b) point. If a single string, the same string appears over all the data points. If an array of strings, the items are mapped in order to the the data points in (a,b). If trace `hoverinfo` contains a *text* flag and *hovertext* is not set, these elements will be seen in the hover labels. string info TRUE style Sets hover text elements associated with each (a,b) point. If a single string, the same string appears over all the data points. If an array of strings, the items are mapped in order to the the data points in (a,b). To be seen, trace `hoverinfo` must contain a *text* flag. color style style TRUE Sets the line color. number 0 2 style style TRUE Sets the line width (in px). string solid solid style style Sets the dash style of lines. Set to a dash type string (*solid*, *dot*, *dash*, *longdash*, *dashdot*, or *longdashdot*) or a dash length list in px (eg *5px,10px,2px,2px*). enumerated linear linear style plot Determines the line shape. With *spline* the lines are drawn using spline interpolation. The other available values correspond to step-wise line shapes. number 0 1.3 1 style plot Has an effect only if `shape` is set to *spline* Sets the amount of smoothing. *0* corresponds to no smoothing (equivalent to a *linear* shape). calc object boolean FALSE info calc Determines whether or not gaps (i.e. {nan} or missing values) in the provided data arrays are connected. enumerated none style calc Sets the area to fill with a solid color. Use with `fillcolor` if not *none*. scatterternary has a subset of the options available to scatter. *toself* connects the endpoints of the trace (or each segment of the trace if it has gaps) into a closed shape. *tonext* fills the space between two traces if one completely encloses the other (eg consecutive contour lines), and behaves like *toself* if there is no trace before it. *tonext* should not be used if one trace does not enclose the other. none color style style TRUE Sets the fill color. Defaults to a half-transparent variant of the line color, marker color, or marker line color, whichever is available. enumerated 0 circle TRUE style style Sets the marker symbol type. Adding 100 is equivalent to appending *-open* to a symbol name. Adding 200 is equivalent to appending *-dot* to a symbol name. Adding 300 is equivalent to appending *-open-dot* or *dot-open* to a symbol name. number 0 1 TRUE style style TRUE Sets the marker opacity. number 0 0 style plot Sets a maximum number of points to be drawn on the graph. *0* corresponds to no limit. number 0 6 TRUE style calc TRUE Sets the marker size (in px). number 1 style calc Has an effect only if `marker.size` is set to a numerical array. Sets the scale factor used to determine the rendered size of marker points. Use with `sizemin` and `sizemode`. number 0 0 style calc Has an effect only if `marker.size` is set to a numerical array. Sets the minimum size (in px) of the rendered marker points. enumerated diameter diameter info calc Has an effect only if `marker.size` is set to a numerical array. Sets the rule for which the data in `size` is converted to pixels. number 0 TRUE style style TRUE Sets the width (in px) of the lines bounding the marker points. calc color TRUE style style Sets themarker.linecolor. It accepts either a specific color or an array of numbers that are mapped to the colorscale relative to the max and min values of the array or relative to `marker.line.cmin` and `marker.line.cmax` if set. boolean info TRUE calc Determines whether or not the color domain is computed with respect to the input data (here in `marker.line.color`) or the bounds set in `marker.line.cmin` and `marker.line.cmax` Has an effect only if in `marker.line.color`is set to a numerical array. Defaults to `false` when `marker.line.cmin` and `marker.line.cmax` are set by the user. number info plot FALSE Sets the lower bound of the color domain. Has an effect only if in `marker.line.color`is set to a numerical array. Value should have the same units as in `marker.line.color` and if set, `marker.line.cmax` must be set as well. number info plot FALSE Sets the upper bound of the color domain. Has an effect only if in `marker.line.color`is set to a numerical array. Value should have the same units as in `marker.line.color` and if set, `marker.line.cmin` must be set as well. number info calc Sets the mid-point of the color domain by scaling `marker.line.cmin` and/or `marker.line.cmax` to be equidistant to this point. Has an effect only if in `marker.line.color`is set to a numerical array. Value should have the same units as in `marker.line.color`. Has no effect when `marker.line.cauto` is `false`. colorscale style calc FALSE Sets the colorscale. Has an effect only if in `marker.line.color`is set to a numerical array. The colorscale must be an array containing arrays mapping a normalized value to an rgb, rgba, hex, hsl, hsv, or named color string. At minimum, a mapping for the lowest (0) and highest (1) values are required. For example, `[[0, 'rgb(0,0,255)', [1, 'rgb(255,0,0)']]`. To control the bounds of the colorscale in color space, use`marker.line.cmin` and `marker.line.cmax`. Alternatively, `colorscale` may be a palette name string of the following list: Greys,YlGnBu,Greens,YlOrRd,Bluered,RdBu,Reds,Blues,Picnic,Rainbow,Portland,Jet,Hot,Blackbody,Earth,Electric,Viridis,Cividis. boolean style TRUE calc Determines whether the colorscale is a default palette (`autocolorscale: true`) or the palette determined by `marker.line.colorscale`. Has an effect only if in `marker.line.color`is set to a numerical array. In case `colorscale` is unspecified or `autocolorscale` is true, the default palette will be chosen according to whether numbers in the `color` array are all positive, all negative or mixed. boolean style FALSE plot Reverses the color mapping if true. Has an effect only if in `marker.line.color`is set to a numerical array. If true, `marker.line.cmin` will correspond to the last color in the array and `marker.line.cmax` will correspond to the first color. object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for width . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for color . none enumerated radial TRUE none style calc Sets the type of gradient used to fill the markers color TRUE style calc Sets the final color of the gradient fill: the center color for radial, the right for horizontal, or the bottom for vertical. calc object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for type . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for color . none calc color TRUE style style Sets themarkercolor. It accepts either a specific color or an array of numbers that are mapped to the colorscale relative to the max and min values of the array or relative to `marker.cmin` and `marker.cmax` if set. boolean info TRUE calc Determines whether or not the color domain is computed with respect to the input data (here in `marker.color`) or the bounds set in `marker.cmin` and `marker.cmax` Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. Defaults to `false` when `marker.cmin` and `marker.cmax` are set by the user. number info plot FALSE Sets the lower bound of the color domain. Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. Value should have the same units as in `marker.color` and if set, `marker.cmax` must be set as well. number info plot FALSE Sets the upper bound of the color domain. Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. Value should have the same units as in `marker.color` and if set, `marker.cmin` must be set as well. number info calc Sets the mid-point of the color domain by scaling `marker.cmin` and/or `marker.cmax` to be equidistant to this point. Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. Value should have the same units as in `marker.color`. Has no effect when `marker.cauto` is `false`. colorscale style calc FALSE Sets the colorscale. Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. The colorscale must be an array containing arrays mapping a normalized value to an rgb, rgba, hex, hsl, hsv, or named color string. At minimum, a mapping for the lowest (0) and highest (1) values are required. For example, `[[0, 'rgb(0,0,255)', [1, 'rgb(255,0,0)']]`. To control the bounds of the colorscale in color space, use`marker.cmin` and `marker.cmax`. Alternatively, `colorscale` may be a palette name string of the following list: Greys,YlGnBu,Greens,YlOrRd,Bluered,RdBu,Reds,Blues,Picnic,Rainbow,Portland,Jet,Hot,Blackbody,Earth,Electric,Viridis,Cividis. boolean style TRUE calc Determines whether the colorscale is a default palette (`autocolorscale: true`) or the palette determined by `marker.colorscale`. Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. In case `colorscale` is unspecified or `autocolorscale` is true, the default palette will be chosen according to whether numbers in the `color` array are all positive, all negative or mixed. boolean style FALSE plot Reverses the color mapping if true. Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. If true, `marker.cmin` will correspond to the last color in the array and `marker.cmax` will correspond to the first color. boolean info FALSE calc Determines whether or not a colorbar is displayed for this trace. Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. enumerated fraction style pixels Determines whether this color bar's thickness (i.e. the measure in the constant color direction) is set in units of plot *fraction* or in *pixels*. Use `thickness` to set the value. colorbars number style 0 30 Sets the thickness of the color bar This measure excludes the size of the padding, ticks and labels. colorbars enumerated fraction info fraction Determines whether this color bar's length (i.e. the measure in the color variation direction) is set in units of plot *fraction* or in *pixels. Use `len` to set the value. colorbars number 0 1 style Sets the length of the color bar This measure excludes the padding of both ends. That is, the color bar length is this length minus the padding on both ends. colorbars number 1.02 -2 3 style Sets the x position of the color bar (in plot fraction). colorbars enumerated left left style Sets this color bar's horizontal position anchor. This anchor binds the `x` position to the *left*, *center* or *right* of the color bar. colorbars number style 0 10 Sets the amount of padding (in px) along the x direction. colorbars number style 0.5 -2 3 Sets the y position of the color bar (in plot fraction). colorbars enumerated top style middle Sets this color bar's vertical position anchor This anchor binds the `y` position to the *top*, *middle* or *bottom* of the color bar. colorbars number style 0 10 Sets the amount of padding (in px) along the y direction. colorbars color #444 style colorbars Sets the axis line color. number 0 1 style colorbars Sets the width (in px) of the axis line. color #444 style colorbars Sets the axis line color. number style 0 0 Sets the width (in px) or the border enclosing this color bar. colorbars color style rgba(0,0,0,0) Sets the color of padded area. colorbars enumerated auto info colorbars Sets the tick mode for this axis. If *auto*, the number of ticks is set via `nticks`. If *linear*, the placement of the ticks is determined by a starting position `tick0` and a tick step `dtick` (*linear* is the default value if `tick0` and `dtick` are provided). If *array*, the placement of the ticks is set via `tickvals` and the tick text is `ticktext`. (*array* is the default value if `tickvals` is provided). integer 0 0 style colorbars Specifies the maximum number of ticks for the particular axis. The actual number of ticks will be chosen automatically to be less than or equal to `nticks`. Has an effect only if `tickmode` is set to *auto*. any style colorbars linear Sets the placement of the first tick on this axis. Use with `dtick`. If the axis `type` is *log*, then you must take the log of your starting tick (e.g. to set the starting tick to 100, set the `tick0` to 2) except when `dtick`=*L<f>* (see `dtick` for more info). If the axis `type` is *date*, it should be a date string, like date data. If the axis `type` is *category*, it should be a number, using the scale where each category is assigned a serial number from zero in the order it appears. any style colorbars linear Sets the step in-between ticks on this axis. Use with `tick0`. Must be a positive number, or special strings available to *log* and *date* axes. If the axis `type` is *log*, then ticks are set every 10^(n*dtick) where n is the tick number. For example, to set a tick mark at 1, 10, 100, 1000, ... set dtick to 1. To set tick marks at 1, 100, 10000, ... set dtick to 2. To set tick marks at 1, 5, 25, 125, 625, 3125, ... set dtick to log_10(5), or 0.69897000433. *log* has several special values; *L<f>*, where `f` is a positive number, gives ticks linearly spaced in value (but not position). For example `tick0` = 0.1, `dtick` = *L0.5* will put ticks at 0.1, 0.6, 1.1, 1.6 etc. To show powers of 10 plus small digits between, use *D1* (all digits) or *D2* (only 2 and 5). `tick0` is ignored for *D1* and *D2*. If the axis `type` is *date*, then you must convert the time to milliseconds. For example, to set the interval between ticks to one day, set `dtick` to 86400000.0. *date* also has special values *M<n>* gives ticks spaced by a number of months. `n` must be a positive integer. To set ticks on the 15th of every third month, set `tick0` to *2000-01-15* and `dtick` to *M3*. To set ticks every 4 years, set `dtick` to *M48* data_array colorbars Sets the values at which ticks on this axis appear. Only has an effect if `tickmode` is set to *array*. Used with `ticktext`. data data_array colorbars Sets the text displayed at the ticks position via `tickvals`. Only has an effect if `tickmode` is set to *array*. Used with `tickvals`. data enumerated outside style colorbars Determines whether ticks are drawn or not. If **, this axis' ticks are not drawn. If *outside* (*inside*), this axis' are drawn outside (inside) the axis lines. number 0 5 style colorbars Sets the tick length (in px). number 0 1 style colorbars Sets the tick width (in px). color #444 style colorbars Sets the tick color. boolean TRUE style colorbars Determines whether or not the tick labels are drawn. string style TRUE TRUE HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. colorbars number style 1 colorbars color style colorbars Sets the color bar's tick label font colorbars object angle auto style colorbars Sets the angle of the tick labels with respect to the horizontal. For example, a `tickangle` of -90 draws the tick labels vertically. string style colorbars Sets the tick label formatting rule using d3 formatting mini-languages which are very similar to those in Python. For numbers, see: https://github.com/d3/d3-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format And for dates see: https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format We add one item to d3's date formatter: *%{n}f* for fractional seconds with n digits. For example, *2016-10-13 09:15:23.456* with tickformat *%H~%M~%S.%2f* would display *09~15~23.46* boolean info TRUE colorbars Determines whether or not this stop is used. If `false`, this stop is ignored even within its `dtickrange`. info_array info any colorbars colorbars range [*min*, *max*], where *min*, *max* - dtick values which describe some zoom level, it is possible to omit *min* or *max* value by passing *null* string style colorbars string - dtickformat for described zoom level, the same as *tickformat* colorbars string style colorbars When used in a template, named items are created in the output figure in addition to any items the figure already has in this array. You can modify these items in the output figure by making your own item with `templateitemname` matching this `name` alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). Has no effect outside of a template. string info colorbars Used to refer to a named item in this array in the template. Named items from the template will be created even without a matching item in the input figure, but you can modify one by making an item with `templateitemname` matching its `name`, alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). If there is no template or no matching item, this item will be hidden unless you explicitly show it with `visible: true`. object object string style colorbars Sets a tick label prefix. enumerated all all style colorbars If *all*, all tick labels are displayed with a prefix. If *first*, only the first tick is displayed with a prefix. If *last*, only the last tick is displayed with a suffix. If *none*, tick prefixes are hidden. string style colorbars Sets a tick label suffix. enumerated all all style colorbars Same as `showtickprefix` but for tick suffixes. boolean FALSE style colorbars If "true", even 4-digit integers are separated enumerated none B style colorbars Determines a formatting rule for the tick exponents. For example, consider the number 1,000,000,000. If *none*, it appears as 1,000,000,000. If *e*, 1e+9. If *E*, 1E+9. If *power*, 1x10^9 (with 9 in a super script). If *SI*, 1G. If *B*, 1B. enumerated all all style colorbars If *all*, all exponents are shown besides their significands. If *first*, only the exponent of the first tick is shown. If *last*, only the exponent of the last tick is shown. If *none*, no exponents appear. string info Sets the title of the color bar. Note that before the existence of `title.text`, the title's contents used to be defined as the `title` attribute itself. This behavior has been deprecated. colorbars string style TRUE TRUE HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. colorbars number style 1 colorbars color style colorbars Sets this color bar's title font. Note that the title's font used to be set by the now deprecated `titlefont` attribute. colorbars object enumerated right style top Determines the location of color bar's title with respect to the color bar. Note that the title's location used to be set by the now deprecated `titleside` attribute. colorbars colorbars object string info Deprecated in favor of color bar's `title.text`. Note that value of color bar's `title` is no longer a simple *string* but a set of sub-attributes. colorbars string style TRUE TRUE HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. colorbars number style 1 colorbars color style colorbars Deprecated in favor of color bar's `title.font`. colorbars enumerated right style top Deprecated in favor of color bar's `title.side`. colorbars colorbars object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for tickvals . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for ticktext . none object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for symbol . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for opacity . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for size . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for color . none string style TRUE TRUE calc HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. TRUE number style 1 calc TRUE color style style TRUE calc Sets the text font. object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for family . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for size . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for color . none enumerated top left middle center TRUE style calc Sets the positions of the `text` elements with respects to the (x,y) coordinates. number 0 1 style style Sets the marker opacity of selected points. color style style Sets the marker color of selected points. number 0 style style Sets the marker size of selected points. style object color style style Sets the text font color of selected points. style object style object number 0 1 style style Sets the marker opacity of unselected points, applied only when a selection exists. color style style Sets the marker color of unselected points, applied only when a selection exists. number 0 style style Sets the marker size of unselected points, applied only when a selection exists. style object color style style Sets the text font color of unselected points, applied only when a selection exists. style object style object flaglist info a all TRUE all none Determines which trace information appear on hover. If `none` or `skip` are set, no information is displayed upon hovering. But, if `none` is set, click and hover events are still fired. flaglist points info style Do the hover effects highlight individual points (markers or line points) or do they highlight filled regions? If the fill is *toself* or *tonext* and there are no markers or text, then the default is *fills*, otherwise it is *points*. string info none Template string used for rendering the information that appear on hover box. Note that this will override `hoverinfo`. Variables are inserted using %{variable}, for example "y: %{y}". Numbers are formatted using d3-format's syntax %{variable:d3-format}, for example "Price: %{y:$.2f}". See https://github.com/d3/d3-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format for details on the formatting syntax. The variables available in `hovertemplate` are the ones emitted as event data described at this link https://plot.ly/javascript/plotlyjs-events/#event-data. Additionally, every attributes that can be specified per-point (the ones that are `arrayOk: true`) are available. Anything contained in tag `<extra>` is displayed in the secondary box, for example "<extra>{fullData.name}</extra>". To hide the secondary box completely, use an empty tag `<extra></extra>`. TRUE subplotid info x calc+clearAxisTypes Sets a reference between this trace's x coordinates and a 2D cartesian x axis. If *x* (the default value), the x coordinates refer to `layout.xaxis`. If *x2*, the x coordinates refer to `layout.xaxis2`, and so on. subplotid info y calc+clearAxisTypes Sets a reference between this trace's y coordinates and a 2D cartesian y axis. If *y* (the default value), the y coordinates refer to `layout.yaxis`. If *y2*, the y coordinates refer to `layout.yaxis2`, and so on. string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for ids . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for customdata . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for a . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for b . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for text . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for hovertext . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for textposition . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for hoverinfo . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for hovertemplate . none contour_carpet Plots contours on either the first carpet axis or the carpet axis with a matching `carpet` attribute. Data `z` is interpreted as matching that of the corresponding carpet axis. contourcarpet enumerated TRUE info TRUE calc Determines whether or not this trace is visible. If *legendonly*, the trace is not drawn, but can appear as a legend item (provided that the legend itself is visible). boolean info TRUE style Determines whether or not an item corresponding to this trace is shown in the legend. string info style Sets the legend group for this trace. Traces part of the same legend group hide/show at the same time when toggling legend items. number style 0 1 1 style Sets the opacity of the trace. string info style Sets the trace name. The trace name appear as the legend item and on hover. string info plot TRUE Assign an id to this trace, Use this to provide object constancy between traces during animations and transitions. data_array calc TRUE Assigns id labels to each datum. These ids for object constancy of data points during animation. Should be an array of strings, not numbers or any other type. data data_array calc Assigns extra data each datum. This may be useful when listening to hover, click and selection events. Note that, *scatter* traces also appends customdata items in the markers DOM elements data any info calc Array containing integer indices of selected points. Has an effect only for traces that support selections. Note that an empty array means an empty selection where the `unselected` are turned on for all points, whereas, any other non-array values means no selection all where the `selected` and `unselected` styles have no effect. flaglist info x all TRUE all none Determines which trace information appear on hover. If `none` or `skip` are set, no information is displayed upon hovering. But, if `none` is set, click and hover events are still fired. color style TRUE none Sets the background color of the hover labels for this trace color style TRUE none Sets the border color of the hover labels for this trace. string style TRUE TRUE none HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. TRUE number style 1 none TRUE color style none TRUE none Sets the font used in hover labels. object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for family . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for size . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for color . none integer -1 TRUE style none Sets the length (in number of characters) of the trace name in the hover labels for this trace. -1 shows the whole name regardless of length. 0-3 shows the first 0-3 characters, and an integer >3 will show the whole name if it is less than that many characters, but if it is longer, will truncate to `namelength - 3` characters and add an ellipsis. calc object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for bgcolor . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for bordercolor . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for namelength . none string TRUE TRUE info calc The stream id number links a data trace on a plot with a stream. See https://plot.ly/settings for more details. number 0 10000 500 info calc Sets the maximum number of points to keep on the plots from an incoming stream. If `maxpoints` is set to *50*, only the newest 50 points will be displayed on the plot. calc object any info none Controls persistence of some user-driven changes to the trace: `constraintrange` in `parcoords` traces, as well as some `editable: true` modifications such as `name` and `colorbar.title`. Defaults to `layout.uirevision`. Note that other user-driven trace attribute changes are controlled by `layout` attributes: `trace.visible` is controlled by `layout.legend.uirevision`, `selectedpoints` is controlled by `layout.selectionrevision`, and `colorbar.(x|y)` (accessible with `config: {editable: true}`) is controlled by `layout.editrevision`. Trace changes are tracked by `uid`, which only falls back on trace index if no `uid` is provided. So if your app can add/remove traces before the end of the `data` array, such that the same trace has a different index, you can still preserve user-driven changes if you give each trace a `uid` that stays with it as it moves. string info calc The `carpet` of the carpet axes on which this contour trace lies data_array calc Sets the z data. data data_array calc+clearAxisTypes TRUE Sets the x coordinates. array data any 0 info calc+clearAxisTypes TRUE Alternate to `x`. Builds a linear space of x coordinates. Use with `dx` where `x0` is the starting coordinate and `dx` the step. scaled number 1 info calc TRUE Sets the x coordinate step. See `x0` for more info. scaled data_array calc+clearAxisTypes TRUE Sets the y coordinates. array data any 0 info calc+clearAxisTypes TRUE Alternate to `y`. Builds a linear space of y coordinates. Use with `dy` where `y0` is the starting coordinate and `dy` the step. scaled number 1 info calc TRUE Sets the y coordinate step. See `y0` for more info. scaled data_array calc Sets the text elements associated with each z value. data data_array calc Same as `text`. data boolean FALSE info calc Transposes the z data. enumerated array info calc+clearAxisTypes If *array*, the heatmap's x coordinates are given by *x* (the default behavior when `x` is provided). If *scaled*, the heatmap's x coordinates are given by *x0* and *dx* (the default behavior when `x` is not provided). enumerated array info calc+clearAxisTypes If *array*, the heatmap's y coordinates are given by *y* (the default behavior when `y` is provided) If *scaled*, the heatmap's y coordinates are given by *y0* and *dy* (the default behavior when `y` is not provided) color style calc Sets the fill color if `contours.type` is *constraint*. Defaults to a half-transparent variant of the line color, marker color, or marker line color, whichever is available. boolean TRUE style calc Determines whether or not the contour level attributes are picked by an algorithm. If *true*, the number of contour levels can be set in `ncontours`. If *false*, set the contour level attributes in `contours`. integer 15 1 style calc Sets the maximum number of contour levels. The actual number of contours will be chosen automatically to be less than or equal to the value of `ncontours`. Has an effect only if `autocontour` is *true* or if `contours.size` is missing. enumerated levels levels info calc If `levels`, the data is represented as a contour plot with multiple levels displayed. If `constraint`, the data is represented as constraints with the invalid region shaded as specified by the `operation` and `value` parameters. number style plot FALSE Sets the starting contour level value. Must be less than `contours.end` number style plot FALSE Sets the end contour level value. Must be more than `contours.start` number 0 style plot FALSE Sets the step between each contour level. Must be positive. enumerated fill fill style calc Determines the coloring method showing the contour values. If *fill*, coloring is done evenly between each contour level If *lines*, coloring is done on the contour lines. If *none*, no coloring is applied on this trace. boolean TRUE style plot Determines whether or not the contour lines are drawn. Has an effect only if `contours.coloring` is set to *fill*. boolean FALSE style plot Determines whether to label the contour lines with their values. string style TRUE TRUE plot HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. number style 1 plot color style style plot Sets the font used for labeling the contour levels. The default color comes from the lines, if shown. The default family and size come from `layout.font`. object string style plot Sets the contour label formatting rule using d3 formatting mini-language which is very similar to Python, see: https://github.com/d3/d3-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format. enumerated = info = calc Sets the constraint operation. *=* keeps regions equal to `value` *<* and *<=* keep regions less than `value` *>* and *>=* keep regions greater than `value` *[]*, *()*, *[)*, and *(]* keep regions inside `value[0]` to `value[1]` *][*, *)(*, *](*, *)[* keep regions outside `value[0]` to value[1]` Open vs. closed intervals make no difference to constraint display, but all versions are allowed for consistency with filter transforms. any 0 info calc Sets the value or values of the constraint boundary. When `operation` is set to one of the comparison values (=,<,>=,>,<=) *value* is expected to be a number. When `operation` is set to one of the interval values ([],(),[),(],][,)(,](,)[) *value* is expected to be an array of two numbers where the first is the lower bound and the second is the upper bound. calc FALSE object object color style style TRUE Sets the color of the contour level. Has no if `contours.coloring` is set to *lines*. number 0 2 style style TRUE Sets the line width (in px). string solid solid style style Sets the dash style of lines. Set to a dash type string (*solid*, *dot*, *dash*, *longdash*, *dashdot*, or *longdashdot*) or a dash length list in px (eg *5px,10px,2px,2px*). number 0 1.3 1 style plot Sets the amount of smoothing for the contour lines, where *0* corresponds to no smoothing. plot object boolean info TRUE calc Determines whether or not the color domain is computed with respect to the input data (here in `z`) or the bounds set in `zmin` and `zmax` Defaults to `false` when `zmin` and `zmax` are set by the user. number info plot FALSE Sets the lower bound of the color domain. Value should have the same units as in `z` and if set, `zmax` must be set as well. number info plot FALSE Sets the upper bound of the color domain. Value should have the same units as in `z` and if set, `zmin` must be set as well. number info calc Sets the mid-point of the color domain by scaling `zmin` and/or `zmax` to be equidistant to this point. Value should have the same units as in `z`. Has no effect when `zauto` is `false`. colorscale style calc FALSE Sets the colorscale. The colorscale must be an array containing arrays mapping a normalized value to an rgb, rgba, hex, hsl, hsv, or named color string. At minimum, a mapping for the lowest (0) and highest (1) values are required. For example, `[[0, 'rgb(0,0,255)', [1, 'rgb(255,0,0)']]`. To control the bounds of the colorscale in color space, use`zmin` and `zmax`. Alternatively, `colorscale` may be a palette name string of the following list: Greys,YlGnBu,Greens,YlOrRd,Bluered,RdBu,Reds,Blues,Picnic,Rainbow,Portland,Jet,Hot,Blackbody,Earth,Electric,Viridis,Cividis. boolean style FALSE calc Determines whether the colorscale is a default palette (`autocolorscale: true`) or the palette determined by `colorscale`. In case `colorscale` is unspecified or `autocolorscale` is true, the default palette will be chosen according to whether numbers in the `color` array are all positive, all negative or mixed. boolean style FALSE plot Reverses the color mapping if true. If true, `zmin` will correspond to the last color in the array and `zmax` will correspond to the first color. boolean info TRUE calc Determines whether or not a colorbar is displayed for this trace. enumerated fraction style pixels Determines whether this color bar's thickness (i.e. the measure in the constant color direction) is set in units of plot *fraction* or in *pixels*. Use `thickness` to set the value. colorbars number style 0 30 Sets the thickness of the color bar This measure excludes the size of the padding, ticks and labels. colorbars enumerated fraction info fraction Determines whether this color bar's length (i.e. the measure in the color variation direction) is set in units of plot *fraction* or in *pixels. Use `len` to set the value. colorbars number 0 1 style Sets the length of the color bar This measure excludes the padding of both ends. That is, the color bar length is this length minus the padding on both ends. colorbars number 1.02 -2 3 style Sets the x position of the color bar (in plot fraction). colorbars enumerated left left style Sets this color bar's horizontal position anchor. This anchor binds the `x` position to the *left*, *center* or *right* of the color bar. colorbars number style 0 10 Sets the amount of padding (in px) along the x direction. colorbars number style 0.5 -2 3 Sets the y position of the color bar (in plot fraction). colorbars enumerated top style middle Sets this color bar's vertical position anchor This anchor binds the `y` position to the *top*, *middle* or *bottom* of the color bar. colorbars number style 0 10 Sets the amount of padding (in px) along the y direction. colorbars color #444 style colorbars Sets the axis line color. number 0 1 style colorbars Sets the width (in px) of the axis line. color #444 style colorbars Sets the axis line color. number style 0 0 Sets the width (in px) or the border enclosing this color bar. colorbars color style rgba(0,0,0,0) Sets the color of padded area. colorbars enumerated auto info colorbars Sets the tick mode for this axis. If *auto*, the number of ticks is set via `nticks`. If *linear*, the placement of the ticks is determined by a starting position `tick0` and a tick step `dtick` (*linear* is the default value if `tick0` and `dtick` are provided). If *array*, the placement of the ticks is set via `tickvals` and the tick text is `ticktext`. (*array* is the default value if `tickvals` is provided). integer 0 0 style colorbars Specifies the maximum number of ticks for the particular axis. The actual number of ticks will be chosen automatically to be less than or equal to `nticks`. Has an effect only if `tickmode` is set to *auto*. any style colorbars linear Sets the placement of the first tick on this axis. Use with `dtick`. If the axis `type` is *log*, then you must take the log of your starting tick (e.g. to set the starting tick to 100, set the `tick0` to 2) except when `dtick`=*L<f>* (see `dtick` for more info). If the axis `type` is *date*, it should be a date string, like date data. If the axis `type` is *category*, it should be a number, using the scale where each category is assigned a serial number from zero in the order it appears. any style colorbars linear Sets the step in-between ticks on this axis. Use with `tick0`. Must be a positive number, or special strings available to *log* and *date* axes. If the axis `type` is *log*, then ticks are set every 10^(n*dtick) where n is the tick number. For example, to set a tick mark at 1, 10, 100, 1000, ... set dtick to 1. To set tick marks at 1, 100, 10000, ... set dtick to 2. To set tick marks at 1, 5, 25, 125, 625, 3125, ... set dtick to log_10(5), or 0.69897000433. *log* has several special values; *L<f>*, where `f` is a positive number, gives ticks linearly spaced in value (but not position). For example `tick0` = 0.1, `dtick` = *L0.5* will put ticks at 0.1, 0.6, 1.1, 1.6 etc. To show powers of 10 plus small digits between, use *D1* (all digits) or *D2* (only 2 and 5). `tick0` is ignored for *D1* and *D2*. If the axis `type` is *date*, then you must convert the time to milliseconds. For example, to set the interval between ticks to one day, set `dtick` to 86400000.0. *date* also has special values *M<n>* gives ticks spaced by a number of months. `n` must be a positive integer. To set ticks on the 15th of every third month, set `tick0` to *2000-01-15* and `dtick` to *M3*. To set ticks every 4 years, set `dtick` to *M48* data_array colorbars Sets the values at which ticks on this axis appear. Only has an effect if `tickmode` is set to *array*. Used with `ticktext`. data data_array colorbars Sets the text displayed at the ticks position via `tickvals`. Only has an effect if `tickmode` is set to *array*. Used with `tickvals`. data enumerated outside style colorbars Determines whether ticks are drawn or not. If **, this axis' ticks are not drawn. If *outside* (*inside*), this axis' are drawn outside (inside) the axis lines. number 0 5 style colorbars Sets the tick length (in px). number 0 1 style colorbars Sets the tick width (in px). color #444 style colorbars Sets the tick color. boolean TRUE style colorbars Determines whether or not the tick labels are drawn. string style TRUE TRUE HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. colorbars number style 1 colorbars color style colorbars Sets the color bar's tick label font colorbars object angle auto style colorbars Sets the angle of the tick labels with respect to the horizontal. For example, a `tickangle` of -90 draws the tick labels vertically. string style colorbars Sets the tick label formatting rule using d3 formatting mini-languages which are very similar to those in Python. For numbers, see: https://github.com/d3/d3-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format And for dates see: https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format We add one item to d3's date formatter: *%{n}f* for fractional seconds with n digits. For example, *2016-10-13 09:15:23.456* with tickformat *%H~%M~%S.%2f* would display *09~15~23.46* boolean info TRUE colorbars Determines whether or not this stop is used. If `false`, this stop is ignored even within its `dtickrange`. info_array info any colorbars colorbars range [*min*, *max*], where *min*, *max* - dtick values which describe some zoom level, it is possible to omit *min* or *max* value by passing *null* string style colorbars string - dtickformat for described zoom level, the same as *tickformat* colorbars string style colorbars When used in a template, named items are created in the output figure in addition to any items the figure already has in this array. You can modify these items in the output figure by making your own item with `templateitemname` matching this `name` alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). Has no effect outside of a template. string info colorbars Used to refer to a named item in this array in the template. Named items from the template will be created even without a matching item in the input figure, but you can modify one by making an item with `templateitemname` matching its `name`, alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). If there is no template or no matching item, this item will be hidden unless you explicitly show it with `visible: true`. object object string style colorbars Sets a tick label prefix. enumerated all all style colorbars If *all*, all tick labels are displayed with a prefix. If *first*, only the first tick is displayed with a prefix. If *last*, only the last tick is displayed with a suffix. If *none*, tick prefixes are hidden. string style colorbars Sets a tick label suffix. enumerated all all style colorbars Same as `showtickprefix` but for tick suffixes. boolean FALSE style colorbars If "true", even 4-digit integers are separated enumerated none B style colorbars Determines a formatting rule for the tick exponents. For example, consider the number 1,000,000,000. If *none*, it appears as 1,000,000,000. If *e*, 1e+9. If *E*, 1E+9. If *power*, 1x10^9 (with 9 in a super script). If *SI*, 1G. If *B*, 1B. enumerated all all style colorbars If *all*, all exponents are shown besides their significands. If *first*, only the exponent of the first tick is shown. If *last*, only the exponent of the last tick is shown. If *none*, no exponents appear. string info Sets the title of the color bar. Note that before the existence of `title.text`, the title's contents used to be defined as the `title` attribute itself. This behavior has been deprecated. colorbars string style TRUE TRUE HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. colorbars number style 1 colorbars color style colorbars Sets this color bar's title font. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates.
