The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. colorbars number style 1 colorbars color style colorbars Deprecated in favor of color bar's `title.font`. colorbars enumerated right style top Deprecated in favor of color bar's `title.side`. colorbars colorbars object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for tickvals . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for ticktext . none subplotid info x calc+clearAxisTypes Sets a reference between this trace's x coordinates and a 2D cartesian x axis. If *x* (the default value), the x coordinates refer to `layout.xaxis`. If *x2*, the x coordinates refer to `layout.xaxis2`, and so on. subplotid info y calc+clearAxisTypes Sets a reference between this trace's y coordinates and a 2D cartesian y axis. If *y* (the default value), the y coordinates refer to `layout.yaxis`. If *y2*, the y coordinates refer to `layout.yaxis2`, and so on. string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for ids . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for customdata . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for hoverinfo . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for z . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for a . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for b . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for text . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for hovertext . none The ohlc (short for Open-High-Low-Close) is a style of financial chart describing open, high, low and close for a given `x` coordinate (most likely time). The tip of the lines represent the `low` and `high` values and the horizontal segments represent the `open` and `close` values. Sample points where the close value is higher (lower) then the open value are called increasing (decreasing). By default, increasing items are drawn in green whereas decreasing are drawn in red. ohlc enumerated TRUE info TRUE calc Determines whether or not this trace is visible. If *legendonly*, the trace is not drawn, but can appear as a legend item (provided that the legend itself is visible). boolean info TRUE style Determines whether or not an item corresponding to this trace is shown in the legend. string info style Sets the legend group for this trace. Traces part of the same legend group hide/show at the same time when toggling legend items. number style 0 1 1 style Sets the opacity of the trace. string info style Sets the trace name. The trace name appear as the legend item and on hover. string info plot TRUE Assign an id to this trace, Use this to provide object constancy between traces during animations and transitions. data_array calc TRUE Assigns id labels to each datum. These ids for object constancy of data points during animation. Should be an array of strings, not numbers or any other type. data data_array calc Assigns extra data each datum. This may be useful when listening to hover, click and selection events. Note that, *scatter* traces also appends customdata items in the markers DOM elements data any info calc Array containing integer indices of selected points. Has an effect only for traces that support selections. Note that an empty array means an empty selection where the `unselected` are turned on for all points, whereas, any other non-array values means no selection all where the `selected` and `unselected` styles have no effect. flaglist info x all TRUE all none Determines which trace information appear on hover. If `none` or `skip` are set, no information is displayed upon hovering. But, if `none` is set, click and hover events are still fired. string TRUE TRUE info calc The stream id number links a data trace on a plot with a stream. See https://plot.ly/settings for more details. number 0 10000 500 info calc Sets the maximum number of points to keep on the plots from an incoming stream. If `maxpoints` is set to *50*, only the newest 50 points will be displayed on the plot. calc object calc An array of operations that manipulate the trace data, for example filtering or sorting the data arrays. object object any info none Controls persistence of some user-driven changes to the trace: `constraintrange` in `parcoords` traces, as well as some `editable: true` modifications such as `name` and `colorbar.title`. Defaults to `layout.uirevision`. Note that other user-driven trace attribute changes are controlled by `layout` attributes: `trace.visible` is controlled by `layout.legend.uirevision`, `selectedpoints` is controlled by `layout.selectionrevision`, and `colorbar.(x|y)` (accessible with `config: {editable: true}`) is controlled by `layout.editrevision`. Trace changes are tracked by `uid`, which only falls back on trace index if no `uid` is provided. So if your app can add/remove traces before the end of the `data` array, such that the same trace has a different index, you can still preserve user-driven changes if you give each trace a `uid` that stays with it as it moves. data_array calc+clearAxisTypes Sets the x coordinates. If absent, linear coordinate will be generated. data data_array calc Sets the open values. data data_array calc Sets the high values. data data_array calc Sets the low values. data data_array calc Sets the close values. data number 0 2 style style TRUE [object Object] Note that this style setting can also be set per direction via `increasing.line.width` and `decreasing.line.width`. string solid solid style style Sets the dash style of lines. Set to a dash type string (*solid*, *dot*, *dash*, *longdash*, *dashdot*, or *longdashdot*) or a dash length list in px (eg *5px,10px,2px,2px*). Note that this style setting can also be set per direction via `increasing.line.dash` and `decreasing.line.dash`. style object color style style TRUE Sets the line color. #3D9970 number 0 2 style style TRUE Sets the line width (in px). string solid solid style style Sets the dash style of lines. Set to a dash type string (*solid*, *dot*, *dash*, *longdash*, *dashdot*, or *longdashdot*) or a dash length list in px (eg *5px,10px,2px,2px*). style object style object color style style TRUE Sets the line color. #FF4136 number 0 2 style style TRUE Sets the line width (in px). string solid solid style style Sets the dash style of lines. Set to a dash type string (*solid*, *dot*, *dash*, *longdash*, *dashdot*, or *longdashdot*) or a dash length list in px (eg *5px,10px,2px,2px*). style object style object string info TRUE calc Sets hover text elements associated with each sample point. If a single string, the same string appears over all the data points. If an array of string, the items are mapped in order to this trace's sample points. string info TRUE calc Same as `text`. number 0 0.5 0.3 style calc Sets the width of the open/close tick marks relative to the *x* minimal interval. color style TRUE none Sets the background color of the hover labels for this trace color style TRUE none Sets the border color of the hover labels for this trace. string style TRUE TRUE none HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. TRUE number style 1 none TRUE color style none TRUE none Sets the font used in hover labels. object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for family . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for size . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for color . none integer -1 TRUE style none Sets the length (in number of characters) of the trace name in the hover labels for this trace. -1 shows the whole name regardless of length. 0-3 shows the first 0-3 characters, and an integer >3 will show the whole name if it is less than that many characters, but if it is longer, will truncate to `namelength - 3` characters and add an ellipsis. calc boolean info FALSE style Show hover information (open, close, high, low) in separate labels. object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for bgcolor . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for bordercolor . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for namelength . none enumerated gregorian info calc gregorian Sets the calendar system to use with `x` date data. subplotid info x calc+clearAxisTypes Sets a reference between this trace's x coordinates and a 2D cartesian x axis. If *x* (the default value), the x coordinates refer to `layout.xaxis`. If *x2*, the x coordinates refer to `layout.xaxis2`, and so on. subplotid info y calc+clearAxisTypes Sets a reference between this trace's y coordinates and a 2D cartesian y axis. If *y* (the default value), the y coordinates refer to `layout.yaxis`. If *y2*, the y coordinates refer to `layout.yaxis2`, and so on. string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for ids . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for customdata . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for hoverinfo . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for x . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for open . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for high . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for low . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for close . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for text . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for hovertext . none The candlestick is a style of financial chart describing open, high, low and close for a given `x` coordinate (most likely time). The boxes represent the spread between the `open` and `close` values and the lines represent the spread between the `low` and `high` values Sample points where the close value is higher (lower) then the open value are called increasing (decreasing). By default, increasing candles are drawn in green whereas decreasing are drawn in red. candlestick enumerated TRUE info TRUE calc Determines whether or not this trace is visible. If *legendonly*, the trace is not drawn, but can appear as a legend item (provided that the legend itself is visible). boolean info TRUE style Determines whether or not an item corresponding to this trace is shown in the legend. string info style Sets the legend group for this trace. Traces part of the same legend group hide/show at the same time when toggling legend items. number style 0 1 1 style Sets the opacity of the trace. string info style Sets the trace name. The trace name appear as the legend item and on hover. string info plot TRUE Assign an id to this trace, Use this to provide object constancy between traces during animations and transitions. data_array calc TRUE Assigns id labels to each datum. These ids for object constancy of data points during animation. Should be an array of strings, not numbers or any other type. data data_array calc Assigns extra data each datum. This may be useful when listening to hover, click and selection events. Note that, *scatter* traces also appends customdata items in the markers DOM elements data any info calc Array containing integer indices of selected points. Has an effect only for traces that support selections. Note that an empty array means an empty selection where the `unselected` are turned on for all points, whereas, any other non-array values means no selection all where the `selected` and `unselected` styles have no effect. flaglist info x all TRUE all none Determines which trace information appear on hover. If `none` or `skip` are set, no information is displayed upon hovering. But, if `none` is set, click and hover events are still fired. string TRUE TRUE info calc The stream id number links a data trace on a plot with a stream. See https://plot.ly/settings for more details. number 0 10000 500 info calc Sets the maximum number of points to keep on the plots from an incoming stream. If `maxpoints` is set to *50*, only the newest 50 points will be displayed on the plot. calc object calc An array of operations that manipulate the trace data, for example filtering or sorting the data arrays. object object any info none Controls persistence of some user-driven changes to the trace: `constraintrange` in `parcoords` traces, as well as some `editable: true` modifications such as `name` and `colorbar.title`. Defaults to `layout.uirevision`. Note that other user-driven trace attribute changes are controlled by `layout` attributes: `trace.visible` is controlled by `layout.legend.uirevision`, `selectedpoints` is controlled by `layout.selectionrevision`, and `colorbar.(x|y)` (accessible with `config: {editable: true}`) is controlled by `layout.editrevision`. Trace changes are tracked by `uid`, which only falls back on trace index if no `uid` is provided. So if your app can add/remove traces before the end of the `data` array, such that the same trace has a different index, you can still preserve user-driven changes if you give each trace a `uid` that stays with it as it moves. data_array calc+clearAxisTypes Sets the x coordinates. If absent, linear coordinate will be generated. data data_array calc Sets the open values. data data_array calc Sets the high values. data data_array calc Sets the low values. data data_array calc Sets the close values. data number style 0 2 style Sets the width (in px) of line bounding the box(es). Note that this style setting can also be set per direction via `increasing.line.width` and `decreasing.line.width`. style object color style style Sets the color of line bounding the box(es). #3D9970 number style 0 2 style Sets the width (in px) of line bounding the box(es). style object color style style TRUE Sets the fill color. Defaults to a half-transparent variant of the line color, marker color, or marker line color, whichever is available. style object color style style Sets the color of line bounding the box(es). #FF4136 number style 0 2 style Sets the width (in px) of line bounding the box(es). style object color style style TRUE Sets the fill color. Defaults to a half-transparent variant of the line color, marker color, or marker line color, whichever is available. style object string info TRUE calc Sets hover text elements associated with each sample point. If a single string, the same string appears over all the data points. If an array of string, the items are mapped in order to this trace's sample points. string info TRUE calc Same as `text`. number 0 1 0 style calc Sets the width of the whiskers relative to the box' width. For example, with 1, the whiskers are as wide as the box(es). color style TRUE none Sets the background color of the hover labels for this trace color style TRUE none Sets the border color of the hover labels for this trace. string style TRUE TRUE none HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. TRUE number style 1 none TRUE color style none TRUE none Sets the font used in hover labels. object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for family . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for size . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for color . none integer -1 TRUE style none Sets the length (in number of characters) of the trace name in the hover labels for this trace. -1 shows the whole name regardless of length. 0-3 shows the first 0-3 characters, and an integer >3 will show the whole name if it is less than that many characters, but if it is longer, will truncate to `namelength - 3` characters and add an ellipsis. calc boolean info FALSE style Show hover information (open, close, high, low) in separate labels. object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for bgcolor . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for bordercolor . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for namelength . none enumerated gregorian info calc gregorian Sets the calendar system to use with `x` date data. subplotid info x calc+clearAxisTypes Sets a reference between this trace's x coordinates and a 2D cartesian x axis. If *x* (the default value), the x coordinates refer to `layout.xaxis`. If *x2*, the x coordinates refer to `layout.xaxis2`, and so on. subplotid info y calc+clearAxisTypes Sets a reference between this trace's y coordinates and a 2D cartesian y axis. If *y* (the default value), the y coordinates refer to `layout.yaxis`. If *y2*, the y coordinates refer to `layout.yaxis2`, and so on. string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for ids . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for customdata . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for hoverinfo . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for x . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for open . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for high . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for low . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for close . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for text . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for hovertext . none enumerated group overlay info calc Determines how boxes at the same location coordinate are displayed on the graph. If *group*, the boxes are plotted next to one another centered around the shared location. If *overlay*, the boxes are plotted over one another, you might need to set *opacity* to see them multiple boxes. Has no effect on traces that have *width* set. number 0 1 0.3 style calc Sets the gap (in plot fraction) between boxes of adjacent location coordinates. Has no effect on traces that have *width* set. number 0 1 0.3 style calc Sets the gap (in plot fraction) between boxes of the same location coordinate. Has no effect on traces that have *width* set. scatter_polar The scatterpolar trace type encompasses line charts, scatter charts, text charts, and bubble charts in polar coordinates. The data visualized as scatter point or lines is set in `r` (radial) and `theta` (angular) coordinates Text (appearing either on the chart or on hover only) is via `text`. Bubble charts are achieved by setting `marker.size` and/or `marker.color` to numerical arrays. scatterpolar enumerated TRUE info TRUE calc Determines whether or not this trace is visible. If *legendonly*, the trace is not drawn, but can appear as a legend item (provided that the legend itself is visible). boolean info TRUE style Determines whether or not an item corresponding to this trace is shown in the legend. string info style Sets the legend group for this trace. Traces part of the same legend group hide/show at the same time when toggling legend items. number style 0 1 1 style Sets the opacity of the trace. string info style Sets the trace name. The trace name appear as the legend item and on hover. string info plot TRUE Assign an id to this trace, Use this to provide object constancy between traces during animations and transitions. data_array calc TRUE Assigns id labels to each datum. These ids for object constancy of data points during animation. Should be an array of strings, not numbers or any other type. data data_array calc Assigns extra data each datum. This may be useful when listening to hover, click and selection events. See https://plot.ly/settings for more details. number 0 10000 500 info calc Sets the maximum number of points to keep on the plots from an incoming stream. If `maxpoints` is set to *50*, only the newest 50 points will be displayed on the plot. calc object calc An array of operations that manipulate the trace data, for example filtering or sorting the data arrays. object object any info none Controls persistence of some user-driven changes to the trace: `constraintrange` in `parcoords` traces, as well as some `editable: true` modifications such as `name` and `colorbar.title`. Defaults to `layout.uirevision`. Note that other user-driven trace attribute changes are controlled by `layout` attributes: `trace.visible` is controlled by `layout.legend.uirevision`, `selectedpoints` is controlled by `layout.selectionrevision`, and `colorbar.(x|y)` (accessible with `config: {editable: true}`) is controlled by `layout.editrevision`. Trace changes are tracked by `uid`, which only falls back on trace index if no `uid` is provided. So if your app can add/remove traces before the end of the `data` array, such that the same trace has a different index, you can still preserve user-driven changes if you give each trace a `uid` that stays with it as it moves. flaglist lines none info calc Determines the drawing mode for this scatter trace. If the provided `mode` includes *text* then the `text` elements appear at the coordinates. Otherwise, the `text` elements appear on hover. If there are less than 20 points and the trace is not stacked then the default is *lines+markers*. Otherwise, *lines*. data_array calc+clearAxisTypes Sets the radial coordinates data data_array calc+clearAxisTypes Sets the angular coordinates data any 0 info calc+clearAxisTypes Alternate to `r`. Builds a linear space of r coordinates. Use with `dr` where `r0` is the starting coordinate and `dr` the step. number 1 info calc Sets the r coordinate step. any 0 info calc+clearAxisTypes Alternate to `theta`. Builds a linear space of theta coordinates. Use with `dtheta` where `theta0` is the starting coordinate and `dtheta` the step. number info calc Sets the theta coordinate step. By default, the `dtheta` step equals the subplot's period divided by the length of the `r` coordinates. enumerated radians degrees info calc+clearAxisTypes Sets the unit of input *theta* values. Has an effect only when on *linear* angular axes. string info TRUE calc Sets text elements associated with each (x,y) pair. If a single string, the same string appears over all the data points. If an array of string, the items are mapped in order to the this trace's (x,y) coordinates. If trace `hoverinfo` contains a *text* flag and *hovertext* is not set, these elements will be seen in the hover labels. string info TRUE style Sets hover text elements associated with each (x,y) pair. If a single string, the same string appears over all the data points. If an array of string, the items are mapped in order to the this trace's (x,y) coordinates. To be seen, trace `hoverinfo` must contain a *text* flag. color style style TRUE Sets the line color. number 0 2 style style TRUE Sets the line width (in px). string solid solid style style Sets the dash style of lines. Set to a dash type string (*solid*, *dot*, *dash*, *longdash*, *dashdot*, or *longdashdot*) or a dash length list in px (eg *5px,10px,2px,2px*). enumerated linear linear style plot Determines the line shape. With *spline* the lines are drawn using spline interpolation. The other available values correspond to step-wise line shapes. number 0 1.3 1 style plot Has an effect only if `shape` is set to *spline* Sets the amount of smoothing. *0* corresponds to no smoothing (equivalent to a *linear* shape). calc object boolean FALSE info calc Determines whether or not gaps (i.e. {nan} or missing values) in the provided data arrays are connected. enumerated 0 circle TRUE style style Sets the marker symbol type. Adding 100 is equivalent to appending *-open* to a symbol name. Adding 200 is equivalent to appending *-dot* to a symbol name. Adding 300 is equivalent to appending *-open-dot* or *dot-open* to a symbol name. number 0 1 TRUE style style TRUE Sets the marker opacity. number 0 6 TRUE style calc TRUE Sets the marker size (in px). number 0 0 style plot Sets a maximum number of points to be drawn on the graph. *0* corresponds to no limit. number 1 style calc Has an effect only if `marker.size` is set to a numerical array. Sets the scale factor used to determine the rendered size of marker points. Use with `sizemin` and `sizemode`. number 0 0 style calc Has an effect only if `marker.size` is set to a numerical array. Sets the minimum size (in px) of the rendered marker points. enumerated diameter diameter info calc Has an effect only if `marker.size` is set to a numerical array. Sets the rule for which the data in `size` is converted to pixels. enumerated fraction style pixels Determines whether this color bar's thickness (i.e. the measure in the constant color direction) is set in units of plot *fraction* or in *pixels*. Use `thickness` to set the value. colorbars number style 0 30 Sets the thickness of the color bar This measure excludes the size of the padding, ticks and labels. colorbars enumerated fraction info fraction Determines whether this color bar's length (i.e. the measure in the color variation direction) is set in units of plot *fraction* or in *pixels. Use `len` to set the value. colorbars number 0 1 style Sets the length of the color bar This measure excludes the padding of both ends. That is, the color bar length is this length minus the padding on both ends. colorbars number 1.02 -2 3 style Sets the x position of the color bar (in plot fraction). colorbars enumerated left left style Sets this color bar's horizontal position anchor. This anchor binds the `x` position to the *left*, *center* or *right* of the color bar. colorbars number style 0 10 Sets the amount of padding (in px) along the x direction. colorbars number style 0.5 -2 3 Sets the y position of the color bar (in plot fraction). colorbars enumerated top style middle Sets this color bar's vertical position anchor This anchor binds the `y` position to the *top*, *middle* or *bottom* of the color bar. colorbars number style 0 10 Sets the amount of padding (in px) along the y direction. colorbars color #444 style colorbars Sets the axis line color. number 0 1 style colorbars Sets the width (in px) of the axis line. color #444 style colorbars Sets the axis line color. number style 0 0 Sets the width (in px) or the border enclosing this color bar. colorbars color style rgba(0,0,0,0) Sets the color of padded area. colorbars enumerated auto info colorbars Sets the tick mode for this axis. If *auto*, the number of ticks is set via `nticks`. If *linear*, the placement of the ticks is determined by a starting position `tick0` and a tick step `dtick` (*linear* is the default value if `tick0` and `dtick` are provided). If *array*, the placement of the ticks is set via `tickvals` and the tick text is `ticktext`. (*array* is the default value if `tickvals` is provided). integer 0 0 style colorbars Specifies the maximum number of ticks for the particular axis. The actual number of ticks will be chosen automatically to be less than or equal to `nticks`. Has an effect only if `tickmode` is set to *auto*. any style colorbars linear Sets the placement of the first tick on this axis. Use with `dtick`. If the axis `type` is *log*, then you must take the log of your starting tick (e.g. to set the starting tick to 100, set the `tick0` to 2) except when `dtick`=*L<f>* (see `dtick` for more info). If the axis `type` is *date*, it should be a date string, like date data. If the axis `type` is *category*, it should be a number, using the scale where each category is assigned a serial number from zero in the order it appears. any style colorbars linear Sets the step in-between ticks on this axis. Use with `tick0`. Must be a positive number, or special strings available to *log* and *date* axes. If the axis `type` is *log*, then ticks are set every 10^(n*dtick) where n is the tick number. For example, to set a tick mark at 1, 10, 100, 1000, ... set dtick to 1. To set tick marks at 1, 100, 10000, ... set dtick to 2. To set tick marks at 1, 5, 25, 125, 625, 3125, ... set dtick to log_10(5), or 0.69897000433. *log* has several special values; *L<f>*, where `f` is a positive number, gives ticks linearly spaced in value (but not position). For example `tick0` = 0.1, `dtick` = *L0.5* will put ticks at 0.1, 0.6, 1.1, 1.6 etc. To show powers of 10 plus small digits between, use *D1* (all digits) or *D2* (only 2 and 5). `tick0` is ignored for *D1* and *D2*. If the axis `type` is *date*, then you must convert the time to milliseconds. For example, to set the interval between ticks to one day, set `dtick` to 86400000.0. *date* also has special values *M<n>* gives ticks spaced by a number of months. `n` must be a positive integer. To set ticks on the 15th of every third month, set `tick0` to *2000-01-15* and `dtick` to *M3*. To set ticks every 4 years, set `dtick` to *M48* data_array colorbars Sets the values at which ticks on this axis appear. Only has an effect if `tickmode` is set to *array*. Used with `ticktext`. data data_array colorbars Sets the text displayed at the ticks position via `tickvals`. Only has an effect if `tickmode` is set to *array*. Used with `tickvals`. data enumerated outside style colorbars Determines whether ticks are drawn or not. If **, this axis' ticks are not drawn. If *outside* (*inside*), this axis' are drawn outside (inside) the axis lines. number 0 5 style colorbars Sets the tick length (in px). number 0 1 style colorbars Sets the tick width (in px). color #444 style colorbars Sets the tick color. boolean TRUE style colorbars Determines whether or not the tick labels are drawn. string style TRUE TRUE HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. colorbars number style 1 colorbars color style colorbars Sets the color bar's tick label font colorbars object angle auto style colorbars Sets the angle of the tick labels with respect to the horizontal. For example, a `tickangle` of -90 draws the tick labels vertically. string style colorbars Sets the tick label formatting rule using d3 formatting mini-languages which are very similar to those in Python. For numbers, see: https://github.com/d3/d3-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format And for dates see: https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format We add one item to d3's date formatter: *%{n}f* for fractional seconds with n digits. For example, *2016-10-13 09:15:23.456* with tickformat *%H~%M~%S.%2f* would display *09~15~23.46* boolean info TRUE colorbars Determines whether or not this stop is used. If `false`, this stop is ignored even within its `dtickrange`. info_array info any colorbars colorbars range [*min*, *max*], where *min*, *max* - dtick values which describe some zoom level, it is possible to omit *min* or *max* value by passing *null* string style colorbars string - dtickformat for described zoom level, the same as *tickformat* colorbars string style colorbars When used in a template, named items are created in the output figure in addition to any items the figure already has in this array. You can modify these items in the output figure by making your own item with `templateitemname` matching this `name` alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). Has no effect outside of a template. string info colorbars Used to refer to a named item in this array in the template. Named items from the template will be created even without a matching item in the input figure, but you can modify one by making an item with `templateitemname` matching its `name`, alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). If there is no template or no matching item, this item will be hidden unless you explicitly show it with `visible: true`. object object string style colorbars Sets a tick label prefix. enumerated all all style colorbars If *all*, all tick labels are displayed with a prefix. If *first*, only the first tick is displayed with a prefix. If *last*, only the last tick is displayed with a suffix. If *none*, tick prefixes are hidden. string style colorbars Sets a tick label suffix. enumerated all all style colorbars Same as `showtickprefix` but for tick suffixes. boolean FALSE style colorbars If "true", even 4-digit integers are separated enumerated none B style colorbars Determines a formatting rule for the tick exponents. For example, consider the number 1,000,000,000. If *none*, it appears as 1,000,000,000. If *e*, 1e+9. If *E*, 1E+9. If *power*, 1x10^9 (with 9 in a super script). If *SI*, 1G. If *B*, 1B. enumerated all all style colorbars If *all*, all exponents are shown besides their significands. If *first*, only the exponent of the first tick is shown. If *last*, only the exponent of the last tick is shown. If *none*, no exponents appear. string info Sets the title of the color bar. Note that before the existence of `title.text`, the title's contents used to be defined as the `title` attribute itself. This behavior has been deprecated. colorbars string style TRUE TRUE HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. colorbars number style 1 colorbars color style colorbars Sets this color bar's title font. Note that the title's font used to be set by the now deprecated `titlefont` attribute. colorbars object enumerated right style top Determines the location of color bar's title with respect to the color bar. Note that the title's location used to be set by the now deprecated `titleside` attribute. colorbars colorbars object string info Deprecated in favor of color bar's `title.text`. Note that value of color bar's `title` is no longer a simple *string* but a set of sub-attributes. colorbars string style TRUE TRUE HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. colorbars number style 1 colorbars color style colorbars Deprecated in favor of color bar's `title.font`. colorbars enumerated right style top Deprecated in favor of color bar's `title.side`. colorbars colorbars object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for tickvals . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for ticktext . none number 0 TRUE style style TRUE Sets the width (in px) of the lines bounding the marker points. calc color TRUE style style Sets themarker.linecolor. It accepts either a specific color or an array of numbers that are mapped to the colorscale relative to the max and min values of the array or relative to `marker.line.cmin` and `marker.line.cmax` if set. TRUE boolean info TRUE calc Determines whether or not the color domain is computed with respect to the input data (here in `marker.line.color`) or the bounds set in `marker.line.cmin` and `marker.line.cmax` Has an effect only if in `marker.line.color`is set to a numerical array. Defaults to `false` when `marker.line.cmin` and `marker.line.cmax` are set by the user. number info plot FALSE Sets the lower bound of the color domain. Has an effect only if in `marker.line.color`is set to a numerical array. Value should have the same units as in `marker.line.color` and if set, `marker.line.cmax` must be set as well. number info plot FALSE Sets the upper bound of the color domain. Has an effect only if in `marker.line.color`is set to a numerical array. Value should have the same units as in `marker.line.color` and if set, `marker.line.cmin` must be set as well. number info calc Sets the mid-point of the color domain by scaling `marker.line.cmin` and/or `marker.line.cmax` to be equidistant to this point. Has an effect only if in `marker.line.color`is set to a numerical array. Value should have the same units as in `marker.line.color`. Has no effect when `marker.line.cauto` is `false`. colorscale style calc FALSE Sets the colorscale. Has an effect only if in `marker.line.color`is set to a numerical array. The colorscale must be an array containing arrays mapping a normalized value to an rgb, rgba, hex, hsl, hsv, or named color string. At minimum, a mapping for the lowest (0) and highest (1) values are required. For example, `[[0, 'rgb(0,0,255)', [1, 'rgb(255,0,0)']]`. To control the bounds of the colorscale in color space, use`marker.line.cmin` and `marker.line.cmax`. Alternatively, `colorscale` may be a palette name string of the following list: Greys,YlGnBu,Greens,YlOrRd,Bluered,RdBu,Reds,Blues,Picnic,Rainbow,Portland,Jet,Hot,Blackbody,Earth,Electric,Viridis,Cividis. boolean style TRUE calc Determines whether the colorscale is a default palette (`autocolorscale: true`) or the palette determined by `marker.line.colorscale`. Has an effect only if in `marker.line.color`is set to a numerical array. In case `colorscale` is unspecified or `autocolorscale` is true, the default palette will be chosen according to whether numbers in the `color` array are all positive, all negative or mixed. boolean style FALSE plot Reverses the color mapping if true. Has an effect only if in `marker.line.color`is set to a numerical array. If true, `marker.line.cmin` will correspond to the last color in the array and `marker.line.cmax` will correspond to the first color. object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for width . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for color . none enumerated radial TRUE none style calc Sets the type of gradient used to fill the markers color TRUE style calc Sets the final color of the gradient fill: the center color for radial, the right for horizontal, or the bottom for vertical. calc object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for type . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for color . none calc color TRUE style style Sets themarkercolor. It accepts either a specific color or an array of numbers that are mapped to the colorscale relative to the max and min values of the array or relative to `marker.cmin` and `marker.cmax` if set. TRUE boolean info TRUE calc Determines whether or not the color domain is computed with respect to the input data (here in `marker.color`) or the bounds set in `marker.cmin` and `marker.cmax` Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. Defaults to `false` when `marker.cmin` and `marker.cmax` are set by the user. number info plot FALSE Sets the lower bound of the color domain. Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. Value should have the same units as in `marker.color` and if set, `marker.cmax` must be set as well. number info plot FALSE Sets the upper bound of the color domain. Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. Value should have the same units as in `marker.color` and if set, `marker.cmin` must be set as well. number info calc Sets the mid-point of the color domain by scaling `marker.cmin` and/or `marker.cmax` to be equidistant to this point. Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. Value should have the same units as in `marker.color`. Has no effect when `marker.cauto` is `false`. colorscale style calc FALSE Sets the colorscale. Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. The colorscale must be an array containing arrays mapping a normalized value to an rgb, rgba, hex, hsl, hsv, or named color string. At minimum, a mapping for the lowest (0) and highest (1) values are required. For example, `[[0, 'rgb(0,0,255)', [1, 'rgb(255,0,0)']]`. To control the bounds of the colorscale in color space, use`marker.cmin` and `marker.cmax`. Alternatively, `colorscale` may be a palette name string of the following list: Greys,YlGnBu,Greens,YlOrRd,Bluered,RdBu,Reds,Blues,Picnic,Rainbow,Portland,Jet,Hot,Blackbody,Earth,Electric,Viridis,Cividis. boolean style TRUE calc Determines whether the colorscale is a default palette (`autocolorscale: true`) or the palette determined by `marker.colorscale`. Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. In case `colorscale` is unspecified or `autocolorscale` is true, the default palette will be chosen according to whether numbers in the `color` array are all positive, all negative or mixed. boolean style FALSE plot Reverses the color mapping if true. Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. If true, `marker.cmin` will correspond to the last color in the array and `marker.cmax` will correspond to the first color. boolean info FALSE calc Determines whether or not a colorbar is displayed for this trace. Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for symbol . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for opacity . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for size . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for color . none boolean FALSE info plot Determines whether or not markers and text nodes are clipped about the subplot axes. To show markers and text nodes above axis lines and tick labels, make sure to set `xaxis.layer` and `yaxis.layer` to *below traces*. enumerated top left middle center TRUE style calc Sets the positions of the `text` elements with respects to the (x,y) coordinates. string style TRUE TRUE calc HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. TRUE number style 1 calc TRUE color style style TRUE calc Sets the text font. object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for family . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for size . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for color . none enumerated none style calc Sets the area to fill with a solid color. Use with `fillcolor` if not *none*. scatterpolar has a subset of the options available to scatter. *toself* connects the endpoints of the trace (or each segment of the trace if it has gaps) into a closed shape. *tonext* fills the space between two traces if one completely encloses the other (eg consecutive contour lines), and behaves like *toself* if there is no trace before it. *tonext* should not be used if one trace does not enclose the other. none color style style TRUE Sets the fill color. Defaults to a half-transparent variant of the line color, marker color, or marker line color, whichever is available. flaglist info r all TRUE all none Determines which trace information appear on hover. If `none` or `skip` are set, no information is displayed upon hovering. But, if `none` is set, click and hover events are still fired. flaglist points info style Do the hover effects highlight individual points (markers or line points) or do they highlight filled regions? If the fill is *toself* or *tonext* and there are no markers or text, then the default is *fills*, otherwise it is *points*. string info none Template string used for rendering the information that appear on hover box. Note that this will override `hoverinfo`. Variables are inserted using %{variable}, for example "y: %{y}". Numbers are formatted using d3-format's syntax %{variable:d3-format}, for example "Price: %{y:$.2f}". See https://github.com/d3/d3-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format for details on the formatting syntax. The variables available in `hovertemplate` are the ones emitted as event data described at this link https://plot.ly/javascript/plotlyjs-events/#event-data. Additionally, every attributes that can be specified per-point (the ones that are `arrayOk: true`) are available. Anything contained in tag `<extra>` is displayed in the secondary box, for example "<extra>{fullData.name}</extra>". To hide the secondary box completely, use an empty tag `<extra></extra>`. TRUE number 0 1 style style Sets the marker opacity of selected points. color style style Sets the marker color of selected points. number 0 style style Sets the marker size of selected points. style object color style style Sets the text font color of selected points. style object style object number 0 1 style style Sets the marker opacity of unselected points, applied only when a selection exists. color style style Sets the marker color of unselected points, applied only when a selection exists. number 0 style style Sets the marker size of unselected points, applied only when a selection exists. style object color style style Sets the text font color of unselected points, applied only when a selection exists. style object style object subplotid info polar calc Sets a reference between this trace's data coordinates and a polar subplot. If *polar* (the default value), the data refer to `layout.polar`. If *polar2*, the data refer to `layout.polar2`, and so on. string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for ids . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for customdata . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for r . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for theta . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for text . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for hovertext . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for textposition . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for hoverinfo . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for hovertemplate . none scatter_polar_gl The scatterpolargl trace type encompasses line charts, scatter charts, and bubble charts in polar coordinates using the WebGL plotting engine. The data visualized as scatter point or lines is set in `r` (radial) and `theta` (angular) coordinates Bubble charts are achieved by setting `marker.size` and/or `marker.color` to numerical arrays. scatterpolargl enumerated TRUE info TRUE calc Determines whether or not this trace is visible. If *legendonly*, the trace is not drawn, but can appear as a legend item (provided that the legend itself is visible). boolean info TRUE style Determines whether or not an item corresponding to this trace is shown in the legend. string info style Sets the legend group for this trace. Traces part of the same legend group hide/show at the same time when toggling legend items. number style 0 1 1 style Sets the opacity of the trace. string info style Sets the trace name. The trace name appear as the legend item and on hover. string info plot TRUE Assign an id to this trace, Use this to provide object constancy between traces during animations and transitions. data_array calc TRUE Assigns id labels to each datum. These ids for object constancy of data points during animation. Should be an array of strings, not numbers or any other type. data data_array calc Assigns extra data each datum. This may be useful when listening to hover, click and selection events. Note that, *scatter* traces also appends customdata items in the markers DOM elements data any info calc Array containing integer indices of selected points. Has an effect only for traces that support selections. Note that an empty array means an empty selection where the `unselected` are turned on for all points, whereas, any other non-array values means no selection all where the `selected` and `unselected` styles have no effect. color style TRUE none Sets the background color of the hover labels for this trace color style TRUE none Sets the border color of the hover labels for this trace. string style TRUE TRUE none HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. TRUE number style 1 none TRUE color style none TRUE none Sets the font used in hover labels. object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for family . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for size . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for color . none integer -1 TRUE style none Sets the length (in number of characters) of the trace name in the hover labels for this trace. -1 shows the whole name regardless of length. 0-3 shows the first 0-3 characters, and an integer >3 will show the whole name if it is less than that many characters, but if it is longer, will truncate to `namelength - 3` characters and add an ellipsis. calc object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for bgcolor . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for bordercolor . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for namelength . none string TRUE TRUE info calc The stream id number links a data trace on a plot with a stream. See https://plot.ly/settings for more details. number 0 10000 500 info calc Sets the maximum number of points to keep on the plots from an incoming stream. If `maxpoints` is set to *50*, only the newest 50 points will be displayed on the plot. calc object calc An array of operations that manipulate the trace data, for example filtering or sorting the data arrays. object object any info none Controls persistence of some user-driven changes to the trace: `constraintrange` in `parcoords` traces, as well as some `editable: true` modifications such as `name` and `colorbar.title`. Defaults to `layout.uirevision`. Note that other user-driven trace attribute changes are controlled by `layout` attributes: `trace.visible` is controlled by `layout.legend.uirevision`, `selectedpoints` is controlled by `layout.selectionrevision`, and `colorbar.(x|y)` (accessible with `config: {editable: true}`) is controlled by `layout.editrevision`. Trace changes are tracked by `uid`, which only falls back on trace index if no `uid` is provided. So if your app can add/remove traces before the end of the `data` array, such that the same trace has a different index, you can still preserve user-driven changes if you give each trace a `uid` that stays with it as it moves. flaglist lines none info calc Determines the drawing mode for this scatter trace. If the provided `mode` includes *text* then the `text` elements appear at the coordinates. Otherwise, the `text` elements appear on hover. If there are less than 20 points and the trace is not stacked then the default is *lines+markers*. Otherwise, *lines*. data_array calc+clearAxisTypes Sets the radial coordinates data data_array calc+clearAxisTypes Sets the angular coordinates data any 0 info calc+clearAxisTypes Alternate to `r`. Builds a linear space of r coordinates. Use with `dr` where `r0` is the starting coordinate and `dr` the step. number 1 info calc Sets the r coordinate step. any 0 info calc+clearAxisTypes Alternate to `theta`. Builds a linear space of theta coordinates. Use with `dtheta` where `theta0` is the starting coordinate and `dtheta` the step. number info calc Sets the theta coordinate step. By default, the `dtheta` step equals the subplot's period divided by the length of the `r` coordinates. enumerated radians degrees info calc+clearAxisTypes Sets the unit of input *theta* values. Has an effect only when on *linear* angular axes. string info TRUE calc Sets text elements associated with each (x,y) pair. If a single string, the same string appears over all the data points. If an array of string, the items are mapped in order to the this trace's (x,y) coordinates. If trace `hoverinfo` contains a *text* flag and *hovertext* is not set, these elements will be seen in the hover labels. string info TRUE style Sets hover text elements associated with each (x,y) pair. If a single string, the same string appears over all the data points. If an array of string, the items are mapped in order to the this trace's (x,y) coordinates. To be seen, trace `hoverinfo` must contain a *text* flag. string info none Template string used for rendering the information that appear on hover box. Note that this will override `hoverinfo`. Variables are inserted using %{variable}, for example "y: %{y}". Numbers are formatted using d3-format's syntax %{variable:d3-format}, for example "Price: %{y:$.2f}". See https://github.com/d3/d3-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format for details on the formatting syntax. The variables available in `hovertemplate` are the ones emitted as event data described at this link https://plot.ly/javascript/plotlyjs-events/#event-data. Additionally, every attributes that can be specified per-point (the ones that are `arrayOk: true`) are available. Anything contained in tag `<extra>` is displayed in the secondary box, for example "<extra>{fullData.name}</extra>". To hide the secondary box completely, use an empty tag `<extra></extra>`. TRUE color style calc TRUE Sets the line color. number 0 2 style calc TRUE Sets the line width (in px). enumerated linear linear style calc Determines the line shape. The values correspond to step-wise line shapes. enumerated solid solid style Sets the style of the lines. calc calc object boolean FALSE info calc Determines whether or not gaps (i.e. {nan} or missing values) in the provided data arrays are connected. color TRUE style calc Sets themarkercolor. It accepts either a specific color or an array of numbers that are mapped to the colorscale relative to the max and min values of the array or relative to `marker.cmin` and `marker.cmax` if set. boolean info TRUE calc Determines whether or not the color domain is computed with respect to the input data (here in `marker.color`) or the bounds set in `marker.cmin` and `marker.cmax` Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. Defaults to `false` when `marker.cmin` and `marker.cmax` are set by the user. number info calc FALSE Sets the lower bound of the color domain. Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. Value should have the same units as in `marker.color` and if set, `marker.cmax` must be set as well. number info calc FALSE Sets the upper bound of the color domain. Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. Value should have the same units as in `marker.color` and if set, `marker.cmin` must be set as well. number info calc Sets the mid-point of the color domain by scaling `marker.cmin` and/or `marker.cmax` to be equidistant to this point. Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. Value should have the same units as in `marker.color`. Has no effect when `marker.cauto` is `false`. colorscale style calc FALSE Sets the colorscale. Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. The colorscale must be an array containing arrays mapping a normalized value to an rgb, rgba, hex, hsl, hsv, or named color string. At minimum, a mapping for the lowest (0) and highest (1) values are required. For example, `[[0, 'rgb(0,0,255)', [1, 'rgb(255,0,0)']]`. To control the bounds of the colorscale in color space, use`marker.cmin` and `marker.cmax`. Alternatively, `colorscale` may be a palette name string of the following list: Greys,YlGnBu,Greens,YlOrRd,Bluered,RdBu,Reds,Blues,Picnic,Rainbow,Portland,Jet,Hot,Blackbody,Earth,Electric,Viridis,Cividis. boolean style TRUE calc Determines whether the colorscale is a default palette (`autocolorscale: true`) or the palette determined by `marker.colorscale`. Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. In case `colorscale` is unspecified or `autocolorscale` is true, the default palette will be chosen according to whether numbers in the `color` array are all positive, all negative or mixed. boolean style FALSE calc Reverses the color mapping if true. Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. If true, `marker.cmin` will correspond to the last color in the array and `marker.cmax` will correspond to the first color. boolean info FALSE calc Determines whether or not a colorbar is displayed for this trace. Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. enumerated 0 circle TRUE style calc Sets the marker symbol type. Adding 100 is equivalent to appending *-open* to a symbol name. Adding 200 is equivalent to appending *-dot* to a symbol name. Adding 300 is equivalent to appending *-open-dot* or *dot-open* to a symbol name. number 0 6 TRUE style calc TRUE Sets the marker size (in px). number 1 style calc Has an effect only if `marker.size` is set to a numerical array. Sets the scale factor used to determine the rendered size of marker points. Use with `sizemin` and `sizemode`. number 0 0 style calc Has an effect only if `marker.size` is set to a numerical array. Sets the minimum size (in px) of the rendered marker points. enumerated diameter diameter info calc Has an effect only if `marker.size` is set to a numerical array. Sets the rule for which the data in `size` is converted to pixels. number 0 1 TRUE style calc TRUE Sets the marker opacity. enumerated fraction style pixels Determines whether this color bar's thickness (i.e. the measure in the constant color direction) is set in units of plot *fraction* or in *pixels*. Use `thickness` to set the value. calc number style 0 30 Sets the thickness of the color bar This measure excludes the size of the padding, ticks and labels. calc enumerated fraction info fraction Determines whether this color bar's length (i.e. the measure in the color variation direction) is set in units of plot *fraction* or in *pixels. Use `len` to set the value. calc number 0 1 style Sets the length of the color bar This measure excludes the padding of both ends. That is, the color bar length is this length minus the padding on both ends. calc number 1.02 -2 3 style Sets the x position of the color bar (in plot fraction). calc enumerated left left style Sets this color bar's horizontal position anchor. This anchor binds the `x` position to the *left*, *center* or *right* of the color bar. calc number style 0 10 Sets the amount of padding (in px) along the x direction. calc number style 0.5 -2 3 Sets the y position of the color bar (in plot fraction). calc enumerated top style middle Sets this color bar's vertical position anchor This anchor binds the `y` position to the *top*, *middle* or *bottom* of the color bar. calc number style 0 10 Sets the amount of padding (in px) along the y direction. calc color #444 style calc Sets the axis line color. number 0 1 style calc Sets the width (in px) of the axis line. color #444 style calc Sets the axis line color. number style 0 0 Sets the width (in px) or the border enclosing this color bar. calc color style rgba(0,0,0,0) Sets the color of padded area. calc enumerated auto info calc Sets the tick mode for this axis. If *auto*, the number of ticks is set via `nticks`. If *linear*, the placement of the ticks is determined by a starting position `tick0` and a tick step `dtick` (*linear* is the default value if `tick0` and `dtick` are provided). If *array*, the placement of the ticks is set via `tickvals` and the tick text is `ticktext`. (*array* is the default value if `tickvals` is provided). integer 0 0 style calc Specifies the maximum number of ticks for the particular axis. The actual number of ticks will be chosen automatically to be less than or equal to `nticks`. Has an effect only if `tickmode` is set to *auto*. any style calc linear Sets the placement of the first tick on this axis. Use with `dtick`. If the axis `type` is *log*, then you must take the log of your starting tick (e.g. to set the starting tick to 100, set the `tick0` to 2) except when `dtick`=*L<f>* (see `dtick` for more info). If the axis `type` is *date*, it should be a date string, like date data. If the axis `type` is *category*, it should be a number, using the scale where each category is assigned a serial number from zero in the order it appears. any style calc linear Sets the step in-between ticks on this axis. Use with `tick0`. Must be a positive number, or special strings available to *log* and *date* axes. If the axis `type` is *log*, then ticks are set every 10^(n*dtick) where n is the tick number. For example, to set a tick mark at 1, 10, 100, 1000, ... set dtick to 1. To set tick marks at 1, 100, 10000, ... set dtick to 2. To set tick marks at 1, 5, 25, 125, 625, 3125, ... set dtick to log_10(5), or 0.69897000433. *log* has several special values; *L<f>*, where `f` is a positive number, gives ticks linearly spaced in value (but not position). For example `tick0` = 0.1, `dtick` = *L0.5* will put ticks at 0.1, 0.6, 1.1, 1.6 etc. To show powers of 10 plus small digits between, use *D1* (all digits) or *D2* (only 2 and 5). `tick0` is ignored for *D1* and *D2*. If the axis `type` is *date*, then you must convert the time to milliseconds. For example, to set the interval between ticks to one day, set `dtick` to 86400000.0. *date* also has special values *M<n>* gives ticks spaced by a number of months. `n` must be a positive integer. To set ticks on the 15th of every third month, set `tick0` to *2000-01-15* and `dtick` to *M3*. To set ticks every 4 years, set `dtick` to *M48* data_array calc Sets the values at which ticks on this axis appear. Only has an effect if `tickmode` is set to *array*. Used with `ticktext`. data data_array calc Sets the text displayed at the ticks position via `tickvals`. Only has an effect if `tickmode` is set to *array*. Used with `tickvals`. data enumerated outside style calc Determines whether ticks are drawn or not. If **, this axis' ticks are not drawn. If *outside* (*inside*), this axis' are drawn outside (inside) the axis lines. number 0 5 style calc Sets the tick length (in px). number 0 1 style calc Sets the tick width (in px). color #444 style calc Sets the tick color. boolean TRUE style calc Determines whether or not the tick labels are drawn. string style TRUE TRUE HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. calc number style 1 calc color style calc Sets the color bar's tick label font calc object angle auto style calc Sets the angle of the tick labels with respect to the horizontal. For example, a `tickangle` of -90 draws the tick labels vertically. string style calc Sets the tick label formatting rule using d3 formatting mini-languages which are very similar to those in Python. For numbers, see: https://github.com/d3/d3-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format And for dates see: https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format We add one item to d3's date formatter: *%{n}f* for fractional seconds with n digits. For example, *2016-10-13 09:15:23.456* with tickformat *%H~%M~%S.%2f* would display *09~15~23.46* boolean info TRUE calc Determines whether or not this stop is used. If `false`, this stop is ignored even within its `dtickrange`. info_array info any calc calc range [*min*, *max*], where *min*, *max* - dtick values which describe some zoom level, it is possible to omit *min* or *max* value by passing *null* string style calc string - dtickformat for described zoom level, the same as *tickformat* calc string style calc When used in a template, named items are created in the output figure in addition to any items the figure already has in this array. You can modify these items in the output figure by making your own item with `templateitemname` matching this `name` alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). Has no effect outside of a template. string info calc Used to refer to a named item in this array in the template. Named items from the template will be created even without a matching item in the input figure, but you can modify one by making an item with `templateitemname` matching its `name`, alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). If there is no template or no matching item, this item will be hidden unless you explicitly show it with `visible: true`. object object string style calc Sets a tick label prefix. enumerated all all style calc If *all*, all tick labels are displayed with a prefix. If *first*, only the first tick is displayed with a prefix. If *last*, only the last tick is displayed with a suffix. If *none*, tick prefixes are hidden. string style calc Sets a tick label suffix. enumerated all all style calc Same as `showtickprefix` but for tick suffixes. boolean FALSE style calc If "true", even 4-digit integers are separated enumerated none B style calc Determines a formatting rule for the tick exponents. For example, consider the number 1,000,000,000. If *none*, it appears as 1,000,000,000. If *e*, 1e+9. If *E*, 1E+9. If *power*, 1x10^9 (with 9 in a super script). If *SI*, 1G. If *B*, 1B. enumerated all all style calc If *all*, all exponents are shown besides their significands. If *first*, only the exponent of the first tick is shown. If *last*, only the exponent of the last tick is shown. If *none*, no exponents appear. string info Sets the title of the color bar. Note that before the existence of `title.text`, the title's contents used to be defined as the `title` attribute itself. This behavior has been deprecated. calc string style TRUE TRUE HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. calc number style 1 calc color style calc Sets this color bar's title font. Note that the title's font used to be set by the now deprecated `titlefont` attribute. calc object enumerated right style top Determines the location of color bar's title with respect to the color bar. Note that the title's location used to be set by the now deprecated `titleside` attribute. calc calc object string info Deprecated in favor of color bar's `title.text`. Note that value of color bar's `title` is no longer a simple *string* but a set of sub-attributes. calc string style TRUE TRUE HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. calc number style 1 calc color style calc Deprecated in favor of color bar's `title.font`. calc enumerated right style top Deprecated in favor of color bar's `title.side`. calc calc object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for tickvals . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for ticktext . none color TRUE style calc Sets themarker.linecolor. It accepts either a specific color or an array of numbers that are mapped to the colorscale relative to the max and min values of the array or relative to `marker.line.cmin` and `marker.line.cmax` if set. boolean info TRUE calc Determines whether or not the color domain is computed with respect to the input data (here in `marker.line.color`) or the bounds set in `marker.line.cmin` and `marker.line.cmax` Has an effect only if in `marker.line.color`is set to a numerical array. Defaults to `false` when `marker.line.cmin` and `marker.line.cmax` are set by the user. number info calc FALSE Sets the lower bound of the color domain. Has an effect only if in `marker.line.color`is set to a numerical array. Value should have the same units as in `marker.line.color` and if set, `marker.line.cmax` must be set as well. number info calc FALSE Sets the upper bound of the color domain. Has an effect only if in `marker.line.color`is set to a numerical array. Value should have the same units as in `marker.line.color` and if set, `marker.line.cmin` must be set as well. number info calc Sets the mid-point of the color domain by scaling `marker.line.cmin` and/or `marker.line.cmax` to be equidistant to this point. Has an effect only if in `marker.line.color`is set to a numerical array. Value should have the same units as in `marker.line.color`. Has no effect when `marker.line.cauto` is `false`. colorscale style calc FALSE Sets the colorscale. Has an effect only if in `marker.line.color`is set to a numerical array. The colorscale must be an array containing arrays mapping a normalized value to an rgb, rgba, hex, hsl, hsv, or named color string. At minimum, a mapping for the lowest (0) and highest (1) values are required. For example, `[[0, 'rgb(0,0,255)', [1, 'rgb(255,0,0)']]`. To control the bounds of the colorscale in color space, use`marker.line.cmin` and `marker.line.cmax`. Alternatively, `colorscale` may be a palette name string of the following list: Greys,YlGnBu,Greens,YlOrRd,Bluered,RdBu,Reds,Blues,Picnic,Rainbow,Portland,Jet,Hot,Blackbody,Earth,Electric,Viridis,Cividis. boolean style TRUE calc Determines whether the colorscale is a default palette (`autocolorscale: true`) or the palette determined by `marker.line.colorscale`. Has an effect only if in `marker.line.color`is set to a numerical array. In case `colorscale` is unspecified or `autocolorscale` is true, the default palette will be chosen according to whether numbers in the `color` array are all positive, all negative or mixed. boolean style FALSE calc Reverses the color mapping if true. Has an effect only if in `marker.line.color`is set to a numerical array. If true, `marker.line.cmin` will correspond to the last color in the array and `marker.line.cmax` will correspond to the first color. number 0 TRUE style calc TRUE Sets the width (in px) of the lines bounding the marker points. calc object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for color . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for width . none calc object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for color . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for symbol . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for size . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for opacity . none enumerated none style calc Sets the area to fill with a solid color. Defaults to *none* unless this trace is stacked, then it gets *tonexty* (*tonextx*) if `orientation` is *v* (*h*) Use with `fillcolor` if not *none*. *tozerox* and *tozeroy* fill to x=0 and y=0 respectively. *tonextx* and *tonexty* fill between the endpoints of this trace and the endpoints of the trace before it, connecting those endpoints with straight lines (to make a stacked area graph); if there is no trace before it, they behave like *tozerox* and *tozeroy*. *toself* connects the endpoints of the trace (or each segment of the trace if it has gaps) into a closed shape. *tonext* fills the space between two traces if one completely encloses the other (eg consecutive contour lines), and behaves like *toself* if there is no trace before it. *tonext* should not be used if one trace does not enclose the other. Traces in a `stackgroup` will only fill to (or be filled to) other traces in the same group. With multiple `stackgroup`s or some traces stacked and some not, if fill-linked traces are not already consecutive, the later ones will be pushed down in the drawing order. none color style calc TRUE Sets the fill color. Defaults to a half-transparent variant of the line color, marker color, or marker line color, whichever is available. enumerated top left middle center TRUE style calc Sets the positions of the `text` elements with respects to the (x,y) coordinates. string style TRUE TRUE calc HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. TRUE number style 1 calc TRUE color style calc TRUE calc Sets the text font. object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for family . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for size . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for color . none flaglist info r all TRUE all none Determines which trace information appear on hover. If `none` or `skip` are set, no information is displayed upon hovering. But, if `none` is set, click and hover events are still fired. number 0 1 style style Sets the marker opacity of selected points. color style style Sets the marker color of selected points. number 0 style style Sets the marker size of selected points. style object color style style Sets the text font color of selected points. style object style object number 0 1 style style Sets the marker opacity of unselected points, applied only when a selection exists. color style style Sets the marker color of unselected points, applied only when a selection exists. number 0 style style Sets the marker size of unselected points, applied only when a selection exists. style object color style style Sets the text font color of unselected points, applied only when a selection exists. style object style object subplotid info polar calc Sets a reference between this trace's data coordinates and a polar subplot. If *polar* (the default value), the data refer to `layout.polar`. If *polar2*, the data refer to `layout.polar2`, and so on. string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for ids . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for customdata . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for r . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for theta . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for text . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for hovertext . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for hovertemplate . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for textposition . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for hoverinfo . none bar_polar The data visualized by the radial span of the bars is set in `r` barpolar enumerated TRUE info TRUE calc Determines whether or not this trace is visible. If *legendonly*, the trace is not drawn, but can appear as a legend item (provided that the legend itself is visible). boolean info TRUE style Determines whether or not an item corresponding to this trace is shown in the legend. string info style Sets the legend group for this trace. Traces part of the same legend group hide/show at the same time when toggling legend items. number style 0 1 1 style Sets the opacity of the trace. string info style Sets the trace name. The trace name appear as the legend item and on hover. string info plot TRUE Assign an id to this trace, Use this to provide object constancy between traces during animations and transitions. data_array calc TRUE Assigns id labels to each datum. These ids for object constancy of data points during animation. Should be an array of strings, not numbers or any other type. data data_array calc Assigns extra data each datum.
