Use this for example to create an elevation profile where the vertical scale is exaggerated a fixed amount with respect to the horizontal. enumerated range range info plot If this axis needs to be compressed (either due to its own `scaleanchor` and `scaleratio` or those of the other axis), determines how that happens: by increasing the *range* (default), or by decreasing the *domain*. enumerated left info plot If this axis needs to be compressed (either due to its own `scaleanchor` and `scaleratio` or those of the other axis), determines which direction we push the originally specified plot area. Options are *left*, *center* (default), and *right* for x axes, and *top*, *middle* (default), and *bottom* for y axes. enumerated /^x([2-9]|[1-9][0-9]+)?$/ info calc If set to another axis id (e.g. `x2`, `y`), the range of this axis will match the range of the corresponding axis in data-coordinates space. Moreover, matching axes share auto-range values, category lists and histogram auto-bins. Note that setting axes simultaneously in both a `scaleanchor` and a `matches` constraint is currently forbidden. Moreover, note that matching axes must have the same `type`. enumerated auto info ticks Sets the tick mode for this axis. If *auto*, the number of ticks is set via `nticks`. If *linear*, the placement of the ticks is determined by a starting position `tick0` and a tick step `dtick` (*linear* is the default value if `tick0` and `dtick` are provided). If *array*, the placement of the ticks is set via `tickvals` and the tick text is `ticktext`. (*array* is the default value if `tickvals` is provided). integer 0 0 style ticks Specifies the maximum number of ticks for the particular axis. The actual number of ticks will be chosen automatically to be less than or equal to `nticks`. Has an effect only if `tickmode` is set to *auto*. any style ticks linear Sets the placement of the first tick on this axis. Use with `dtick`. If the axis `type` is *log*, then you must take the log of your starting tick (e.g. to set the starting tick to 100, set the `tick0` to 2) except when `dtick`=*L<f>* (see `dtick` for more info). If the axis `type` is *date*, it should be a date string, like date data. If the axis `type` is *category*, it should be a number, using the scale where each category is assigned a serial number from zero in the order it appears. any style ticks linear Sets the step in-between ticks on this axis. Use with `tick0`. Must be a positive number, or special strings available to *log* and *date* axes. If the axis `type` is *log*, then ticks are set every 10^(n*dtick) where n is the tick number. For example, to set a tick mark at 1, 10, 100, 1000, ... set dtick to 1. To set tick marks at 1, 100, 10000, ... set dtick to 2. To set tick marks at 1, 5, 25, 125, 625, 3125, ... set dtick to log_10(5), or 0.69897000433. *log* has several special values; *L<f>*, where `f` is a positive number, gives ticks linearly spaced in value (but not position). For example `tick0` = 0.1, `dtick` = *L0.5* will put ticks at 0.1, 0.6, 1.1, 1.6 etc. To show powers of 10 plus small digits between, use *D1* (all digits) or *D2* (only 2 and 5). `tick0` is ignored for *D1* and *D2*. If the axis `type` is *date*, then you must convert the time to milliseconds. For example, to set the interval between ticks to one day, set `dtick` to 86400000.0. *date* also has special values *M<n>* gives ticks spaced by a number of months. `n` must be a positive integer. To set ticks on the 15th of every third month, set `tick0` to *2000-01-15* and `dtick` to *M3*. To set ticks every 4 years, set `dtick` to *M48* data_array ticks Sets the values at which ticks on this axis appear. Only has an effect if `tickmode` is set to *array*. Used with `ticktext`. data data_array ticks Sets the text displayed at the ticks position via `tickvals`. Only has an effect if `tickmode` is set to *array*. Used with `tickvals`. data enumerated outside style ticks Determines whether ticks are drawn or not. If **, this axis' ticks are not drawn. If *outside* (*inside*), this axis' are drawn outside (inside) the axis lines. enumerated labels info labels ticks Determines where ticks and grid lines are drawn with respect to their corresponding tick labels. Only has an effect for axes of `type` *category* or *multicategory*. When set to *boundaries*, ticks and grid lines are drawn half a category to the left/bottom of labels. enumerated TRUE FALSE style ticks+layoutstyle Determines if the axis lines or/and ticks are mirrored to the opposite side of the plotting area. If *true*, the axis lines are mirrored. If *ticks*, the axis lines and ticks are mirrored. If *false*, mirroring is disable. If *all*, axis lines are mirrored on all shared-axes subplots. If *allticks*, axis lines and ticks are mirrored on all shared-axes subplots. number 0 5 style ticks Sets the tick length (in px). number 0 1 style ticks Sets the tick width (in px). color #444 style ticks Sets the tick color. boolean TRUE style ticks Determines whether or not the tick labels are drawn. boolean FALSE style ticks Determines whether long tick labels automatically grow the figure margins. boolean FALSE style modebar Determines whether or not spikes (aka droplines) are drawn for this axis. If *none*, it appears as 1,000,000,000. If *e*, 1e+9. If *E*, 1E+9. If *power*, 1x10^9 (with 9 in a super script). If *SI*, 1G. If *B*, 1B. boolean FALSE style ticks If "true", even 4-digit integers are separated string style ticks Sets the tick label formatting rule using d3 formatting mini-languages which are very similar to those in Python. For numbers, see: https://github.com/d3/d3-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format And for dates see: https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format We add one item to d3's date formatter: *%{n}f* for fractional seconds with n digits. For example, *2016-10-13 09:15:23.456* with tickformat *%H~%M~%S.%2f* would display *09~15~23.46* boolean info TRUE ticks Determines whether or not this stop is used. If `false`, this stop is ignored even within its `dtickrange`. info_array info any ticks ticks range [*min*, *max*], where *min*, *max* - dtick values which describe some zoom level, it is possible to omit *min* or *max* value by passing *null* string style ticks string - dtickformat for described zoom level, the same as *tickformat* ticks string style none When used in a template, named items are created in the output figure in addition to any items the figure already has in this array. You can modify these items in the output figure by making your own item with `templateitemname` matching this `name` alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). Has no effect outside of a template. string info calc Used to refer to a named item in this array in the template. Named items from the template will be created even without a matching item in the input figure, but you can modify one by making an item with `templateitemname` matching its `name`, alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). If there is no template or no matching item, this item will be hidden unless you explicitly show it with `visible: true`. object object string style none Sets the hover text formatting rule using d3 formatting mini-languages which are very similar to those in Python. For numbers, see: https://github.com/d3/d3-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format And for dates see: https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format We add one item to d3's date formatter: *%{n}f* for fractional seconds with n digits. For example, *2016-10-13 09:15:23.456* with tickformat *%H~%M~%S.%2f* would display *09~15~23.46* boolean FALSE style ticks+layoutstyle Determines whether or not a line bounding this axis is drawn. color #444 style layoutstyle Sets the axis line color. number 0 1 style ticks+layoutstyle Sets the width (in px) of the axis line. boolean style ticks Determines whether or not grid lines are drawn. If *true*, the grid lines are drawn at every tick mark. color #eee style ticks Sets the color of the grid lines. number 0 1 style ticks Sets the width (in px) of the grid lines. boolean style ticks Determines whether or not a line is drawn at along the 0 value of this axis. If *true*, the zero line is drawn on top of the grid lines. color #444 style ticks Sets the line color of the zero line. number 1 style ticks Sets the width (in px) of the zero line. boolean TRUE style ticks Determines whether or not a dividers are drawn between the category levels of this axis. Only has an effect on *multicategory* axes. color #444 style ticks Sets the color of the dividers Only has an effect on *multicategory* axes. number 1 style ticks Sets the width (in px) of the dividers Only has an effect on *multicategory* axes. enumerated free info plot If set to an opposite-letter axis id (e.g. `x2`, `y`), this axis is bound to the corresponding opposite-letter axis. If set to *free*, this axis' position is determined by `position`. enumerated top info plot Determines whether a x (y) axis is positioned at the *bottom* (*left*) or *top* (*right*) of the plotting area. enumerated free info plot If set a same-letter axis id, this axis is overlaid on top of the corresponding same-letter axis, with traces and axes visible for both axes. If *false*, this axis does not overlay any same-letter axes. In this case, for axes with overlapping domains only the highest-numbered axis will be visible. enumerated above traces above traces info plot Sets the layer on which this axis is displayed. If *above traces*, this axis is displayed above all the subplot's traces If *below traces*, this axis is displayed below all the subplot's traces, but above the grid lines. Useful when used together with scatter-like traces with `cliponaxis` set to *false* to show markers and/or text nodes above this axis. info_array info number 0 1 plot 0 plot Sets the domain of this axis (in plot fraction). number 0 1 0 style plot Sets the position of this axis in the plotting space (in normalized coordinates). Only has an effect if `anchor` is set to *free*. enumerated trace trace info calc Specifies the ordering logic for the case of categorical variables. By default, plotly uses *trace*, which specifies the order that is present in the data supplied. Set `categoryorder` to *category ascending* or *category descending* if order should be determined by the alphanumerical order of the category names. Set `categoryorder` to *array* to derive the ordering from the attribute `categoryarray`. If a category is not found in the `categoryarray` array, the sorting behavior for that attribute will be identical to the *trace* mode. The unspecified categories will follow the categories in `categoryarray`. data_array data calc Sets the order in which categories on this axis appear. Only has an effect if `categoryorder` is set to *array*. Used with `categoryorder`. any info none Controls persistence of user-driven changes in axis `range`, `autorange`, and `title` if in `editable: true` configuration. Defaults to `layout.uirevision`. calc boolean info ticks Obsolete. Set `tickmode` to *auto* for old `autotick` *true* behavior. Set `tickmode` to *linear* for `autotick` *false*. string info ticks Value of `title` is no longer a simple *string* but a set of sub-attributes. To set the axis' title, please use `title.text` now. string style TRUE TRUE ticks HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. number style 1 ticks color style ticks ticks Former `titlefont` is now the sub-attribute `font` of `title`. To customize title font properties, please use `title.font` now. enumerated gregorian info calc gregorian Sets the calendar system to use for `range` and `tick0` if this is a date axis. This does not set the calendar for interpreting data on this axis, that's specified in the trace or via the global `layout.calendar` TRUE object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for tickvals . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for ticktext . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for categoryarray . none info_array info number 0 1 plot 0 Sets the horizontal domain of this ternary subplot (in plot fraction). plot info_array info number 0 1 plot 0 Sets the vertical domain of this ternary subplot (in plot fraction). plot integer 0 0 info If there is a layout grid, use the domain for this row in the grid for this ternary subplot . plot integer 0 0 info If there is a layout grid, use the domain for this column in the grid for this ternary subplot . plot plot object color style #fff Set the background color of the subplot plot number info 1 0 The number each triplet should sum to, and the maximum range of each axis plot string info plot Sets the title of this axis. Note that before the existence of `title.text`, the title's contents used to be defined as the `title` attribute itself. This behavior has been deprecated. string style TRUE TRUE plot HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. number style 1 plot color style plot plot Sets this axis' title font. Note that the title's font used to be customized by the now deprecated `titlefont` attribute. object plot object color #444 style plot Sets default for all colors associated with this axis all at once: line, font, tick, and grid colors. Grid color is lightened by blending this with the plot background Individual pieces can override this. enumerated auto info plot Sets the tick mode for this axis. If *auto*, the number of ticks is set via `nticks`. If *linear*, the placement of the ticks is determined by a starting position `tick0` and a tick step `dtick` (*linear* is the default value if `tick0` and `dtick` are provided). If *array*, the placement of the ticks is set via `tickvals` and the tick text is `ticktext`. (*array* is the default value if `tickvals` is provided). integer 1 6 style plot Specifies the maximum number of ticks for the particular axis. The actual number of ticks will be chosen automatically to be less than or equal to `nticks`. Has an effect only if `tickmode` is set to *auto*. any style plot linear Sets the placement of the first tick on this axis. Use with `dtick`. If the axis `type` is *log*, then you must take the log of your starting tick (e.g. to set the starting tick to 100, set the `tick0` to 2) except when `dtick`=*L<f>* (see `dtick` for more info). If the axis `type` is *date*, it should be a date string, like date data. If the axis `type` is *category*, it should be a number, using the scale where each category is assigned a serial number from zero in the order it appears. any style plot linear Sets the step in-between ticks on this axis. Use with `tick0`. Must be a positive number, or special strings available to *log* and *date* axes. If the axis `type` is *log*, then ticks are set every 10^(n*dtick) where n is the tick number. For example, to set a tick mark at 1, 10, 100, 1000, ... set dtick to 1. To set tick marks at 1, 100, 10000, ... set dtick to 2. To set tick marks at 1, 5, 25, 125, 625, 3125, ... set dtick to log_10(5), or 0.69897000433. *log* has several special values; *L<f>*, where `f` is a positive number, gives ticks linearly spaced in value (but not position). For example `tick0` = 0.1, `dtick` = *L0.5* will put ticks at 0.1, 0.6, 1.1, 1.6 etc. To show powers of 10 plus small digits between, use *D1* (all digits) or *D2* (only 2 and 5). `tick0` is ignored for *D1* and *D2*. If the axis `type` is *date*, then you must convert the time to milliseconds. For example, to set the interval between ticks to one day, set `dtick` to 86400000.0. *date* also has special values *M<n>* gives ticks spaced by a number of months. `n` must be a positive integer. To set ticks on the 15th of every third month, set `tick0` to *2000-01-15* and `dtick` to *M3*. To set ticks every 4 years, set `dtick` to *M48* data_array plot Sets the values at which ticks on this axis appear. Only has an effect if `tickmode` is set to *array*. Used with `ticktext`. data data_array plot Sets the text displayed at the ticks position via `tickvals`. Only has an effect if `tickmode` is set to *array*. Used with `tickvals`. data enumerated outside style plot Determines whether ticks are drawn or not. If **, this axis' ticks are not drawn. If *outside* (*inside*), this axis' are drawn outside (inside) the axis lines. number 0 5 style plot Sets the tick length (in px). number 0 1 style plot Sets the tick width (in px). color #444 style plot Sets the tick color. boolean TRUE style plot Determines whether or not the tick labels are drawn. enumerated all all style plot If *all*, all tick labels are displayed with a prefix. If *first*, only the first tick is displayed with a prefix. If *last*, only the last tick is displayed with a suffix. If *none*, tick prefixes are hidden. string style plot Sets a tick label prefix. enumerated all all style plot Same as `showtickprefix` but for tick suffixes. string style plot Sets a tick label suffix. enumerated all all style plot If *all*, all exponents are shown besides their significands. If *first*, only the exponent of the first tick is shown. If *last*, only the exponent of the last tick is shown. If *none*, no exponents appear. enumerated none B style plot Determines a formatting rule for the tick exponents. For example, consider the number 1,000,000,000. If *none*, it appears as 1,000,000,000. If *e*, 1e+9. If *E*, 1E+9. If *power*, 1x10^9 (with 9 in a super script). If *SI*, 1G. If *B*, 1B. boolean FALSE style plot If "true", even 4-digit integers are separated string style TRUE TRUE plot HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. number style 1 plot color style plot plot Sets the tick font. object angle auto style plot Sets the angle of the tick labels with respect to the horizontal. For example, a `tickangle` of -90 draws the tick labels vertically. string style plot Sets the tick label formatting rule using d3 formatting mini-languages which are very similar to those in Python. For numbers, see: https://github.com/d3/d3-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format And for dates see: https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format We add one item to d3's date formatter: *%{n}f* for fractional seconds with n digits. For example, *2016-10-13 09:15:23.456* with tickformat *%H~%M~%S.%2f* would display *09~15~23.46* boolean info TRUE plot Determines whether or not this stop is used. If `false`, this stop is ignored even within its `dtickrange`. info_array info any plot plot range [*min*, *max*], where *min*, *max* - dtick values which describe some zoom level, it is possible to omit *min* or *max* value by passing *null* string style plot string - dtickformat for described zoom level, the same as *tickformat* plot string style plot When used in a template, named items are created in the output figure in addition to any items the figure already has in this array. You can modify these items in the output figure by making your own item with `templateitemname` matching this `name` alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). Has no effect outside of a template. string info plot Used to refer to a named item in this array in the template. Named items from the template will be created even without a matching item in the input figure, but you can modify one by making an item with `templateitemname` matching its `name`, alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). If there is no template or no matching item, this item will be hidden unless you explicitly show it with `visible: true`. object object string style plot Sets the hover text formatting rule using d3 formatting mini-languages which are very similar to those in Python. For numbers, see: https://github.com/d3/d3-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format And for dates see: https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format We add one item to d3's date formatter: *%{n}f* for fractional seconds with n digits. For example, *2016-10-13 09:15:23.456* with tickformat *%H~%M~%S.%2f* would display *09~15~23.46* boolean TRUE style plot Determines whether or not a line bounding this axis is drawn. color #444 style plot Sets the axis line color. number 0 1 style plot Sets the width (in px) of the axis line. boolean style plot Determines whether or not grid lines are drawn. If *true*, the grid lines are drawn at every tick mark. TRUE color #eee style plot Sets the color of the grid lines. number 0 1 style plot Sets the width (in px) of the grid lines. enumerated above traces above traces info plot Sets the layer on which this axis is displayed. If *above traces*, this axis is displayed above all the subplot's traces If *below traces*, this axis is displayed below all the subplot's traces, but above the grid lines. Useful when used together with scatter-like traces with `cliponaxis` set to *false* to show markers and/or text nodes above this axis. number 0 info 0 The minimum value visible on this axis. The maximum is determined by the sum minus the minimum values of the other two axes. The full view corresponds to all the minima set to zero. plot string info plot Value of `title` is no longer a simple *string* but a set of sub-attributes. To set the axis' title, please use `title.text` now. string style TRUE TRUE plot HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. number style 1 plot color style plot plot Sets this axis' title font. Note that the title's font used to be customized by the now deprecated `titlefont` attribute. object plot object color #444 style plot Sets default for all colors associated with this axis all at once: line, font, tick, and grid colors. Grid color is lightened by blending this with the plot background Individual pieces can override this. enumerated auto info plot Sets the tick mode for this axis. If *auto*, the number of ticks is set via `nticks`. If *linear*, the placement of the ticks is determined by a starting position `tick0` and a tick step `dtick` (*linear* is the default value if `tick0` and `dtick` are provided). If *array*, the placement of the ticks is set via `tickvals` and the tick text is `ticktext`. (*array* is the default value if `tickvals` is provided). integer 1 6 style plot Specifies the maximum number of ticks for the particular axis. The actual number of ticks will be chosen automatically to be less than or equal to `nticks`. Has an effect only if `tickmode` is set to *auto*. any style plot linear Sets the placement of the first tick on this axis. Use with `dtick`. If the axis `type` is *log*, then you must take the log of your starting tick (e.g. to set the starting tick to 100, set the `tick0` to 2) except when `dtick`=*L<f>* (see `dtick` for more info). If the axis `type` is *date*, it should be a date string, like date data. If the axis `type` is *category*, it should be a number, using the scale where each category is assigned a serial number from zero in the order it appears. any style plot linear Sets the step in-between ticks on this axis. Use with `tick0`. Must be a positive number, or special strings available to *log* and *date* axes. If the axis `type` is *log*, then ticks are set every 10^(n*dtick) where n is the tick number. For example, to set a tick mark at 1, 10, 100, 1000, ... set dtick to 1. To set tick marks at 1, 100, 10000, ... set dtick to 2. To set tick marks at 1, 5, 25, 125, 625, 3125, ... set dtick to log_10(5), or 0.69897000433. *log* has several special values; *L<f>*, where `f` is a positive number, gives ticks linearly spaced in value (but not position). For example `tick0` = 0.1, `dtick` = *L0.5* will put ticks at 0.1, 0.6, 1.1, 1.6 etc. To show powers of 10 plus small digits between, use *D1* (all digits) or *D2* (only 2 and 5). `tick0` is ignored for *D1* and *D2*. If the axis `type` is *date*, then you must convert the time to milliseconds. For example, to set the interval between ticks to one day, set `dtick` to 86400000.0. *date* also has special values *M<n>* gives ticks spaced by a number of months. `n` must be a positive integer. To set ticks on the 15th of every third month, set `tick0` to *2000-01-15* and `dtick` to *M3*. To set ticks every 4 years, set `dtick` to *M48* data_array plot Sets the values at which ticks on this axis appear. Only has an effect if `tickmode` is set to *array*. Used with `ticktext`. data data_array plot Sets the text displayed at the ticks position via `tickvals`. Only has an effect if `tickmode` is set to *array*. Used with `tickvals`. data enumerated outside style plot Determines whether ticks are drawn or not. If **, this axis' ticks are not drawn. If *outside* (*inside*), this axis' are drawn outside (inside) the axis lines. number 0 5 style plot Sets the tick length (in px). number 0 1 style plot Sets the tick width (in px). color #444 style plot Sets the tick color. boolean TRUE style plot Determines whether or not the tick labels are drawn. enumerated all all style plot If *all*, all tick labels are displayed with a prefix. If *first*, only the first tick is displayed with a prefix. If *last*, only the last tick is displayed with a suffix. If *none*, tick prefixes are hidden. string style plot Sets a tick label prefix. enumerated all all style plot Same as `showtickprefix` but for tick suffixes. string style plot Sets a tick label suffix. enumerated all all style plot If *all*, all exponents are shown besides their significands. If *first*, only the exponent of the first tick is shown. If *last*, only the exponent of the last tick is shown. If *none*, no exponents appear. enumerated none B style plot Determines a formatting rule for the tick exponents. For example, consider the number 1,000,000,000. If *none*, it appears as 1,000,000,000. If *e*, 1e+9. If *E*, 1E+9. If *power*, 1x10^9 (with 9 in a super script). If *SI*, 1G. If *B*, 1B. boolean FALSE style plot If "true", even 4-digit integers are separated string style TRUE TRUE plot HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. number style 1 plot color style plot plot Sets the tick font. object angle auto style plot Sets the angle of the tick labels with respect to the horizontal. For example, a `tickangle` of -90 draws the tick labels vertically. string style plot Sets the tick label formatting rule using d3 formatting mini-languages which are very similar to those in Python. For numbers, see: https://github.com/d3/d3-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format And for dates see: https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format We add one item to d3's date formatter: *%{n}f* for fractional seconds with n digits. For example, *2016-10-13 09:15:23.456* with tickformat *%H~%M~%S.%2f* would display *09~15~23.46* boolean info TRUE plot Determines whether or not this stop is used. If `false`, this stop is ignored even within its `dtickrange`. info_array info any plot plot range [*min*, *max*], where *min*, *max* - dtick values which describe some zoom level, it is possible to omit *min* or *max* value by passing *null* string style plot string - dtickformat for described zoom level, the same as *tickformat* plot string style plot When used in a template, named items are created in the output figure in addition to any items the figure already has in this array. You can modify these items in the output figure by making your own item with `templateitemname` matching this `name` alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). Has no effect outside of a template. string info plot Used to refer to a named item in this array in the template. Named items from the template will be created even without a matching item in the input figure, but you can modify one by making an item with `templateitemname` matching its `name`, alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). If there is no template or no matching item, this item will be hidden unless you explicitly show it with `visible: true`. object object string style plot Sets the hover text formatting rule using d3 formatting mini-languages which are very similar to those in Python. For numbers, see: https://github.com/d3/d3-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format And for dates see: https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format We add one item to d3's date formatter: *%{n}f* for fractional seconds with n digits. For example, *2016-10-13 09:15:23.456* with tickformat *%H~%M~%S.%2f* would display *09~15~23.46* boolean TRUE style plot Determines whether or not a line bounding this axis is drawn. color #444 style plot Sets the axis line color. number 0 1 style plot Sets the width (in px) of the axis line. boolean style plot Determines whether or not grid lines are drawn. If *true*, the grid lines are drawn at every tick mark. TRUE color #eee style plot Sets the color of the grid lines. number 0 1 style plot Sets the width (in px) of the grid lines. enumerated above traces above traces info plot Sets the layer on which this axis is displayed. If *above traces*, this axis is displayed above all the subplot's traces If *below traces*, this axis is displayed below all the subplot's traces, but above the grid lines. Useful when used together with scatter-like traces with `cliponaxis` set to *false* to show markers and/or text nodes above this axis. number 0 info 0 The minimum value visible on this axis. The maximum is determined by the sum minus the minimum values of the other two axes. The full view corresponds to all the minima set to zero. plot string info plot Value of `title` is no longer a simple *string* but a set of sub-attributes. To set the axis' title, please use `title.text` now. string style TRUE TRUE plot HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. number style 1 plot color style plot plot Former `titlefont` is now the sub-attribute `font` of `title`. To customize title font properties, please use `title.font` now. plot any info none Controls persistence of user-driven changes in axis `min`, and `title` if in `editable: true` configuration. Defaults to `ternary<N>.uirevision`. object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for tickvals . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for ticktext . none plot any info none Controls persistence of user-driven changes in axis `min` and `title`, if not overridden in the individual axes. Defaults to `layout.uirevision`. TRUE object color style rgba(0,0,0,0) plot number info 0 camera number info 0 camera number info 1 camera camera Sets the (x,y,z) components of the 'up' camera vector. This vector determines the up direction of this scene with respect to the page. The default is *{x: 0, y: 0, z: 1}* which means that the z axis points up. object number info 0 camera number info 0 camera number info 0 camera camera Sets the (x,y,z) components of the 'center' camera vector This vector determines the translation (x,y,z) space about the center of this scene. By default, there is no such translation. object number info 1.25 camera number info 1.25 camera number info 1.25 camera camera Sets the (x,y,z) components of the 'eye' camera vector. This vector determines the view point about the origin of this scene. object enumerated info perspective perspective calc Sets the projection type. The projection type could be either *perspective* or *orthographic*. The default is *perspective*. calc object camera object info_array info plot number 0 1 plot 0 Sets the horizontal domain of this scene subplot (in plot fraction). info_array info plot number 0 1 plot 0 Sets the vertical domain of this scene subplot (in plot fraction). plot integer 0 0 info plot If there is a layout grid, use the domain for this row in the grid for this scene subplot . integer 0 0 info plot If there is a layout grid, use the domain for this column in the grid for this scene subplot . object enumerated info auto auto plot If *cube*, this scene's axes are drawn as a cube, regardless of the axes' ranges. If *data*, this scene's axes are drawn in proportion with the axes' ranges. If *manual*, this scene's axes are drawn in proportion with the input of *aspectratio* (the default behavior if *aspectratio* is provided). If *auto*, this scene's axes are drawn using the results of *data* except when one axis is more than four times the size of the two others, where in that case the results of *cube* are used. number info 0 plot manual number info 0 plot manual number info 0 plot manual plot manual object Sets this scene's axis aspectratio. object boolean info plot A single toggle to hide the axis while preserving interaction like dragging. Default is true when a cheater plot is present on the axis, otherwise false boolean info TRUE Sets whether or not spikes starting from data points to this axis' wall are shown on hover. plot boolean info TRUE Sets whether or not spikes extending from the projection data points to this axis' wall boundaries are shown on hover. plot number style 0 2 Sets the thickness (in px) of the spikes. plot color style #444 Sets the color of the spikes. plot boolean info FALSE Sets whether or not this axis' wall has a background color. plot color style rgba(204, 204, 204, 0.5) Sets the background color of this axis' wall. plot boolean info TRUE Sets whether or not this axis is labeled plot color #444 style plot Sets default for all colors associated with this axis all at once: line, font, tick, and grid colors. Grid color is lightened by blending this with the plot background Individual pieces can override this. enumerated trace trace info plot Specifies the ordering logic for the case of categorical variables. By default, plotly uses *trace*, which specifies the order that is present in the data supplied. Set `categoryorder` to *category ascending* or *category descending* if order should be determined by the alphanumerical order of the category names. Set `categoryorder` to *array* to derive the ordering from the attribute `categoryarray`. If a category is not found in the `categoryarray` array, the sorting behavior for that attribute will be identical to the *trace* mode. The unspecified categories will follow the categories in `categoryarray`. data_array data plot Sets the order in which categories on this axis appear. Only has an effect if `categoryorder` is set to *array*. Used with `categoryorder`. string info plot Sets the title of this axis. Note that before the existence of `title.text`, the title's contents used to be defined as the `title` attribute itself. This behavior has been deprecated. string style TRUE TRUE plot HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. number style 1 plot color style plot plot Sets this axis' title font. Note that the title's font used to be customized by the now deprecated `titlefont` attribute. object plot object enumerated - - info plot TRUE Sets the axis type. By default, plotly attempts to determined the axis type by looking into the data of the traces that referenced the axis in question. enumerated TRUE TRUE info plot Determines whether or not the range of this axis is computed in relation to the input data. See `rangemode` for more info. If `range` is provided, then `autorange` is set to *false*. enumerated normal normal info plot If *normal*, the range is computed in relation to the extrema of the input data. If *tozero*`, the range extends to 0, regardless of the input data If *nonnegative*, the range is non-negative, regardless of the input data. Applies only to linear axes. info_array info any plot FALSE plot FALSE FALSE Sets the range of this axis. If the axis `type` is *log*, then you must take the log of your desired range (e.g. to set the range from 1 to 100, set the range from 0 to 2). If the axis `type` is *date*, it should be date strings, like date data, though Date objects and unix milliseconds will be accepted and converted to strings. If the axis `type` is *category*, it should be numbers, using the scale where each category is assigned a serial number from zero in the order it appears. enumerated auto info plot Sets the tick mode for this axis. If *auto*, the number of ticks is set via `nticks`. If *linear*, the placement of the ticks is determined by a starting position `tick0` and a tick step `dtick` (*linear* is the default value if `tick0` and `dtick` are provided). If *array*, the placement of the ticks is set via `tickvals` and the tick text is `ticktext`. (*array* is the default value if `tickvals` is provided). integer 0 0 style plot Specifies the maximum number of ticks for the particular axis. The actual number of ticks will be chosen automatically to be less than or equal to `nticks`. Has an effect only if `tickmode` is set to *auto*. any style plot linear Sets the placement of the first tick on this axis. Use with `dtick`. If the axis `type` is *log*, then you must take the log of your starting tick (e.g. to set the starting tick to 100, set the `tick0` to 2) except when `dtick`=*L<f>* (see `dtick` for more info). If the axis `type` is *date*, it should be a date string, like date data. If the axis `type` is *category*, it should be a number, using the scale where each category is assigned a serial number from zero in the order it appears. any style plot linear Sets the step in-between ticks on this axis. Use with `tick0`. Must be a positive number, or special strings available to *log* and *date* axes. If the axis `type` is *log*, then ticks are set every 10^(n*dtick) where n is the tick number. For example, to set a tick mark at 1, 10, 100, 1000, ... set dtick to 1. To set tick marks at 1, 100, 10000, ... set dtick to 2. To set tick marks at 1, 5, 25, 125, 625, 3125, ... set dtick to log_10(5), or 0.69897000433. *log* has several special values; *L<f>*, where `f` is a positive number, gives ticks linearly spaced in value (but not position). For example `tick0` = 0.1, `dtick` = *L0.5* will put ticks at 0.1, 0.6, 1.1, 1.6 etc. To show powers of 10 plus small digits between, use *D1* (all digits) or *D2* (only 2 and 5). `tick0` is ignored for *D1* and *D2*. If the axis `type` is *date*, then you must convert the time to milliseconds. For example, to set the interval between ticks to one day, set `dtick` to 86400000.0. *date* also has special values *M<n>* gives ticks spaced by a number of months. `n` must be a positive integer. To set ticks on the 15th of every third month, set `tick0` to *2000-01-15* and `dtick` to *M3*. To set ticks every 4 years, set `dtick` to *M48* data_array plot Sets the values at which ticks on this axis appear. Only has an effect if `tickmode` is set to *array*. Used with `tickvals`. data enumerated outside style plot Determines whether ticks are drawn or not. If **, this axis' ticks are not drawn. If *outside* (*inside*), this axis' are drawn outside (inside) the axis lines. enumerated TRUE FALSE style plot Determines if the axis lines or/and ticks are mirrored to the opposite side of the plotting area. If *true*, the axis lines are mirrored. If *ticks*, the axis lines and ticks are mirrored. If *false*, mirroring is disable. If *all*, axis lines are mirrored on all shared-axes subplots. If *allticks*, axis lines and ticks are mirrored on all shared-axes subplots. number 0 5 style plot Sets the tick length (in px). number 0 1 style plot Sets the tick width (in px). color #444 style plot Sets the tick color. boolean TRUE style plot Determines whether or not the tick labels are drawn. string style TRUE TRUE plot HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. To customize title font properties, please use `title.font` now. plot enumerated gregorian info calc gregorian Sets the calendar system to use for `range` and `tick0` if this is a date axis. This does not set the calendar for interpreting data on this axis, that's specified in the trace or via the global `layout.calendar` object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for categoryarray . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for tickvals . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for ticktext . none boolean info plot A single toggle to hide the axis while preserving interaction like dragging. If the axis `type` is *date*, it should be date strings, like date data, though Date objects and unix milliseconds will be accepted and converted to strings. The actual number of ticks will be chosen automatically to be less than or equal to `nticks`. Has an effect only if `tickmode` is set to *auto*. any style plot linear Sets the placement of the first tick on this axis. Use with `dtick`. If the axis `type` is *log*, then you must take the log of your starting tick (e.g. to set the starting tick to 100, set the `tick0` to 2) except when `dtick`=*L<f>* (see `dtick` for more info). If the axis `type` is *date*, it should be a date string, like date data. If the axis `type` is *category*, it should be a number, using the scale where each category is assigned a serial number from zero in the order it appears. any style plot linear Sets the step in-between ticks on this axis. Use with `tick0`. Must be a positive number, or special strings available to *log* and *date* axes. If the axis `type` is *log*, then ticks are set every 10^(n*dtick) where n is the tick number. For example, to set a tick mark at 1, 10, 100, 1000, ... set dtick to 1. To set tick marks at 1, 100, 10000, ... set dtick to 2. To set tick marks at 1, 5, 25, 125, 625, 3125, ... set dtick to log_10(5), or 0.69897000433. *log* has several special values; *L<f>*, where `f` is a positive number, gives ticks linearly spaced in value (but not position). For example `tick0` = 0.1, `dtick` = *L0.5* will put ticks at 0.1, 0.6, 1.1, 1.6 etc. To show powers of 10 plus small digits between, use *D1* (all digits) or *D2* (only 2 and 5). `tick0` is ignored for *D1* and *D2*. If the axis `type` is *date*, then you must convert the time to milliseconds. For example, to set the interval between ticks to one day, set `dtick` to 86400000.0. *date* also has special values *M<n>* gives ticks spaced by a number of months. `n` must be a positive integer. To set ticks on the 15th of every third month, set `tick0` to *2000-01-15* and `dtick` to *M3*. To set ticks every 4 years, set `dtick` to *M48* data_array plot Sets the values at which ticks on this axis appear. Only has an effect if `tickmode` is set to *array*. Used with `ticktext`. data data_array plot Sets the text displayed at the ticks position via `tickvals`. Only has an effect if `tickmode` is set to *array*. Used with `tickvals`. data enumerated outside style plot Determines whether ticks are drawn or not. If **, this axis' ticks are not drawn. If *outside* (*inside*), this axis' are drawn outside (inside) the axis lines. enumerated TRUE FALSE style plot Determines if the axis lines or/and ticks are mirrored to the opposite side of the plotting area. If *true*, the axis lines are mirrored. If *ticks*, the axis lines and ticks are mirrored. If *false*, mirroring is disable. If *all*, axis lines are mirrored on all shared-axes subplots. If *allticks*, axis lines and ticks are mirrored on all shared-axes subplots. number 0 5 style plot Sets the tick length (in px). number 0 1 style plot Sets the tick width (in px). color #444 style plot Sets the tick color. boolean TRUE style plot Determines whether or not the tick labels are drawn. string style TRUE TRUE plot HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. number style 1 plot color style plot plot Sets the tick font. object angle auto style plot Sets the angle of the tick labels with respect to the horizontal. For example, a `tickangle` of -90 draws the tick labels vertically. string style plot Sets a tick label prefix. enumerated all all style plot If *all*, all tick labels are displayed with a prefix. If *first*, only the first tick is displayed with a prefix. If *last*, only the last tick is displayed with a suffix. If *none*, tick prefixes are hidden. string style plot Sets a tick label suffix. enumerated all all style plot Same as `showtickprefix` but for tick suffixes. enumerated all all style plot If *all*, all exponents are shown besides their significands. If *first*, only the exponent of the first tick is shown. If *last*, only the exponent of the last tick is shown. If *none*, no exponents appear. enumerated none B style plot Determines a formatting rule for the tick exponents. For example, consider the number 1,000,000,000. If *none*, it appears as 1,000,000,000. If *e*, 1e+9. If *E*, 1E+9. If *power*, 1x10^9 (with 9 in a super script). If *SI*, 1G. If *B*, 1B. boolean FALSE style plot If "true", even 4-digit integers are separated string style plot Sets the tick label formatting rule using d3 formatting mini-languages which are very similar to those in Python. For numbers, see: https://github.com/d3/d3-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format And for dates see: https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format We add one item to d3's date formatter: *%{n}f* for fractional seconds with n digits. For example, *2016-10-13 09:15:23.456* with tickformat *%H~%M~%S.%2f* would display *09~15~23.46* boolean info TRUE plot Determines whether or not this stop is used. If `false`, this stop is ignored even within its `dtickrange`. info_array info any plot plot range [*min*, *max*], where *min*, *max* - dtick values which describe some zoom level, it is possible to omit *min* or *max* value by passing *null* string style plot string - dtickformat for described zoom level, the same as *tickformat* plot string style plot When used in a template, named items are created in the output figure in addition to any items the figure already has in this array. You can modify these items in the output figure by making your own item with `templateitemname` matching this `name` alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). Has no effect outside of a template. string info plot Used to refer to a named item in this array in the template. Named items from the template will be created even without a matching item in the input figure, but you can modify one by making an item with `templateitemname` matching its `name`, alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). If there is no template or no matching item, this item will be hidden unless you explicitly show it with `visible: true`. object object string style plot Sets the hover text formatting rule using d3 formatting mini-languages which are very similar to those in Python. For numbers, see: https://github.com/d3/d3-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format And for dates see: https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format We add one item to d3's date formatter: *%{n}f* for fractional seconds with n digits. For example, *2016-10-13 09:15:23.456* with tickformat *%H~%M~%S.%2f* would display *09~15~23.46* boolean FALSE style plot Determines whether or not a line bounding this axis is drawn. color #444 style plot Sets the axis line color. number 0 1 style plot Sets the width (in px) of the axis line. boolean style plot Determines whether or not grid lines are drawn. If *true*, the grid lines are drawn at every tick mark. color rgb(204, 204, 204) style plot Sets the color of the grid lines. number 0 1 style plot Sets the width (in px) of the grid lines. boolean style plot Determines whether or not a line is drawn at along the 0 value of this axis. If *true*, the zero line is drawn on top of the grid lines. color #444 style plot Sets the line color of the zero line. number 1 style plot Sets the width (in px) of the zero line. string info plot Value of `title` is no longer a simple *string* but a set of sub-attributes. To set the axis' title, please use `title.text` now. string style TRUE TRUE plot HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. number style 1 plot color style plot plot Former `titlefont` is now the sub-attribute `font` of `title`. To customize title font properties, please use `title.font` now. plot enumerated gregorian info calc gregorian Sets the calendar system to use for `range` and `tick0` if this is a date axis. This does not set the calendar for interpreting data on this axis, that's specified in the trace or via the global `layout.calendar` object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for categoryarray . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for tickvals . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for ticktext . none boolean info plot A single toggle to hide the axis while preserving interaction like dragging. Default is true when a cheater plot is present on the axis, otherwise false boolean info TRUE Sets whether or not spikes starting from data points to this axis' wall are shown on hover. plot boolean info TRUE Sets whether or not spikes extending from the projection data points to this axis' wall boundaries are shown on hover. plot number style 0 2 Sets the thickness (in px) of the spikes. plot color style #444 Sets the color of the spikes. plot boolean info FALSE Sets whether or not this axis' wall has a background color. plot color style rgba(204, 204, 204, 0.5) Sets the background color of this axis' wall. plot boolean info TRUE Sets whether or not this axis is labeled plot color #444 style plot Sets default for all colors associated with this axis all at once: line, font, tick, and grid colors. Grid color is lightened by blending this with the plot background Individual pieces can override this. enumerated trace trace info plot Specifies the ordering logic for the case of categorical variables. By default, plotly uses *trace*, which specifies the order that is present in the data supplied. Set `categoryorder` to *category ascending* or *category descending* if order should be determined by the alphanumerical order of the category names. Set `categoryorder` to *array* to derive the ordering from the attribute `categoryarray`. If a category is not found in the `categoryarray` array, the sorting behavior for that attribute will be identical to the *trace* mode. The unspecified categories will follow the categories in `categoryarray`. data_array data plot Sets the order in which categories on this axis appear. Only has an effect if `categoryorder` is set to *array*. Used with `categoryorder`. string info plot Sets the title of this axis. Note that before the existence of `title.text`, the title's contents used to be defined as the `title` attribute itself. This behavior has been deprecated. string style TRUE TRUE plot HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. number style 1 plot color style plot plot Sets this axis' title font. Note that the title's font used to be customized by the now deprecated `titlefont` attribute. object plot object enumerated - - info plot TRUE Sets the axis type. By default, plotly attempts to determined the axis type by looking into the data of the traces that referenced the axis in question. enumerated TRUE TRUE info plot Determines whether or not the range of this axis is computed in relation to the input data. See `rangemode` for more info. If `range` is provided, then `autorange` is set to *false*. enumerated normal normal info plot If *normal*, the range is computed in relation to the extrema of the input data. If *tozero*`, the range extends to 0, regardless of the input data If *nonnegative*, the range is non-negative, regardless of the input data. Applies only to linear axes. info_array info any plot FALSE plot FALSE FALSE Sets the range of this axis. If the axis `type` is *log*, then you must take the log of your desired range (e.g. to set the range from 1 to 100, set the range from 0 to 2). If the axis `type` is *date*, it should be date strings, like date data, though Date objects and unix milliseconds will be accepted and converted to strings. If the axis `type` is *category*, it should be numbers, using the scale where each category is assigned a serial number from zero in the order it appears. enumerated auto info plot Sets the tick mode for this axis. If *auto*, the number of ticks is set via `nticks`. If *linear*, the placement of the ticks is determined by a starting position `tick0` and a tick step `dtick` (*linear* is the default value if `tick0` and `dtick` are provided). If *array*, the placement of the ticks is set via `tickvals` and the tick text is `ticktext`. (*array* is the default value if `tickvals` is provided). integer 0 0 style plot Specifies the maximum number of ticks for the particular axis. The actual number of ticks will be chosen automatically to be less than or equal to `nticks`. Has an effect only if `tickmode` is set to *auto*. any style plot linear Sets the placement of the first tick on this axis. Use with `dtick`. If the axis `type` is *log*, then you must take the log of your starting tick (e.g. to set the starting tick to 100, set the `tick0` to 2) except when `dtick`=*L<f>* (see `dtick` for more info). If the axis `type` is *date*, it should be a date string, like date data. If the axis `type` is *category*, it should be a number, using the scale where each category is assigned a serial number from zero in the order it appears. any style plot linear Sets the step in-between ticks on this axis. Use with `tick0`. Must be a positive number, or special strings available to *log* and *date* axes. If the axis `type` is *log*, then ticks are set every 10^(n*dtick) where n is the tick number. For example, to set a tick mark at 1, 10, 100, 1000, ... set dtick to 1. To set tick marks at 1, 100, 10000, ... set dtick to 2. To set tick marks at 1, 5, 25, 125, 625, 3125, ... set dtick to log_10(5), or 0.69897000433. *log* has several special values; *L<f>*, where `f` is a positive number, gives ticks linearly spaced in value (but not position). For example `tick0` = 0.1, `dtick` = *L0.5* will put ticks at 0.1, 0.6, 1.1, 1.6 etc. To show powers of 10 plus small digits between, use *D1* (all digits) or *D2* (only 2 and 5). `tick0` is ignored for *D1* and *D2*. If the axis `type` is *date*, then you must convert the time to milliseconds. For example, to set the interval between ticks to one day, set `dtick` to 86400000.0. *date* also has special values *M<n>* gives ticks spaced by a number of months. `n` must be a positive integer. To set ticks on the 15th of every third month, set `tick0` to *2000-01-15* and `dtick` to *M3*. To set ticks every 4 years, set `dtick` to *M48* data_array plot Sets the values at which ticks on this axis appear. Only has an effect if `tickmode` is set to *array*. Used with `ticktext`. data data_array plot Sets the text displayed at the ticks position via `tickvals`. Only has an effect if `tickmode` is set to *array*. Used with `tickvals`. data enumerated outside style plot Determines whether ticks are drawn or not. If **, this axis' ticks are not drawn. If *allticks*, axis lines and ticks are mirrored on all shared-axes subplots. number 0 5 style plot Sets the tick length (in px). number 0 1 style plot Sets the tick width (in px). color #444 style plot Sets the tick color. boolean TRUE style plot Determines whether or not the tick labels are drawn. string style TRUE TRUE plot HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser.
