To customize title font properties, please use `title.font` now. plot enumerated gregorian info calc gregorian Sets the calendar system to use for `range` and `tick0` if this is a date axis. This does not set the calendar for interpreting data on this axis, that's specified in the trace or via the global `layout.calendar` object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for categoryarray . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for tickvals . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for ticktext . none enumerated info orbit plot Determines the mode of drag interactions for this scene. enumerated info closest closest modebar Determines the mode of hover interactions for this scene. any info none Controls persistence of user-driven changes in camera attributes. Defaults to `layout.uirevision`. plot info_array info camera Obsolete. Use `camera` instead. boolean info TRUE calc Determines whether or not this annotation is visible. any info Sets the annotation's x position. calc any info Sets the annotation's y position. calc any info Sets the annotation's z position. calc number info Sets the x component of the arrow tail about the arrow head (in pixels). calc number info Sets the y component of the arrow tail about the arrow head (in pixels). calc enumerated auto auto info calc Sets the text box's horizontal position anchor This anchor binds the `x` position to the *left*, *center* or *right* of the annotation. For example, if `x` is set to 1, `xref` to *paper* and `xanchor` to *right* then the right-most portion of the annotation lines up with the right-most edge of the plotting area. If *auto*, the anchor is equivalent to *center* for data-referenced annotations or if there is an arrow, whereas for paper-referenced with no arrow, the anchor picked corresponds to the closest side. number 0 style calc Shifts the position of the whole annotation and arrow to the right (positive) or left (negative) by this many pixels. enumerated auto auto info calc Sets the text box's vertical position anchor This anchor binds the `y` position to the *top*, *middle* or *bottom* of the annotation. For example, if `y` is set to 1, `yref` to *paper* and `yanchor` to *top* then the top-most portion of the annotation lines up with the top-most edge of the plotting area. If *auto*, the anchor is equivalent to *middle* for data-referenced annotations or if there is an arrow, whereas for paper-referenced with no arrow, the anchor picked corresponds to the closest side. number 0 style calc Shifts the position of the whole annotation and arrow up (positive) or down (negative) by this many pixels. string info calc Sets the text associated with this annotation. Plotly uses a subset of HTML tags to do things like newline (<br>), bold (<b></b>), italics (<i></i>), hyperlinks (<a href='...'></a>). Tags <em>, <sup>, <sub> <span> are also supported. angle 0 style calc Sets the angle at which the `text` is drawn with respect to the horizontal. string style TRUE TRUE calc HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. number style 1 calc color style calc calc Sets the annotation text font. object number 1 style calc Sets an explicit width for the text box. null (default) lets the text set the box width. Wider text will be clipped. There is no automatic wrapping; use <br> to start a new line. number 1 style calc Sets an explicit height for the text box. null (default) lets the text set the box height. Taller text will be clipped. number 0 1 1 style calc Sets the opacity of the annotation (text + arrow). enumerated left center style calc Sets the horizontal alignment of the `text` within the box. Has an effect only if `text` spans more two or more lines (i.e. `text` contains one or more <br> HTML tags) or if an explicit width is set to override the text width. enumerated top middle style calc Sets the vertical alignment of the `text` within the box. Has an effect only if an explicit height is set to override the text height. color rgba(0,0,0,0) style calc Sets the background color of the annotation. color rgba(0,0,0,0) style calc Sets the color of the border enclosing the annotation `text`. number 0 1 style calc Sets the padding (in px) between the `text` and the enclosing border. number 0 1 style calc Sets the width (in px) of the border enclosing the annotation `text`. boolean TRUE style calc Determines whether or not the annotation is drawn with an arrow. If *true*, `text` is placed near the arrow's tail. If *false*, `text` lines up with the `x` and `y` provided. color style calc Sets the color of the annotation arrow. integer 0 8 1 style calc Sets the end annotation arrow head style. integer 0 8 1 style calc Sets the start annotation arrow head style. flaglist end none end style calc Sets the annotation arrow head position. number 0.3 1 style calc Sets the size of the end annotation arrow head, relative to `arrowwidth`. A value of 1 (default) gives a head about 3x as wide as the line. number 0.3 1 style calc Sets the size of the start annotation arrow head, relative to `arrowwidth`. A value of 1 (default) gives a head about 3x as wide as the line. number 0.1 style calc Sets the width (in px) of annotation arrow line. number 0 0 style calc Sets a distance, in pixels, to move the end arrowhead away from the position it is pointing at, for example to point at the edge of a marker independent of zoom. Note that this shortens the arrow from the `ax` / `ay` vector, in contrast to `xshift` / `yshift` which moves everything by this amount. number 0 0 style calc Sets a distance, in pixels, to move the start arrowhead away from the position it is pointing at, for example to point at the edge of a marker independent of zoom. Note that this shortens the arrow from the `ax` / `ay` vector, in contrast to `xshift` / `yshift` which moves everything by this amount. string info calc Sets text to appear when hovering over this annotation. If omitted or blank, no hover label will appear. color style calc Sets the background color of the hover label. By default uses the annotation's `bgcolor` made opaque, or white if it was transparent. color style calc Sets the border color of the hover label. By default uses either dark grey or white, for maximum contrast with `hoverlabel.bgcolor`. string style TRUE TRUE calc HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. number style 1 calc color style calc calc Sets the hover label text font. By default uses the global hover font and size, with color from `hoverlabel.bordercolor`. object calc object boolean info calc Determines whether the annotation text box captures mouse move and click events, or allows those events to pass through to data points in the plot that may be behind the annotation. By default `captureevents` is *false* unless `hovertext` is provided. If you use the event `plotly_clickannotation` without `hovertext` you must explicitly enable `captureevents`. string style calc When used in a template, named items are created in the output figure in addition to any items the figure already has in this array. You can modify these items in the output figure by making your own item with `templateitemname` matching this `name` alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). Has no effect outside of a template. string info calc Used to refer to a named item in this array in the template. Named items from the template will be created even without a matching item in the input figure, but you can modify one by making an item with `templateitemname` matching its `name`, alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). If there is no template or no matching item, this item will be hidden unless you explicitly show it with `visible: true`. calc object object TRUE object info_array info number 0 1 plot 0 Sets the horizontal domain of this geo subplot (in plot fraction). Note that geo subplots are constrained by domain. In general, when `projection.scale` is set to 1. a map will fit either its x or y domain, but not both. plot info_array info number 0 1 plot 0 Sets the vertical domain of this geo subplot (in plot fraction). Note that geo subplots are constrained by domain. In general, when `projection.scale` is set to 1. a map will fit either its x or y domain, but not both. plot integer 0 0 info If there is a layout grid, use the domain for this row in the grid for this geo subplot . Note that geo subplots are constrained by domain. In general, when `projection.scale` is set to 1. a map will fit either its x or y domain, but not both. plot integer 0 0 info If there is a layout grid, use the domain for this column in the grid for this geo subplot . Note that geo subplots are constrained by domain. In general, when `projection.scale` is set to 1. a map will fit either its x or y domain, but not both. plot plot object enumerated 110 info 110 TRUE Sets the resolution of the base layers. The values have units of km/mm e.g. 110 corresponds to a scale ratio of 1:110,000,000. plot enumerated info world world Set the scope of the map. plot enumerated info equirectangular Sets the projection type. plot number info Rotates the map along parallels (in degrees East). Defaults to the center of the `lonaxis.range` values. plot number info Rotates the map along meridians (in degrees North). plot number info Roll the map (in degrees) For example, a roll of *180* makes the map appear upside down. plot plot object info_array info number plot For conic projection types only. Sets the parallels (tangent, secant) where the cone intersects the sphere. plot number info 0 1 Zooms in or out on the map view. A scale of *1* corresponds to the largest zoom level that fits the map's lon and lat ranges. plot plot object number info Sets the longitude of the map's center. By default, the map's longitude center lies at the middle of the longitude range for scoped projection and above `projection.rotation.lon` otherwise. plot number info Sets the latitude of the map's center. For all projection types, the map's latitude center lies at the middle of the latitude range by default. plot plot object boolean info Sets whether or not the coastlines are drawn. plot color style #444 Sets the coastline color. plot number style 0 1 Sets the coastline stroke width (in px). plot boolean info FALSE Sets whether or not land masses are filled in color. plot color style #F0DC82 Sets the land mass color. plot boolean info FALSE Sets whether or not oceans are filled in color. plot color style #3399FF Sets the ocean color plot boolean info FALSE Sets whether or not lakes are drawn. plot color style #3399FF Sets the color of the lakes. plot boolean info FALSE Sets whether or not rivers are drawn. plot color style #3399FF Sets color of the rivers. plot number style 0 1 Sets the stroke width (in px) of the rivers. plot boolean info Sets whether or not country boundaries are drawn. plot color style #444 Sets line color of the country boundaries. plot number style 0 1 Sets line width (in px) of the country boundaries. plot boolean info Sets whether or not boundaries of subunits within countries (e.g. states, provinces) are drawn. plot color style #444 Sets the color of the subunits boundaries. plot number style 0 1 Sets the stroke width (in px) of the subunits boundaries. plot boolean info Sets whether or not a frame is drawn around the map. plot color style #444 Sets the color the frame. plot number style 0 1 Sets the stroke width (in px) of the frame. plot color style #fff Set the background color of the map plot info_array info number plot Sets the range of this axis (in degrees), sets the map's clipped coordinates. plot boolean info FALSE Sets whether or not graticule are shown on the map. plot number info Sets the graticule's starting tick longitude/latitude. plot number info Sets the graticule's longitude/latitude tick step. plot color style #eee Sets the graticule's stroke color. plot number style 0 1 Sets the graticule's stroke width (in px). plot plot object info_array info number plot Sets the range of this axis (in degrees), sets the map's clipped coordinates. plot boolean info FALSE Sets whether or not graticule are shown on the map. plot number info Sets the graticule's starting tick longitude/latitude. plot number info Sets the graticule's longitude/latitude tick step. plot color style #eee Sets the graticule's stroke color. plot number style 0 1 Sets the graticule's stroke width (in px). plot plot object plot any info none Controls persistence of user-driven changes in the view (projection and center). Defaults to `layout.uirevision`. TRUE object info_array info number 0 1 plot 0 Sets the horizontal domain of this mapbox subplot (in plot fraction). plot info_array info number 0 1 plot 0 Sets the vertical domain of this mapbox subplot (in plot fraction). plot integer 0 0 info If there is a layout grid, use the domain for this row in the grid for this mapbox subplot . plot integer 0 0 info If there is a layout grid, use the domain for this column in the grid for this mapbox subplot . plot plot object string TRUE TRUE info Sets the mapbox access token to be used for this mapbox map. Alternatively, the mapbox access token can be set in the configuration options under `mapboxAccessToken`. plot any basic basic style Sets the Mapbox map style. Either input one of the default Mapbox style names or the URL to a custom style or a valid Mapbox style JSON. plot number 0 info Sets the longitude of the center of the map (in degrees East). plot number 0 info Sets the latitude of the center of the map (in degrees North). plot plot object number 1 info Sets the zoom level of the map (mapbox.zoom). plot number 0 info Sets the bearing angle of the map in degrees counter-clockwise from North (mapbox.bearing). plot number 0 info Sets the pitch angle of the map (in degrees, where *0* means perpendicular to the surface of the map) (mapbox.pitch). plot boolean info TRUE Determines whether this layer is displayed plot enumerated geojson geojson info Sets the source type for this layer. Support for *raster*, *image* and *video* source types is coming soon. plot any info Sets the source data for this layer (mapbox.layer.source). Source can be either a URL, a geojson object (with `sourcetype` set to *geojson*) or an array of tile URLS (with `sourcetype` set to *vector*). plot string info Specifies the layer to use from a vector tile source (mapbox.layer.source-layer). Required for *vector* source type that supports multiple layers. plot enumerated circle circle info Sets the layer type (mapbox.layer.type). Support for *raster*, *background* types is coming soon. Note that *line* and *fill* are not compatible with Point GeoJSON geometries. plot string info Determines if the layer will be inserted before the layer with the specified ID. If omitted or set to '', the layer will be inserted above every existing layer. plot color #444 style Sets the primary layer color. If `type` is *circle*, color corresponds to the circle color (mapbox.layer.paint.circle-color) If `type` is *line*, color corresponds to the line color (mapbox.layer.paint.line-color) If `type` is *fill*, color corresponds to the fill color (mapbox.layer.paint.fill-color) If `type` is *symbol*, color corresponds to the icon color (mapbox.layer.paint.icon-color) plot number 0 1 1 info Sets the opacity of the layer. If `type` is *circle*, opacity corresponds to the circle opacity (mapbox.layer.paint.circle-opacity) If `type` is *line*, opacity corresponds to the line opacity (mapbox.layer.paint.line-opacity) If `type` is *fill*, opacity corresponds to the fill opacity (mapbox.layer.paint.fill-opacity) If `type` is *symbol*, opacity corresponds to the icon/text opacity (mapbox.layer.paint.text-opacity) plot number 0 24 0 info Sets the minimum zoom level (mapbox.layer.minzoom). At zoom levels less than the minzoom, the layer will be hidden. plot number 0 24 24 info Sets the maximum zoom level (mapbox.layer.maxzoom). At zoom levels equal to or greater than the maxzoom, the layer will be hidden. plot number 15 style Sets the circle radius (mapbox.layer.paint.circle-radius). Has an effect only when `type` is set to *circle*. plot plot object number 2 style Sets the line width (mapbox.layer.paint.line-width). Has an effect only when `type` is set to *line*. plot data_array data Sets the length of dashes and gaps (mapbox.layer.paint.line-dasharray). Has an effect only when `type` is set to *line*. plot plot object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for dash . none color #444 style Sets the fill outline color (mapbox.layer.paint.fill-outline-color). Has an effect only when `type` is set to *fill*. plot plot object string marker style Sets the symbol icon image (mapbox.layer.layout.icon-image). Full list: https://www.mapbox.com/maki-icons/ plot number 10 style Sets the symbol icon size (mapbox.layer.layout.icon-size). Has an effect only when `type` is set to *symbol*. plot string info Sets the symbol text (mapbox.layer.layout.text-field). plot enumerated point point info Sets the symbol and/or text placement (mapbox.layer.layout.symbol-placement). If `placement` is *point*, the label is placed where the geometry is located If `placement` is *line*, the label is placed along the line of the geometry If `placement` is *line-center*, the label is placed on the center of the geometry plot string style TRUE TRUE HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. Open Sans Regular, Arial Unicode MS Regular plot number style 1 plot color style plot Sets the icon text font (color=mapbox.layer.paint.text-color, size=mapbox.layer.layout.text-size). Has an effect only when `type` is set to *symbol*. plot object enumerated top left middle center FALSE style plot Sets the positions of the `text` elements with respects to the (x,y) coordinates. plot object string style plot When used in a template, named items are created in the output figure in addition to any items the figure already has in this array. You can modify these items in the output figure by making your own item with `templateitemname` matching this `name` alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). Has no effect outside of a template. string info plot Used to refer to a named item in this array in the template. Named items from the template will be created even without a matching item in the input figure, but you can modify one by making an item with `templateitemname` matching its `name`, alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). If there is no template or no matching item, this item will be hidden unless you explicitly show it with `visible: true`. plot object object plot any info none Controls persistence of user-driven changes in the view: `center`, `zoom`, `bearing`, `pitch`. Defaults to `layout.uirevision`. TRUE object info_array info plot number 0 1 plot 0 Sets the horizontal domain of this polar subplot (in plot fraction). info_array info plot number 0 1 plot 0 Sets the vertical domain of this polar subplot (in plot fraction). plot integer 0 0 info plot If there is a layout grid, use the domain for this row in the grid for this polar subplot . integer 0 0 info plot If there is a layout grid, use the domain for this column in the grid for this polar subplot . object info_array number plot 0 info plot Sets angular span of this polar subplot with two angles (in degrees). Sector are assumed to be spanned in the counterclockwise direction with *0* corresponding to rightmost limit of the polar subplot. number 0 1 0 plot info Sets the fraction of the radius to cut out of the polar subplot. color style plot #fff Set the background color of the subplot boolean info plot A single toggle to hide the axis while preserving interaction like dragging. Default is true when a cheater plot is present on the axis, otherwise false TRUE enumerated - - info calc TRUE Sets the axis type. By default, plotly attempts to determined the axis type by looking into the data of the traces that referenced the axis in question. enumerated TRUE TRUE info plot Determines whether or not the range of this axis is computed in relation to the input data. See `rangemode` for more info. If `range` is provided, then `autorange` is set to *false*. enumerated tozero tozero style calc If *tozero*`, the range extends to 0, regardless of the input data If *nonnegative*, the range is non-negative, regardless of the input data. If *normal*, the range is computed in relation to the extrema of the input data (same behavior as for cartesian axes). info_array info any plot FALSE plot FALSE TRUE Sets the range of this axis. If the axis `type` is *log*, then you must take the log of your desired range (e.g. to set the range from 1 to 100, set the range from 0 to 2). If the axis `type` is *date*, it should be date strings, like date data, though Date objects and unix milliseconds will be accepted and converted to strings. If the axis `type` is *category*, it should be numbers, using the scale where each category is assigned a serial number from zero in the order it appears. enumerated trace trace info calc Specifies the ordering logic for the case of categorical variables. By default, plotly uses *trace*, which specifies the order that is present in the data supplied. Set `categoryorder` to *category ascending* or *category descending* if order should be determined by the alphanumerical order of the category names. Set `categoryorder` to *array* to derive the ordering from the attribute `categoryarray`. If a category is not found in the `categoryarray` array, the sorting behavior for that attribute will be identical to the *trace* mode. The unspecified categories will follow the categories in `categoryarray`. data_array data calc Sets the order in which categories on this axis appear. Only has an effect if `categoryorder` is set to *array*. Used with `categoryorder`. angle plot info Sets the angle (in degrees) from which the radial axis is drawn. Note that by default, radial axis line on the theta=0 line corresponds to a line pointing right (like what mathematicians prefer). Defaults to the first `polar.sector` angle. enumerated clockwise clockwise plot info Determines on which side of radial axis line the tick and tick labels appear. string info plot Sets the title of this axis. Note that before the existence of `title.text`, the title's contents used to be defined as the `title` attribute itself. This behavior has been deprecated. string style TRUE TRUE plot HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. number style 1 plot color style plot plot Sets this axis' title font. Note that the title's font used to be customized by the now deprecated `titlefont` attribute. object plot object string style none Sets the hover text formatting rule using d3 formatting mini-languages which are very similar to those in Python. For numbers, see: https://github.com/d3/d3-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format And for dates see: https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format We add one item to d3's date formatter: *%{n}f* for fractional seconds with n digits. For example, *2016-10-13 09:15:23.456* with tickformat *%H~%M~%S.%2f* would display *09~15~23.46* any info none Controls persistence of user-driven changes in axis `range`, `autorange`, `angle`, and `title` if in `editable: true` configuration. Defaults to `polar<N>.uirevision`. plot string info ticks Value of `title` is no longer a simple *string* but a set of sub-attributes. To set the axis' title, please use `title.text` now. string style TRUE TRUE ticks HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. number style 1 ticks color style ticks ticks Former `titlefont` is now the sub-attribute `font` of `title`. To customize title font properties, please use `title.font` now. color #444 style plot Sets default for all colors associated with this axis all at once: line, font, tick, and grid colors. Grid color is lightened by blending this with the plot background Individual pieces can override this. boolean TRUE style plot Determines whether or not a line bounding this axis is drawn. color #444 style plot Sets the axis line color. number 0 1 style plot Sets the width (in px) of the axis line. boolean style plot Determines whether or not grid lines are drawn. If *true*, the grid lines are drawn at every tick mark. TRUE color #eee style plot Sets the color of the grid lines. number 0 1 style plot Sets the width (in px) of the grid lines. enumerated auto info plot Sets the tick mode for this axis. If *auto*, the number of ticks is set via `nticks`. If *linear*, the placement of the ticks is determined by a starting position `tick0` and a tick step `dtick` (*linear* is the default value if `tick0` and `dtick` are provided). If *array*, the placement of the ticks is set via `tickvals` and the tick text is `ticktext`. (*array* is the default value if `tickvals` is provided). integer 0 0 style plot Specifies the maximum number of ticks for the particular axis. The actual number of ticks will be chosen automatically to be less than or equal to `nticks`. Has an effect only if `tickmode` is set to *auto*. any style plot linear Sets the placement of the first tick on this axis. Use with `dtick`. If the axis `type` is *log*, then you must take the log of your starting tick (e.g. to set the starting tick to 100, set the `tick0` to 2) except when `dtick`=*L<f>* (see `dtick` for more info). If the axis `type` is *date*, it should be a date string, like date data. If the axis `type` is *category*, it should be a number, using the scale where each category is assigned a serial number from zero in the order it appears. any style plot linear Sets the step in-between ticks on this axis. Use with `tick0`. Must be a positive number, or special strings available to *log* and *date* axes. If the axis `type` is *log*, then ticks are set every 10^(n*dtick) where n is the tick number. For example, to set a tick mark at 1, 10, 100, 1000, ... set dtick to 1. To set tick marks at 1, 100, 10000, ... set dtick to 2. To set tick marks at 1, 5, 25, 125, 625, 3125, ... set dtick to log_10(5), or 0.69897000433. *log* has several special values; *L<f>*, where `f` is a positive number, gives ticks linearly spaced in value (but not position). For example `tick0` = 0.1, `dtick` = *L0.5* will put ticks at 0.1, 0.6, 1.1, 1.6 etc. To show powers of 10 plus small digits between, use *D1* (all digits) or *D2* (only 2 and 5). `tick0` is ignored for *D1* and *D2*. If the axis `type` is *date*, then you must convert the time to milliseconds. For example, to set the interval between ticks to one day, set `dtick` to 86400000.0. *date* also has special values *M<n>* gives ticks spaced by a number of months. `n` must be a positive integer. To set ticks on the 15th of every third month, set `tick0` to *2000-01-15* and `dtick` to *M3*. To set ticks every 4 years, set `dtick` to *M48* data_array plot Sets the values at which ticks on this axis appear. Only has an effect if `tickmode` is set to *array*. Used with `ticktext`. data data_array plot Sets the text displayed at the ticks position via `tickvals`. Only has an effect if `tickmode` is set to *array*. Used with `tickvals`. data enumerated outside style plot Determines whether ticks are drawn or not. If **, this axis' ticks are not drawn. If *outside* (*inside*), this axis' are drawn outside (inside) the axis lines. number 0 5 style plot Sets the tick length (in px). number 0 1 style plot Sets the tick width (in px). color #444 style plot Sets the tick color. boolean TRUE style plot Determines whether or not the tick labels are drawn. enumerated all all style plot If *all*, all tick labels are displayed with a prefix. If *first*, only the first tick is displayed with a prefix. If *last*, only the last tick is displayed with a suffix. If *none*, tick prefixes are hidden. string style plot Sets a tick label prefix. enumerated all all style plot Same as `showtickprefix` but for tick suffixes. string style plot Sets a tick label suffix. enumerated all all style plot If *all*, all exponents are shown besides their significands. If *first*, only the exponent of the first tick is shown. If *last*, only the exponent of the last tick is shown. If *none*, no exponents appear. enumerated none B style plot Determines a formatting rule for the tick exponents. For example, consider the number 1,000,000,000. If *none*, it appears as 1,000,000,000. If *e*, 1e+9. If *E*, 1E+9. If *power*, 1x10^9 (with 9 in a super script). If *SI*, 1G. If *B*, 1B. boolean FALSE style plot If "true", even 4-digit integers are separated string style TRUE TRUE plot HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. number style 1 plot color style plot plot Sets the tick font. object angle auto style plot Sets the angle of the tick labels with respect to the horizontal. For example, a `tickangle` of -90 draws the tick labels vertically. string style plot Sets the tick label formatting rule using d3 formatting mini-languages which are very similar to those in Python. For numbers, see: https://github.com/d3/d3-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format And for dates see: https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format We add one item to d3's date formatter: *%{n}f* for fractional seconds with n digits. For example, *2016-10-13 09:15:23.456* with tickformat *%H~%M~%S.%2f* would display *09~15~23.46* boolean info TRUE plot Determines whether or not this stop is used. If `false`, this stop is ignored even within its `dtickrange`. info_array info any plot plot range [*min*, *max*], where *min*, *max* - dtick values which describe some zoom level, it is possible to omit *min* or *max* value by passing *null* string style plot string - dtickformat for described zoom level, the same as *tickformat* plot string style plot When used in a template, named items are created in the output figure in addition to any items the figure already has in this array. You can modify these items in the output figure by making your own item with `templateitemname` matching this `name` alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). Has no effect outside of a template. string info plot Used to refer to a named item in this array in the template. Named items from the template will be created even without a matching item in the input figure, but you can modify one by making an item with `templateitemname` matching its `name`, alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). If there is no template or no matching item, this item will be hidden unless you explicitly show it with `visible: true`. object object enumerated above traces above traces info plot Sets the layer on which this axis is displayed. If *above traces*, this axis is displayed above all the subplot's traces If *below traces*, this axis is displayed below all the subplot's traces, but above the grid lines. Useful when used together with scatter-like traces with `cliponaxis` set to *false* to show markers and/or text nodes above this axis. enumerated gregorian info calc gregorian Sets the calendar system to use for `range` and `tick0` if this is a date axis. This does not set the calendar for interpreting data on this axis, that's specified in the trace or via the global `layout.calendar` object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for categoryarray . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for tickvals . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for ticktext . none boolean info plot A single toggle to hide the axis while preserving interaction like dragging. Default is true when a cheater plot is present on the axis, otherwise false TRUE enumerated - - info calc TRUE Sets the angular axis type. If *linear*, set `thetaunit` to determine the unit in which axis value are shown. If *category, use `period` to set the number of integer coordinates around polar axis. enumerated trace trace info calc Specifies the ordering logic for the case of categorical variables. By default, plotly uses *trace*, which specifies the order that is present in the data supplied. Set `categoryorder` to *category ascending* or *category descending* if order should be determined by the alphanumerical order of the category names. Set `categoryorder` to *array* to derive the ordering from the attribute `categoryarray`. If a category is not found in the `categoryarray` array, the sorting behavior for that attribute will be identical to the *trace* mode. The unspecified categories will follow the categories in `categoryarray`. data_array data calc Sets the order in which categories on this axis appear. Has an effect only when `angularaxis.type` is *linear*. number calc 0 info Set the angular period. Has an effect only when `angularaxis.type` is *category*. enumerated counterclockwise counterclockwise info calc Sets the direction corresponding to positive angles. angle calc info Sets that start position (in degrees) of the angular axis By default, polar subplots with `direction` set to *counterclockwise* get a `rotation` of *0* which corresponds to due East (like what mathematicians prefer). In turn, polar with `direction` set to *clockwise* get a rotation of *90* which corresponds to due North (like on a compass), string style none Sets the hover text formatting rule using d3 formatting mini-languages which are very similar to those in Python. For numbers, see: https://github.com/d3/d3-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format And for dates see: https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format We add one item to d3's date formatter: *%{n}f* for fractional seconds with n digits. For example, *2016-10-13 09:15:23.456* with tickformat *%H~%M~%S.%2f* would display *09~15~23.46* any info none Controls persistence of user-driven changes in axis `rotation`. Defaults to `polar<N>.uirevision`. plot color #444 style plot Sets default for all colors associated with this axis all at once: line, font, tick, and grid colors. Grid color is lightened by blending this with the plot background Individual pieces can override this. boolean TRUE style plot Determines whether or not a line bounding this axis is drawn. color #444 style plot Sets the axis line color. number 0 1 style plot Sets the width (in px) of the axis line. boolean style plot Determines whether or not grid lines are drawn. If *true*, the grid lines are drawn at every tick mark. TRUE color #eee style plot Sets the color of the grid lines. number 0 1 style plot Sets the width (in px) of the grid lines. enumerated auto info plot Sets the tick mode for this axis. If *auto*, the number of ticks is set via `nticks`. If *linear*, the placement of the ticks is determined by a starting position `tick0` and a tick step `dtick` (*linear* is the default value if `tick0` and `dtick` are provided). If *array*, the placement of the ticks is set via `tickvals` and the tick text is `ticktext`. (*array* is the default value if `tickvals` is provided). integer 0 0 style plot Specifies the maximum number of ticks for the particular axis. The actual number of ticks will be chosen automatically to be less than or equal to `nticks`. Has an effect only if `tickmode` is set to *auto*. any style plot linear Sets the placement of the first tick on this axis. Use with `dtick`. If the axis `type` is *log*, then you must take the log of your starting tick (e.g. to set the starting tick to 100, set the `tick0` to 2) except when `dtick`=*L<f>* (see `dtick` for more info). If the axis `type` is *date*, it should be a date string, like date data. If the axis `type` is *category*, it should be a number, using the scale where each category is assigned a serial number from zero in the order it appears. any style plot linear Sets the step in-between ticks on this axis. Use with `tick0`. Must be a positive number, or special strings available to *log* and *date* axes. If the axis `type` is *log*, then ticks are set every 10^(n*dtick) where n is the tick number. For example, to set a tick mark at 1, 10, 100, 1000, ... set dtick to 1. To set tick marks at 1, 100, 10000, ... set dtick to 2. To set tick marks at 1, 5, 25, 125, 625, 3125, ... set dtick to log_10(5), or 0.69897000433. *log* has several special values; *L<f>*, where `f` is a positive number, gives ticks linearly spaced in value (but not position). For example `tick0` = 0.1, `dtick` = *L0.5* will put ticks at 0.1, 0.6, 1.1, 1.6 etc. To show powers of 10 plus small digits between, use *D1* (all digits) or *D2* (only 2 and 5). `tick0` is ignored for *D1* and *D2*. If the axis `type` is *date*, then you must convert the time to milliseconds. For example, to set the interval between ticks to one day, set `dtick` to 86400000.0. *date* also has special values *M<n>* gives ticks spaced by a number of months. `n` must be a positive integer. To set ticks on the 15th of every third month, set `tick0` to *2000-01-15* and `dtick` to *M3*. To set ticks every 4 years, set `dtick` to *M48* data_array plot Sets the values at which ticks on this axis appear. Only has an effect if `tickmode` is set to *array*. Used with `ticktext`. data data_array plot Sets the text displayed at the ticks position via `tickvals`. Only has an effect if `tickmode` is set to *array*. Used with `tickvals`. data enumerated outside style plot Determines whether ticks are drawn or not. If **, this axis' ticks are not drawn. If *outside* (*inside*), this axis' are drawn outside (inside) the axis lines. number 0 5 style plot Sets the tick length (in px). number 0 1 style plot Sets the tick width (in px). color #444 style plot Sets the tick color. boolean TRUE style plot Determines whether or not the tick labels are drawn. enumerated all all style plot If *all*, all tick labels are displayed with a prefix. If *first*, only the first tick is displayed with a prefix. If *last*, only the last tick is displayed with a suffix. If *none*, tick prefixes are hidden. string style plot Sets a tick label prefix. enumerated all all style plot Same as `showtickprefix` but for tick suffixes. string style plot Sets a tick label suffix. enumerated all all style plot If *all*, all exponents are shown besides their significands. If *first*, only the exponent of the first tick is shown. If *last*, only the exponent of the last tick is shown. If *none*, no exponents appear. enumerated none B style plot Determines a formatting rule for the tick exponents. For example, consider the number 1,000,000,000. If *none*, it appears as 1,000,000,000. If *e*, 1e+9. If *E*, 1E+9. If *power*, 1x10^9 (with 9 in a super script). If *SI*, 1G. If *B*, 1B. boolean FALSE style plot If "true", even 4-digit integers are separated string style TRUE TRUE plot HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. number style 1 plot color style plot plot Sets the tick font. object angle auto style plot Sets the angle of the tick labels with respect to the horizontal. For example, a `tickangle` of -90 draws the tick labels vertically. string style plot Sets the tick label formatting rule using d3 formatting mini-languages which are very similar to those in Python. For numbers, see: https://github.com/d3/d3-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format And for dates see: https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format/blob/master/README.md#locale_format We add one item to d3's date formatter: *%{n}f* for fractional seconds with n digits. For example, *2016-10-13 09:15:23.456* with tickformat *%H~%M~%S.%2f* would display *09~15~23.46* boolean info TRUE plot Determines whether or not this stop is used. If `false`, this stop is ignored even within its `dtickrange`. info_array info any plot plot range [*min*, *max*], where *min*, *max* - dtick values which describe some zoom level, it is possible to omit *min* or *max* value by passing *null* string style plot string - dtickformat for described zoom level, the same as *tickformat* plot string style plot When used in a template, named items are created in the output figure in addition to any items the figure already has in this array. You can modify these items in the output figure by making your own item with `templateitemname` matching this `name` alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). Has no effect outside of a template. string info plot Used to refer to a named item in this array in the template. Named items from the template will be created even without a matching item in the input figure, but you can modify one by making an item with `templateitemname` matching its `name`, alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). If there is no template or no matching item, this item will be hidden unless you explicitly show it with `visible: true`. object object enumerated above traces above traces info plot Sets the layer on which this axis is displayed. If *above traces*, this axis is displayed above all the subplot's traces If *below traces*, this axis is displayed below all the subplot's traces, but above the grid lines. Useful when used together with scatter-like traces with `cliponaxis` set to *false* to show markers and/or text nodes above this axis. object string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for categoryarray . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for tickvals . none string info Sets the source reference on plot.ly for ticktext . none enumerated circular circular style plot Determines if the radial axis grid lines and angular axis line are drawn as *circular* sectors or as *linear* (polygon) sectors. Has an effect only when the angular axis has `type` *category*. Note that `radialaxis.angle` is snapped to the angle of the closest vertex when `gridshape` is *circular* (so that radial axis scale is the same as the data scale). any info none Controls persistence of user-driven changes in axis attributes, if not overridden in the individual axes. Defaults to `layout.uirevision`. calc TRUE object info_array info number plot Legacy polar charts are deprecated! Please switch to *polar* subplots. Defines the start and end point of this radial axis. plot info_array info number 0 1 plot 0 plot Polar chart subplots are not supported yet. This key has currently no effect. number style Legacy polar charts are deprecated! Please switch to *polar* subplots. Please switch to *polar* subplots. Sets the direction corresponding to positive angles in legacy polar charts. plot angle info Legacy polar charts are deprecated! Please switch to *polar* subplots. Rotates the entire polar by the given angle in legacy polar charts. plot plot color style legend Sets the legend background color. color #444 style legend Sets the color of the border enclosing the legend. number 0 0 style legend Sets the width (in px) of the border enclosing the legend. string style TRUE TRUE legend HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. number style 1 legend color style legend legend Sets the font used to text the legend items. object enumerated v v info legend Sets the orientation of the legend. flaglist reversed normal style legend Determines the order at which the legend items are displayed. If *normal*, the items are displayed top-to-bottom in the same order as the input data. If *reversed*, the items are displayed in the opposite order as *normal*. If *grouped*, the items are displayed in groups (when a trace `legendgroup` is provided). if *grouped+reversed*, the items are displayed in the opposite order as *grouped*. number 0 10 style legend Sets the amount of vertical space (in px) between legend groups. number -2 3 1.02 style legend Sets the x position (in normalized coordinates) of the legend. enumerated auto left info legend Sets the legend's horizontal position anchor. This anchor binds the `x` position to the *left*, *center* or *right* of the legend. number -2 3 1 style legend Sets the y position (in normalized coordinates) of the legend. enumerated auto auto info legend Sets the legend's vertical position anchor This anchor binds the `y` position to the *top*, *middle* or *bottom* of the legend. any info none Controls persistence of legend-driven changes in trace and pie label visibility. Defaults to `layout.uirevision`. enumerated top middle style legend Sets the vertical alignment of the symbols with respect to their associated text. legend object boolean info TRUE calc+arraydraw Determines whether or not this annotation is visible. string info calc+arraydraw Sets the text associated with this annotation. Plotly uses a subset of HTML tags to do things like newline (<br>), bold (<b></b>), italics (<i></i>), hyperlinks (<a href='...'></a>). Tags <em>, <sup>, <sub> <span> are also supported. angle 0 style calc+arraydraw Sets the angle at which the `text` is drawn with respect to the horizontal. string style TRUE TRUE calc+arraydraw HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. number style 1 calc+arraydraw color style arraydraw calc+arraydraw Sets the annotation text font. object number 1 style calc+arraydraw Sets an explicit width for the text box. null (default) lets the text set the box width. Wider text will be clipped. There is no automatic wrapping; use <br> to start a new line. number 1 style calc+arraydraw Sets an explicit height for the text box. null (default) lets the text set the box height. Taller text will be clipped. number 0 1 1 style arraydraw Sets the opacity of the annotation (text + arrow). enumerated left center style arraydraw Sets the horizontal alignment of the `text` within the box. Has an effect only if `text` spans more two or more lines (i.e. `text` contains one or more <br> HTML tags) or if an explicit width is set to override the text width. enumerated top middle style arraydraw Sets the vertical alignment of the `text` within the box. Has an effect only if an explicit height is set to override the text height. color rgba(0,0,0,0) style arraydraw Sets the background color of the annotation. color rgba(0,0,0,0) style arraydraw Sets the color of the border enclosing the annotation `text`. number 0 1 style calc+arraydraw Sets the padding (in px) between the `text` and the enclosing border. number 0 1 style calc+arraydraw Sets the width (in px) of the border enclosing the annotation `text`. boolean TRUE style calc+arraydraw Determines whether or not the annotation is drawn with an arrow. If *true*, `text` is placed near the arrow's tail. If *false*, `text` lines up with the `x` and `y` provided. color style arraydraw Sets the color of the annotation arrow. integer 0 8 1 style arraydraw Sets the end annotation arrow head style. integer 0 8 1 style arraydraw Sets the start annotation arrow head style. flaglist end none end style arraydraw Sets the annotation arrow head position. number 0.3 1 style calc+arraydraw Sets the size of the end annotation arrow head, relative to `arrowwidth`. A value of 1 (default) gives a head about 3x as wide as the line. number 0.3 1 style calc+arraydraw Sets the size of the start annotation arrow head, relative to `arrowwidth`. A value of 1 (default) gives a head about 3x as wide as the line. number 0.1 style calc+arraydraw Sets the width (in px) of annotation arrow line. number 0 0 style calc+arraydraw Sets a distance, in pixels, to move the end arrowhead away from the position it is pointing at, for example to point at the edge of a marker independent of zoom. Note that this shortens the arrow from the `ax` / `ay` vector, in contrast to `xshift` / `yshift` which moves everything by this amount. number 0 0 style calc+arraydraw Sets a distance, in pixels, to move the start arrowhead away from the position it is pointing at, for example to point at the edge of a marker independent of zoom. Note that this shortens the arrow from the `ax` / `ay` vector, in contrast to `xshift` / `yshift` which moves everything by this amount. any info calc+arraydraw Sets the x component of the arrow tail about the arrow head. If `axref` is `pixel`, a positive (negative) component corresponds to an arrow pointing from right to left (left to right). If `axref` is an axis, this is an absolute value on that axis, like `x`, NOT a relative value. any info calc+arraydraw Sets the y component of the arrow tail about the arrow head. If `ayref` is `pixel`, a positive (negative) component corresponds to an arrow pointing from bottom to top (top to bottom). If `ayref` is an axis, this is an absolute value on that axis, like `y`, NOT a relative value. enumerated pixel pixel info calc Indicates in what terms the tail of the annotation (ax,ay) is specified. If `pixel`, `ax` is a relative offset in pixels from `x`. If set to an x axis id (e.g. *x* or *x2*), `ax` is specified in the same terms as that axis. This is useful for trendline annotations which should continue to indicate the correct trend when zoomed. enumerated pixel pixel info calc Indicates in what terms the tail of the annotation (ax,ay) is specified. If `pixel`, `ay` is a relative offset in pixels from `y`. If set to a y axis id (e.g. *y* or *y2*), `ay` is specified in the same terms as that axis. This is useful for trendline annotations which should continue to indicate the correct trend when zoomed. enumerated paper info calc Sets the annotation's x coordinate axis. If set to an x axis id (e.g. *x* or *x2*), the `x` position refers to an x coordinate If set to *paper*, the `x` position refers to the distance from the left side of the plotting area in normalized coordinates where 0 (1) corresponds to the left (right) side. any info calc+arraydraw Sets the annotation's x position. If the axis `type` is *log*, then you must take the log of your desired range. If the axis `type` is *date*, it should be date strings, like date data, though Date objects and unix milliseconds will be accepted and converted to strings. If the axis `type` is *category*, it should be numbers, using the scale where each category is assigned a serial number from zero in the order it appears. enumerated auto auto info calc+arraydraw Sets the text box's horizontal position anchor This anchor binds the `x` position to the *left*, *center* or *right* of the annotation. For example, if `x` is set to 1, `xref` to *paper* and `xanchor` to *right* then the right-most portion of the annotation lines up with the right-most edge of the plotting area. If *auto*, the anchor is equivalent to *center* for data-referenced annotations or if there is an arrow, whereas for paper-referenced with no arrow, the anchor picked corresponds to the closest side. number 0 style calc+arraydraw Shifts the position of the whole annotation and arrow to the right (positive) or left (negative) by this many pixels. enumerated paper info calc Sets the annotation's y coordinate axis. If set to an y axis id (e.g. *y* or *y2*), the `y` position refers to an y coordinate If set to *paper*, the `y` position refers to the distance from the bottom of the plotting area in normalized coordinates where 0 (1) corresponds to the bottom (top). any info calc+arraydraw Sets the annotation's y position. If the axis `type` is *log*, then you must take the log of your desired range. If the axis `type` is *date*, it should be date strings, like date data, though Date objects and unix milliseconds will be accepted and converted to strings. If the axis `type` is *category*, it should be numbers, using the scale where each category is assigned a serial number from zero in the order it appears. enumerated auto auto info calc+arraydraw Sets the text box's vertical position anchor This anchor binds the `y` position to the *top*, *middle* or *bottom* of the annotation. For example, if `y` is set to 1, `yref` to *paper* and `yanchor` to *top* then the top-most portion of the annotation lines up with the top-most edge of the plotting area. If *auto*, the anchor is equivalent to *middle* for data-referenced annotations or if there is an arrow, whereas for paper-referenced with no arrow, the anchor picked corresponds to the closest side. number 0 style calc+arraydraw Shifts the position of the whole annotation and arrow up (positive) or down (negative) by this many pixels. enumerated FALSE FALSE style arraydraw Makes this annotation respond to clicks on the plot. If you click a data point that exactly matches the `x` and `y` values of this annotation, and it is hidden (visible: false), it will appear. In *onoff* mode, you must click the same point again to make it disappear, so if you click multiple points, you can show multiple annotations. In *onout* mode, a click anywhere else in the plot (on another data point or not) will hide this annotation. If you need to show/hide this annotation in response to different `x` or `y` values, you can set `xclick` and/or `yclick`. This is useful for example to label the side of a bar. To label markers though, `standoff` is preferred over `xclick` and `yclick`. any info arraydraw Toggle this annotation when clicking a data point whose `x` value is `xclick` rather than the annotation's `x` value. any info arraydraw Toggle this annotation when clicking a data point whose `y` value is `yclick` rather than the annotation's `y` value. string info arraydraw Sets text to appear when hovering over this annotation. If omitted or blank, no hover label will appear. color style arraydraw Sets the background color of the hover label. By default uses the annotation's `bgcolor` made opaque, or white if it was transparent. color style arraydraw Sets the border color of the hover label. By default uses either dark grey or white, for maximum contrast with `hoverlabel.bgcolor`. string style TRUE TRUE arraydraw HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. number style 1 arraydraw color style arraydraw arraydraw Sets the hover label text font. By default uses the global hover font and size, with color from `hoverlabel.bordercolor`. object arraydraw object boolean info arraydraw Determines whether the annotation text box captures mouse move and click events, or allows those events to pass through to data points in the plot that may be behind the annotation. By default `captureevents` is *false* unless `hovertext` is provided. If you use the event `plotly_clickannotation` without `hovertext` you must explicitly enable `captureevents`. calc string info calc Obsolete. Set `xref` and `yref` separately instead. string style none When used in a template, named items are created in the output figure in addition to any items the figure already has in this array. You can modify these items in the output figure by making your own item with `templateitemname` matching this `name` alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). Has no effect outside of a template. string info calc Used to refer to a named item in this array in the template. Named items from the template will be created even without a matching item in the input figure, but you can modify one by making an item with `templateitemname` matching its `name`, alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). If there is no template or no matching item, this item will be hidden unless you explicitly show it with `visible: true`. object object boolean info TRUE calc+arraydraw Determines whether or not this shape is visible. enumerated circle info calc+arraydraw Specifies the shape type to be drawn. If *line*, a line is drawn from (`x0`,`y0`) to (`x1`,`y1`) with respect to the axes' sizing mode. If *circle*, a circle is drawn from ((`x0`+`x1`)/2, (`y0`+`y1`)/2)) with radius (|(`x0`+`x1`)/2 - `x0`|, |(`y0`+`y1`)/2 -`y0`)|) with respect to the axes' sizing mode. If *rect*, a rectangle is drawn linking (`x0`,`y0`), (`x1`,`y0`), (`x1`,`y1`), (`x0`,`y1`), (`x0`,`y0`) with respect to the axes' sizing mode. If *path*, draw a custom SVG path using `path`. with respect to the axes' sizing mode. enumerated below above info arraydraw Specifies whether shapes are drawn below or above traces. enumerated paper info calc Sets the shape's x coordinate axis. If set to an x axis id (e.g. *x* or *x2*), the `x` position refers to an x coordinate. If set to *paper*, the `x` position refers to the distance from the left side of the plotting area in normalized coordinates where *0* (*1*) corresponds to the left (right) side. If the axis `type` is *log*, then you must take the log of your desired range. If the axis `type` is *date*, then you must convert the date to unix time in milliseconds. enumerated scaled scaled info calc+arraydraw Sets the shapes's sizing mode along the x axis. If set to *scaled*, `x0`, `x1` and x coordinates within `path` refer to data values on the x axis or a fraction of the plot area's width (`xref` set to *paper*). If set to *pixel*, `xanchor` specifies the x position in terms of data or plot fraction but `x0`, `x1` and x coordinates within `path` are pixels relative to `xanchor`. This way, the shape can have a fixed width while maintaining a position relative to data or plot fraction. any info calc+arraydraw Only relevant in conjunction with `xsizemode` set to *pixel*. Specifies the anchor point on the x axis to which `x0`, `x1` and x coordinates within `path` are relative to. E.g. useful to attach a pixel sized shape to a certain data value. No effect when `xsizemode` not set to *pixel*. any info calc+arraydraw Sets the shape's starting x position. See `type` and `xsizemode` for more info. any info calc+arraydraw Sets the shape's end x position. See `type` and `xsizemode` for more info. enumerated paper info calc Sets the annotation's y coordinate axis. If set to an y axis id (e.g. *y* or *y2*), the `y` position refers to an y coordinate If set to *paper*, the `y` position refers to the distance from the bottom of the plotting area in normalized coordinates where *0* (*1*) corresponds to the bottom (top). enumerated scaled scaled info calc+arraydraw Sets the shapes's sizing mode along the y axis. If set to *scaled*, `y0`, `y1` and y coordinates within `path` refer to data values on the y axis or a fraction of the plot area's height (`yref` set to *paper*). If set to *pixel*, `yanchor` specifies the y position in terms of data or plot fraction but `y0`, `y1` and y coordinates within `path` are pixels relative to `yanchor`. This way, the shape can have a fixed height while maintaining a position relative to data or plot fraction. any info calc+arraydraw Only relevant in conjunction with `ysizemode` set to *pixel*. Specifies the anchor point on the y axis to which `y0`, `y1` and y coordinates within `path` are relative to. E.g. useful to attach a pixel sized shape to a certain data value. No effect when `ysizemode` not set to *pixel*. any info calc+arraydraw Sets the shape's starting y position. See `type` and `ysizemode` for more info. any info calc+arraydraw Sets the shape's end y position. See `type` and `ysizemode` for more info. string info calc+arraydraw For `type` *path* - a valid SVG path with the pixel values replaced by data values in `xsizemode`/`ysizemode` being *scaled* and taken unmodified as pixels relative to `xanchor` and `yanchor` in case of *pixel* size mode. There are a few restrictions / quirks only absolute instructions, not relative. So the allowed segments are: M, L, H, V, Q, C, T, S, and Z arcs (A) are not allowed because radius rx and ry are relative. In the future we could consider supporting relative commands, but we would have to decide on how to handle date and log axes. Note that even as is, Q and C Bezier paths that are smooth on linear axes may not be smooth on log, and vice versa. no chained "polybezier" commands - specify the segment type for each one. On category axes, values are numbers scaled to the serial numbers of categories because using the categories themselves there would be no way to describe fractional positions On data axes: because space and T are both normal components of path strings, we can't use either to separate date from time parts. Therefore we'll use underscore for this purpose: 2015-02-21_13:45:56.789 number 0 1 1 info arraydraw Sets the opacity of the shape. color style arraydraw TRUE Sets the line color. number 0 2 style calc+arraydraw TRUE Sets the line width (in px). string solid solid style arraydraw Sets the dash style of lines. Set to a dash type string (*solid*, *dot*, *dash*, *longdash*, *dashdot*, or *longdashdot*) or a dash length list in px (eg *5px,10px,2px,2px*). object calc+arraydraw color rgba(0,0,0,0) info arraydraw Sets the color filling the shape's interior. arraydraw string style none When used in a template, named items are created in the output figure in addition to any items the figure already has in this array. You can modify these items in the output figure by making your own item with `templateitemname` matching this `name` alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). Has no effect outside of a template. string info calc Used to refer to a named item in this array in the template. Named items from the template will be created even without a matching item in the input figure, but you can modify one by making an item with `templateitemname` matching its `name`, alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). If there is no template or no matching item, this item will be hidden unless you explicitly show it with `visible: true`. object object boolean info TRUE arraydraw Determines whether or not this image is visible. string info arraydraw Specifies the URL of the image to be used. The URL must be accessible from the domain where the plot code is run, and can be either relative or absolute. enumerated below above info arraydraw Specifies whether images are drawn below or above traces. When `xref` and `yref` are both set to `paper`, image is drawn below the entire plot area. number info 0 arraydraw Sets the image container size horizontally. The image will be sized based on the `position` value. When `xref` is set to `paper`, units are sized relative to the plot width. number info 0 arraydraw Sets the image container size vertically. The image will be sized based on the `position` value. When `yref` is set to `paper`, units are sized relative to the plot height. enumerated fill contain info arraydraw Specifies which dimension of the image to constrain. number info 0 1 1 arraydraw Sets the opacity of the image. any info 0 arraydraw Sets the image's x position. When `xref` is set to `paper`, units are sized relative to the plot height. See `xref` for more info any info 0 arraydraw Sets the image's y position. When `yref` is set to `paper`, units are sized relative to the plot height. See `yref` for more info enumerated left left info arraydraw Sets the anchor for the x position enumerated top top info arraydraw Sets the anchor for the y position. enumerated paper paper info arraydraw Sets the images's x coordinate axis. If set to a x axis id (e.g. *x* or *x2*), the `x` position refers to an x data coordinate If set to *paper*, the `x` position refers to the distance from the left of plot in normalized coordinates where *0* (*1*) corresponds to the left (right). enumerated paper paper info arraydraw Sets the images's y coordinate axis. If set to a y axis id (e.g. *y* or *y2*), the `y` position refers to a y data coordinate. If set to *paper*, the `y` position refers to the distance from the bottom of the plot in normalized coordinates where *0* (*1*) corresponds to the bottom (top). arraydraw string style none When used in a template, named items are created in the output figure in addition to any items the figure already has in this array. You can modify these items in the output figure by making your own item with `templateitemname` matching this `name` alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). Has no effect outside of a template. string info calc Used to refer to a named item in this array in the template. Named items from the template will be created even without a matching item in the input figure, but you can modify one by making an item with `templateitemname` matching its `name`, alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). If there is no template or no matching item, this item will be hidden unless you explicitly show it with `visible: true`. object object boolean info Determines whether or not the update menu is visible. arraydraw enumerated dropdown dropdown info Determines whether the buttons are accessible via a dropdown menu or whether the buttons are stacked horizontally or vertically arraydraw enumerated left down info Determines the direction in which the buttons are laid out, whether in a dropdown menu or a row/column of buttons. For `left` and `up`, the buttons will still appear in left-to-right or top-to-bottom order respectively. arraydraw integer info -1 0 Determines which button (by index starting from 0) is considered active. arraydraw boolean info TRUE Highlights active dropdown item or active button if true. arraydraw boolean info Determines whether or not this button is visible. arraydraw enumerated restyle restyle info Sets the Plotly method to be called on click. If the `skip` method is used, the API updatemenu will function as normal but will perform no API calls and will not bind automatically to state updates. This may be used to create a component interface and attach to updatemenu events manually via JavaScript. arraydraw info_array info TRUE any arraydraw Sets the arguments values to be passed to the Plotly method set in `method` on click. arraydraw string info Sets the text label to appear on the button. arraydraw boolean info TRUE When true, the API method is executed. When false, all other behaviors are the same and command execution is skipped. This may be useful when hooking into, for example, the `plotly_buttonclicked` method and executing the API command manually without losing the benefit of the updatemenu automatically binding to the state of the plot through the specification of `method` and `args`. arraydraw string style arraydraw When used in a template, named items are created in the output figure in addition to any items the figure already has in this array. You can modify these items in the output figure by making your own item with `templateitemname` matching this `name` alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). Has no effect outside of a template. string info arraydraw Used to refer to a named item in this array in the template. Named items from the template will be created even without a matching item in the input figure, but you can modify one by making an item with `templateitemname` matching its `name`, alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). If there is no template or no matching item, this item will be hidden unless you explicitly show it with `visible: true`. arraydraw object object number -2 3 -0.05 style Sets the x position (in normalized coordinates) of the update menu. arraydraw enumerated auto right info Sets the update menu's horizontal position anchor. This anchor binds the `x` position to the *left*, *center* or *right* of the range selector. arraydraw number -2 3 1 style Sets the y position (in normalized coordinates) of the update menu. arraydraw enumerated auto top info Sets the update menu's vertical position anchor This anchor binds the `y` position to the *top*, *middle* or *bottom* of the range selector. arraydraw number 0 style arraydraw The amount of padding (in px) along the top of the component. number 0 style arraydraw The amount of padding (in px) on the right side of the component. number 0 style arraydraw The amount of padding (in px) along the bottom of the component. number 0 style arraydraw The amount of padding (in px) on the left side of the component. arraydraw Sets the padding around the buttons or dropdown menu. object string style TRUE TRUE HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*. arraydraw number style 1 arraydraw color style arraydraw Sets the font of the update menu button text. arraydraw object color style Sets the background color of the update menu buttons. arraydraw color #BEC8D9 style Sets the color of the border enclosing the update menu. arraydraw number 0 1 style arraydraw Sets the width (in px) of the border enclosing the update menu. string style arraydraw When used in a template, named items are created in the output figure in addition to any items the figure already has in this array. You can modify these items in the output figure by making your own item with `templateitemname` matching this `name` alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). Has no effect outside of a template. string info arraydraw Used to refer to a named item in this array in the template. Named items from the template will be created even without a matching item in the input figure, but you can modify one by making an item with `templateitemname` matching its `name`, alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). If there is no template or no matching item, this item will be hidden unless you explicitly show it with `visible: true`. arraydraw object object boolean info TRUE Determines whether or not the slider is visible. arraydraw number info 0 0 Determines which button (by index starting from 0) is considered active. arraydraw boolean info TRUE Determines whether or not this step is included in the slider. arraydraw enumerated restyle restyle info Sets the Plotly method to be called when the slider value is changed. This may be used to create a component interface and attach to slider events manually via JavaScript. arraydraw info_array info TRUE any arraydraw Sets the arguments values to be passed to the Plotly method set in `method` on slide. arraydraw string info Sets the text label to appear on the slider arraydraw string info Sets the value of the slider step, used to refer to the step programatically. Defaults to the slider label if not provided. arraydraw boolean info TRUE When true, the API method is executed. When false, all other behaviors are the same and command execution is skipped. If there is no template or no matching item, this item will be hidden unless you explicitly show it with `visible: true`. arraydraw object object enumerated fraction info fraction Determines whether this slider length is set in units of plot *fraction* or in *pixels. Use `len` to set the value. arraydraw number 0 1 style Sets the length of the slider This measure excludes the padding of both ends. That is, the slider's length is this length minus the padding on both ends. arraydraw number -2 3 0 style Sets the x position (in normalized coordinates) of the slider. arraydraw number 20 style arraydraw The amount of padding (in px) along the top of the component. number 0 style arraydraw The amount of padding (in px) on the right side of the component. number 0 style arraydraw The amount of padding (in px) along the bottom of the component. number 0 style arraydraw The amount of padding (in px) on the left side of the component. arraydraw Set the padding of the slider component along each side. object enumerated auto left info Sets the slider's horizontal position anchor. The plotly service (at https://plot.ly or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported.
